original: de'i phyir 'jug pa'i yul la ltos nas kyang khyad par gyi yul can ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa'i yul la ltos nas kyang khyad par gyi yul can ma yin nam /
translated: Therefore, even in relation to the object of engagement, it is not a specific object-possessor.üîΩSince inference is common to other causes, it is taught to be that, and in relation to that, it is also considered to be a general object-possessor.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni rgyu gzhan dang thun mong bas de ston par byed cing de las ltos nas kyang spyi'i yul can yin no snyam du sems pa la mngon sum gyi bya ba mi dpyad par rnam par rtog pa tsam la dpyod par byed pa ni gnyi
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni rgyu gzhan dang thun mong bas de ston par byed cing de las ltos nas kyang spyi'i yul can yin no snyam du sems pa la mngon sum gyi bya ba mi dpyad par rnam par rtog pa tsam la dpyod par byed pa ni gnyi
translated: The activity of direct perception is not analyzed, but the mere conceptualization is analyzed.

original: ga yang spyi'i yul du mtshungs so //
analyzed: ga yang spyi'i yul du mtshungs so //
translated: Both are similar in being general objects.

original: skad cig ma'i mngon sum ltos pa yin na yang rtags kyi mngon sum la ltos nas khyad par mtshungs pa yin te /üîΩskad cig ma gang gzung ba de'i rgyun bzhin du 'bras bu gang gzung ba de'i rgyun la nges par byed pa yang yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i mngon sum ltos pa yin na yang rtags kyi mngon sum la ltos nas khyad par mtshungs pa yin te / skad cig ma gang gzung ba de'i rgyun bzhin du 'bras bu gang gzung ba de'i rgyun la nges par byed pa yang yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Even if momentary direct perception is dependent, it is similar to the difference in dependence on inferential direct perception.

original: de dang 'brel pa gzung ba ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa gzung ba ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Just as the continuum of that which is grasped is ascertained, the continuum of the result of that which is grasped is also ascertained. This is taught by ‚ÄúIf that which is related to it is grasped‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that, ‚Äúthat‚Äù is that which will arise.

original: 'brel pa can zhes bya ba ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa can zhes bya ba ni dang po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is related‚Äù is the first.

original: rjes su dpag pa la bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa can gyi rtags kyi rtogs pa mngon sum gyi rjes la 'byung ba la rgyu ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa can gyi rtags kyi rtogs pa mngon sum gyi rjes la 'byung ba la rgyu ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la'o //
translated: In inference, the cognition of the reason that is related to the probandum occurs after the perception. The cause is for that which is to occur.

original: de'i rigs nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul yin no //
analyzed: de'i rigs nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul yin no //
translated: Its type is the object of perception.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: With respect to what?

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ni rjes su dpag par zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ni rjes su dpag par zhes sbyar ro //
translated: With respect to the object of inference, inference is applied.

original: der ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa la'o //
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa la'o //
translated: There means in inference.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las byung ba'i rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las byung ba'i rtogs pa la'o //
translated: This means the cognition that arises from perception.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la'o //
translated: Here means in perception.

original: 'di nyid la ni gsal ba gcig la'o zhes bya ba mi rigs par bstan pa ni ma yin te /üîΩbyung ba dang @39a * //
analyzed: 'di nyid la ni gsal ba gcig la'o zhes bya ba mi rigs par bstan pa ni ma yin te / byung ba dang @39a * //
translated: This itself means in one manifestation. It is not taught that it is not tenable.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba rgyun gzhan las log pa yang spyi kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba rgyun gzhan las log pa yang spyi kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Arisen and arising are only universals that are distinguished from other continua. This is the meaning.

original: thob par bya ba ni 'jug par bya ba ste thob par bya ba'i yul nyid med na zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba ste 'khrul pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: thob par bya ba ni 'jug par bya ba ste thob par bya ba'i yul nyid med na zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba ste 'khrul pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: That which is to be obtained is that which is to be engaged, and if there is no object to be obtained, then it is present.

original: mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i 'od la ni nor bur shes pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i 'od la ni nor bur shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne sees‚Äù means that with respect to the light of a jewel, there is the cognition of the jewel.

original: phyi ma rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe latter‚Äù means that because of the establishment of the one, there is the establishment of the other.

original: shes pa'i skad cig ma dang po kho nas bzung zhing khongs su gtogs pa'i nges pa bas nges pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pa'i skad cig ma dang po kho nas bzung zhing khongs su gtogs pa'i nges pa bas nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that the first moment of cognition apprehends and includes the object, and that the subsequent cognitions are certain with respect to that?üîΩIf it is not certain with respect to that, then it is not reasonable to analyze the object.

original: der ma nges na de'i yul du dpyod pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la the tshom za na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: der ma nges na de'i yul du dpyod pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la the tshom za na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If one doubts, then one should say that the object is not ascertained.

original: nges pa'i mthar thug pa'i bya ba la tshad ma rdzogs na the tshom ma yin te thams cad la de ltar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i mthar thug pa'i bya ba la tshad ma rdzogs na the tshom ma yin te thams cad la de ltar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the activity of ascertaining is not complete, then it is not a doubt, because it would follow that everything would be like that.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not a valid cognition.

original: the tshom za bas gnod pa'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom za bas gnod pa'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity is impaired by doubt.üîΩIf that is so,

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i snga rol du 'jug pa po de med pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i snga rol du 'jug pa po de med pa'o //
translated: the one who engages is not prior to engagement.

original: the tshom za ba'i yul can gyi shes pa nyid tshad ma ma yin pa las 'jug pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i yul can gyi shes pa nyid tshad ma ma yin pa las 'jug pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The very cognition that has doubt for its object is not a valid cognition, and it is taught that engagement is just from that.üîΩHaving seen,

original: re zhig mthong ste zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa'i tshad ma nyid las mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: re zhig mthong ste zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa'i tshad ma nyid las mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that it is not reasonable from a valid cognition that is not ascertained.

original: gsal ba'i mngon sum la ni mi gsal ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhing mi gsal ba'i rjes su dpag pa la ni 'jug pa'i yul gsal ba ste /
analyzed: gsal ba'i mngon sum la ni mi gsal ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhing mi gsal ba'i rjes su dpag pa la ni 'jug pa'i yul gsal ba ste /
translated: In the case of a clear perception, the unclear arises, and in the case of an unclear inference, the clear object of engagement.

original: brtags pa ni mi gsal ba yin la cig shos ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa ni mi gsal ba yin la cig shos ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: The imagined is unclear, and the other is clear.

original: gsal ba yang sgro 'dogs par byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba yang sgro 'dogs par byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: The clear also superimposes, and it is an inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa gzhan bzhin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan bzhin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it is like another inference.

original: yang na rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, in another way.

original: de ni mngon sum gang yin no zhe na gtso bor gyur pas ni bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gang yin no zhe na gtso bor gyur pas ni bya ba smos te /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is that direct perception?‚Äù the primary one is mentioned.

original: shin tu goms pas rtog pa med pa yin na khyad par du 'jug par brjod do //
analyzed: shin tu goms pas rtog pa med pa yin na khyad par du 'jug par brjod do //
translated: If it is very familiar, it is nonconceptual, and it is said to engage specifically.

original: rnam par rtog pa des sbyor ba can gyis kyang ni 'brel pa can gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa des sbyor ba can gyis kyang ni 'brel pa can gyis kyang ngo //
translated: Even though it is a conceptual engagement, it is a connection.

original: de med na yang zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med na yang ngo //
analyzed: de med na yang zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med na yang ngo //
translated: Even though it does not exist means even though it is nonconceptual.

original: 'jug par byed pa'i mngon sum cha gang la nges pa skyed par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar mtshon par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i mngon sum cha gang la nges pa skyed par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar mtshon par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the aspect of the engaging direct perception that generates ascertainment is indicated by the conceptual thought?

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni thams cad kyi cha la gsal ba'i bya ba can yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni thams cad kyi cha la gsal ba'i bya ba can yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation that direct perception is clear with regard to all aspects is:

original: @39b rjes 'gro ldog pa dag las ni //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @39b rjes 'gro ldog pa dag las ni // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From the forward and reverse order.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i 'jug pa ni mngon sum gyis 'jug pa la nus pa yod do zhes rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i 'jug pa ni mngon sum gyis 'jug pa la nus pa yod do zhes rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The engagement of conceptual thought is said to have the power to engage direct perception.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tha snyad sgrub par byed pas phan ma thogs pa la dran pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rtog pa dang / nges pa rjod par byed pa la sogs pa'i dran pa ni ma mtshon pa'i yul la mi 'byung ba ni de nyid kyi phyir dran pa bzhin du tha snyad du yang 'gyur ba'i phyir rtog pa'i nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tha snyad sgrub par byed pas phan ma thogs pa la dran pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rtog pa dang / nges pa rjod par byed pa la sogs pa'i dran pa ni ma mtshon pa'i yul la mi 'byung ba ni de nyid kyi phyir dran pa bzhin du tha snyad du yang 'gyur ba'i phyir rtog pa'i nus pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means that memory that precedes the thought that does not help to establish a convention and memory that expresses ascertainment and so on do not occur with respect to an object that is not indicated. For that very reason, it is not the capacity of thought to be like memory, even conventionally.

original: gang ga phyir rang nyid mtshon pa la ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang don med do //
analyzed: gang ga phyir rang nyid mtshon pa la ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang don med do //
translated: Because it is not itself indicated, it is pointless to have a reason of nature.

original: de'i phyir rang nyid mtshon pa ma yin pa la ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sam gzhan gyis kyang rung tha snyad kyi phyir nges par byed la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid mtshon pa ma yin pa la ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sam gzhan gyis kyang rung tha snyad kyi phyir nges par byed la /
translated: Therefore, with respect to that which is not itself indicated, a reason of nature or another is ascertained for the sake of a convention.

original: der nges kyang de'i don byed pa la nges pa med pa'i phyir de'i nges pa ni rang nyid kyang rtags kho na las yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: der nges kyang de'i don byed pa la nges pa med pa'i phyir de'i nges pa ni rang nyid kyang rtags kho na las yin pas skyon med do //
translated: Even though it is ascertained there, because there is no ascertainment of its functioning, that ascertainment is only from a sign itself. Therefore there is no fault.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la 'jug par byed pa nyid yin yang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag la mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la 'jug par byed pa nyid yin yang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag la mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it engages objects that are hidden‚Äù means that it is similar to perception and inference.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i dbye bas zhes bya ba ni gzung bya'i rnam pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i dbye bas zhes bya ba ni gzung bya'i rnam pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the division of the clear and unclear‚Äù means by the division of the aspect of the object that is grasped.

original: de'i phyir / bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
translated: Therefore, it is well said:

original: 'khrul pa la yang tshad ma nyid //üîΩces bya ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩdes na gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa la yang tshad ma nyid // ces bya ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin par bstan pa ni / des na gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it is mistaken, it is valid cognition,üîΩbecause it is nondeceptive with regard to what is thought.‚Äù

original: tshad ma nyid yin yang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid 'khrul pa nyid dang 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid yin yang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid 'khrul pa nyid dang 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúTherefore, it is valid cognition even though it is mistaken‚Äù shows that there is no contradiction between being valid cognition and being mistaken.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa ste rjes su dpag pa ni de kho na nyid rig par byed pa po rnams la 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa ste rjes su dpag pa ni de kho na nyid rig par byed pa po rnams la 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught: Inference is mistaken for those who know reality,

original: tha snyad pa rnams la ni mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams la ni mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: but it is not valid cognition for them, because it is deceptive with regard to the conventional.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa ni 'khrul pa dang mi slu ba can yang yin pa tha snyad pa rnams kho na la'o zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa ni 'khrul pa dang mi slu ba can yang yin pa tha snyad pa rnams kho na la'o zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: The cognition of the gem in the light of the gem is both erroneous and non-deceptive, only for the conventional. This is the distinction.

original: phan tshun khyad par med mod kyi zhes bya ba ni gseb kyi bu ga'i phyogs la gnyi ga la yang nor bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun khyad par med mod kyi zhes bya ba ni gseb kyi bu ga'i phyogs la gnyi ga la yang nor bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there is no difference between them, in the case of the hole in the wall, both are without the gem.

original: don ji lta ba ma yin pa'i shes pa yang gnod par byed pa 'byung ba med na 'jug par byed pa mthong ngo zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don ji lta ba ma yin pa'i shes pa yang gnod par byed pa 'byung ba med na 'jug par byed pa mthong ngo zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is seen that a cognition that does not correspond to the object also occurs when there is no occurrence of a sublating cognition. This is shown by

original: ma mthong yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even when it is not seen.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i 'khrul pa las cig shos la khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i 'khrul pa las cig shos la khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The absence of difference in the other case, i.e., in the case of inference, from an erroneous cognition, is shown by

original: 'brel pa'i don las zhes bya ba ste tshad ma skye ba'i ste mngon sum gyi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i don las zhes bya ba ste tshad ma skye ba'i ste mngon sum gyi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The object of the relation. The reason for the arising of the valid cognition is the arising of perception.üîΩThat is shown by

original: de bstan pa ni mngon sum gyi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gang yin pa @40a * //üîΩde ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni mngon sum gyi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gang yin pa @40a * //üîΩde ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: That is the reason for the arising of perception.

original: de yang de yin la rjes su dpog pa'i shes pa yang yin pa ni 'bru mang po pa'i bsdu ba dang / bsgrub bya la drug pa'i bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de yang de yin la rjes su dpog pa'i shes pa yang yin pa ni 'bru mang po pa'i bsdu ba dang / bsgrub bya la drug pa'i bsdu ba ste /
translated: That is inference and it is a consciousness is a dvandva compound, and the object of the verb is in a tatpurusa compound with the suffix -tva.

original: mngon sum gyi rjes su dpag pa bzhin du rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rjes su dpag pa bzhin du rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as perception is valid knowledge, so too inference is valid knowledge.

original: bsgrub bya'i bshad pa ni rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i bshad pa ni rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the object of the verb is ‚Äúinference.‚Äù

original: dpe ni mngon sum yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe ni mngon sum yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is ‚Äúperception.‚Äù

original: gal te mngon sum gyis sngon por mthong ba la /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis sngon por mthong ba la /
translated: If one sees blue with perception,

original: rjes su dpag pa ji ltar dpe yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ji ltar dpe yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: how can inference be an example?

original: rjes dpag med par zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshig ste /
analyzed: rjes dpag med par zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshig ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout inference‚Äù is a verbal action.

original: sngon po mthong ba ni des pa yod na ma goms pa'i ched du 'jug par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: sngon po mthong ba ni des pa yod na ma goms pa'i ched du 'jug par byed pa yin la /
translated: Seeing blue is the cause of engaging in the activity of seeking it if it exists and avoiding it if it does not exist.

original: nges pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum tshad mar byed na rjes su dpag par thob par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum tshad mar byed na rjes su dpag par thob par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since ascertainment is inference, if perception is valid knowledge, then inference would also be valid knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma nyid kyi rgyu mtshan mi slu ba'i ngo bo'i mngon sum yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma nyid kyi rgyu mtshan mi slu ba'i ngo bo'i mngon sum yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason why inference is a valid cognition is because it is non-deceptive in nature, as is direct perception.

original: de bzhin rjes su dpag ces bya ba ni byed pa po'i tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin rjes su dpag ces bya ba ni byed pa po'i tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúinference‚Äù is in the instrumental case.

original: la lar dang por zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag par yang ngo //
analyzed: la lar dang por zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag par yang ngo //
translated: In some cases, it is direct perception that comes first, and in some cases, it is inference that comes first.

original: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin la /
translated: Direct perception is not necessarily preceded by inference,üîΩand inference is not necessarily preceded by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i khyad par yod pa ji ltar khyad par med pa yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i khyad par yod pa ji ltar khyad par med pa yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: How can there be no difference between them?

original: rjes dpag las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes dpag las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúinference‚Äù is in the ablative case.

original: 'das ma thag pa'i tshig rkad bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i tshig rkad bshad pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúimmediately preceding‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: 'on te 'gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'gyur na yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if‚Äù refers to the previous statement.

original: rjes su dpag pa med pa yang zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshig go //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med pa yang zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout inference‚Äù is in the ablative case.

original: gal te na mngon sum skye ba la ni rjes su dpag ba la mi ltos pa tha snyad du ni ltos pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te na mngon sum skye ba la ni rjes su dpag ba la mi ltos pa tha snyad du ni ltos pa kho na yin te /
translated: If it does, then the arising of direct perception does not depend on inference. But conventionally, it does depend on it.

original: gzhan du na tshad ma nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩrjes dpag med par mngon sum ni //
analyzed: gzhan du na tshad ma nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni / rjes dpag med par mngon sum ni //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be suitable to be a valid cognition.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is taught by the line:üîΩWithout inference, there is no direct perception.

original: sgrub par byed pa rjes su dpag pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa rjes su dpag pa yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The proof is the inference.

original: bden te tha snyad du ni mngon sum rjes su dpag pa la ltos la rjes su dpag pa ni de la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bden te tha snyad du ni mngon sum rjes su dpag pa la ltos la rjes su dpag pa ni de la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: It is true that conventionally, direct perception depends on inference, but inference does not depend on it.üîΩBecause it is a mere designation that is established by itself.

original: rang nyid nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyis tha snyad 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rang nyid nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyis tha snyad 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that,

original: 'on te yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'gyur na /
translated: then the line is:

original: mngon sum ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout inference, there is no direct perception.‚Äù

original: sngar nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni dran pa yin la ji ltar nyams su myong ba kho na @40b dngos po'i de ltar ba nyid rnam par gzhag pa mi byed do //
analyzed: sngar nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni dran pa yin la ji ltar nyams su myong ba kho na @40b dngos po'i de ltar ba nyid rnam par gzhag pa mi byed do //
translated: Memory is an inference that arises from the latent impressions of previous experience. It does not establish the way things really are, just as it was experienced.

original: mngon sum ni phyogs kyi chos nges pa'i yul can gang dran pa'i yul la khyab par byed pa ste ston pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni phyogs kyi chos nges pa'i yul can gang dran pa'i yul la khyab par byed pa ste ston pa yin no //
translated: Direct perception is the subject that has a determined object that is pervaded by the object of memory. It is the teacher.

original: yul can gzhan gyis de'i yul can la khyab pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul can gzhan gyis de'i yul can la khyab pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The subject of another [cognition] does not pervade the subject of that [cognition].

original: de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is not observed in that way, it is taught:

original: mngon sum min na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum min na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not direct perception...

original: dran pa ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba kho na yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba kho na yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Memory is just as it was experienced, it is taught:

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By inference...

original: dran pa ni yul dang dus la sogs pas thag ring ba'i yul can nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa ni yul dang dus la sogs pas thag ring ba'i yul can nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: Memory is taught to have an object that is distant in terms of place, time, and so on:

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By a wall, and so on...

original: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba ni khyab par bya ba'i mngon sum gyi bya ba las 'byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa dran pa tsam nyid kyis ma nges pa'i yul la sogs pa'i yul can nyid yin par the tshom za ba nyid do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba ni khyab par bya ba'i mngon sum gyi bya ba las 'byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa dran pa tsam nyid kyis ma nges pa'i yul la sogs pa'i yul can nyid yin par the tshom za ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúBy direct perception‚Äù means that the object of memory, which is the mere recollection of the activity of the direct perception of the pervaded, is uncertain with regard to the object, such as the object of the pervasion.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang bral ba'i nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa la yul la phyin ci log pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang bral ba'i nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa la yul la phyin ci log pa'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of the light of the jewel, which is devoid of inference, is mistaken with regard to the object.

original: nges pa'i yul yongs su mi 'dzin pa ni gnyi ga la yang mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa'i yul yongs su mi 'dzin pa ni gnyi ga la yang mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the non-apprehension of the ascertained object is the same for both is:

original: nor bu'i 'od la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of the light of the jewel.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba yul nges pa can yin na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yul nges pa can yin na /
translated: If experience has a definite object,

original: dran pa yul nges pa can yin te /
analyzed: dran pa yul nges pa can yin te /
translated: memory would have a definite object.

original: yul nges pa la sogs pa'i khyab pa nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul nges pa la sogs pa'i khyab pa nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the experience of the pervasion of definiteness, etc. is not so.

original: rim gyis nges par mthong ba can ni the tshom yin la gcig med pa nges par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni the tshom ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rim gyis nges par mthong ba can ni the tshom yin la gcig med pa nges par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni the tshom ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who sees gradually is one who doubts, and the thought that one of the two is ascertained is doubt.

original: rim gyis sam rim gyis ma yin par yang rung ste /
analyzed: rim gyis sam rim gyis ma yin par yang rung ste /
translated: Whether gradually or not,

original: the tshom ni nges par mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom ni nges par mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: doubt is not a seeing of ascertainment.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: nges par gzung ba mi byed par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba mi byed par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that it does not ascertain is

original: gnyi ga'i cha la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: both parts.

original: de'i cha gnyi ga nges par 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i cha gnyi ga nges par 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not ascertain both parts.

original: cha phyed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cha phyed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The absence of a partial part

original: gal te yang gzhan las log par nges pa yin yang /
analyzed: gal te yang gzhan las log par nges pa yin yang /
translated: means that even if it is ascertained as the opposite of another,

original: de gnyi ga las gcig nges par 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde lta yin yang mngon sum gzhan kho na yul nges par byed pas tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga las gcig nges par 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de lta yin yang mngon sum gzhan kho na yul nges par byed pas tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pas ni ma yin te /
translated: it does not ascertain one of the two. This is the meaning.

original: yul nye bar ma bstan pas zhig pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: yul nye bar ma bstan pas zhig pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Even though that is so, direct perception is a valid knowledge that ascertains the object because it is another. Inference is not because the object is not revealed.üîΩThe thought that this is so isüîΩthe response to that.

original: des na cha phyed pa med pa de zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des na cha phyed pa med pa de zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúwithout a part.‚Äù

original: de dag gi dbye ba yin na bden mod kyi tshad ma gcig gi bya ba la phral ba'i dbye ba yin pas dbye ba las byung @41a * //
analyzed: de dag gi dbye ba yin na bden mod kyi tshad ma gcig gi bya ba la phral ba'i dbye ba yin pas dbye ba las byung @41a * //
translated: If it is a division of those, it is certainly true. However, since it is a division of the separation of the activity of a single valid cognition, it is not a fault that arises from a division.

original: ba'i skyon ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i skyon ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa phyin ci log pa yang rjes su dpag pa dang lhan cig bya ba gcig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa phyin ci log pa yang rjes su dpag pa dang lhan cig bya ba gcig pa yin gyi /
translated: The cognition of the gem with respect to the light of the gem is also a misconception, but it is simultaneous with the inference.

original: bya ba tha dad pa'i skyon gyis gos pa ma yin par bstan pa ni phyin ci log kyang zhes bya ba dang / sel ba yin zhes bya ba dang sbyar te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i stobs kyis snga rol nyid ni the tshom dang phyin ci log pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba tha dad pa'i skyon gyis gos pa ma yin par bstan pa ni phyin ci log kyang zhes bya ba dang / sel ba yin zhes bya ba dang sbyar te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i stobs kyis snga rol nyid ni the tshom dang phyin ci log pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point of the text is that it is not tainted by the fault of having a different activity.üîΩThe cognition of the gem with respect to the light of the gem is not a valid cognition.üîΩThis is the point.

original: de lta na yang nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba sel ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba sel ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though it is like that, it is said that the cognition of the gem with respect to the light of the gem is not a valid cognition.üîΩThis is the point of the text.

original: rjes su dpag pa gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom another inference‚Äù means from another inference.

original: de rjes su dpag pa'o zhes log par rtogs pas zer ba ni /
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pa'o zhes log par rtogs pas zer ba ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat is an inference‚Äù is a mistaken understanding.

original: de tshang ma gang yin zhes pa'o //üîΩrang gi 'dod pa bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de tshang ma gang yin zhes pa'o // rang gi 'dod pa bstan pa ni //
translated: What is that?

original: de ni mngon sum tshad ma nyid //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum tshad ma nyid // ces bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is direct perception itself‚Äù shows our own position.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúIt is direct perception itself‚Äù shows our own position.

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i khyad par ni bsams pa'i cha la 'khrul pa bsal ba'i ched du yin gyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i khyad par ni bsams pa'i cha la 'khrul pa bsal ba'i ched du yin gyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The qualification ‚Äúwithout error‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding error in the part of the object that is intended, but not for the purpose of excluding error in all respects.

original: mngon sum thams cad kho na nges par mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum thams cad kho na nges par mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all direct perception is ascertained in the same way,

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: it is not the case that all direct perception is nonerroneous in all respects.

original: mi slu bas na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi slu bas na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBecause it is nondeceptive‚Äù shows this.

original: bsams pa'i cha la 'khrul pa med pas cha gzhan thams cad 'khrul pa yin par bstan pa ni 'khrul dang mi 'khrul zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsams pa'i cha la 'khrul pa med pas cha gzhan thams cad 'khrul pa yin par bstan pa ni 'khrul dang mi 'khrul zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is erroneous and nonerroneous‚Äù shows that because it is nonerroneous in the part of the object that is intended, it is erroneous in all other parts.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa spyi'i mtshan nyid las re zhig tshad ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa spyi'i mtshan nyid las re zhig tshad ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The light of the gem is valid cognition, because it is non-deceptive.

original: tshad ma ni mi slu ba can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ni mi slu ba can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The definition of valid cognition is that which is non-deceptive.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ma 'khrul pa nyid mi slu ba las gzhan nyid yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ma 'khrul pa nyid mi slu ba las gzhan nyid yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The reason for that is non-erroneous. Non-deceptive is different from non-erroneous.

original: gal te mi slu pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mi slu pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one says non-deceptive is also...

original: don ji lta ba nyid dang ma 'khrul pa dang mi slu ba rnams don gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don ji lta ba nyid dang ma 'khrul pa dang mi slu ba rnams don gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of just as it is, non-erroneous, and non-deceptive are not different.

original: yul dang dus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is because of the object and time.

original: de skad brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is because of the expression. Because of the expression of non-deceptive.

original: gal te de lta na rang gi phyogs kyi rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rang gi phyogs kyi rtsod pa ste /
translated: If it is like that, then there is an objection from one's own side.

original: 'khrul pa dad ma 'khrul pa nyid du kho nas de dag gi dbye ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dad ma 'khrul pa nyid du kho nas de dag gi dbye ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The division of those is only by error and non-error, not otherwise. This is the meaning.

original: ma 'khrul pa'i don ni mi slu ba'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa'i don ni mi slu ba'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of non-erroneous is the meaning of non-deceptive.

original: rtog pa dang cig shos nyid du de las khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa dang cig shos nyid du de las khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The non-difference of the conceptual and non-conceptual in regard to that is taught:

original: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because of the difference in appearance.üîΩThe non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.üîΩThe non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.üîΩThe non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.

original: ma 'khrul @41b pa nyid ni 'dod pa la mi slu ba can nyid du gnyi ga la yang khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ma 'khrul @41b pa nyid ni 'dod pa la mi slu ba can nyid du gnyi ga la yang khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:

original: tshad ma'i shes pa thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i shes pa thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: all valid cognitions.üîΩThe non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.üîΩThe non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.üîΩThe non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.üîΩThe non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.

original: de kho na nyid rig pa po'i rnam par 'khrul pa yang gnyi ga la yang 'khrul pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rig pa po'i rnam par 'khrul pa yang gnyi ga la yang 'khrul pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.

original: 'khrul pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: all valid cognitions.üîΩThe non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.üîΩThe non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.

original: mi slu ba can gyi yang dag pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs su mi slu ba'i don can gyi ma 'khrul pa smos pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba yang gang smras pa /
analyzed: mi slu ba can gyi yang dag pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs su mi slu ba'i don can gyi ma 'khrul pa smos pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba yang gang smras pa /
translated: The non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i.e., the non-deceptive, is taught:üîΩall valid cognitions.

original: de yang bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyi sdud par byed pa'i dag gi skyon ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyi sdud par byed pa'i dag gi skyon ma yin no //
translated: The non-difference of both in regard to the non-erroneous, i

original: gzhan du na rtogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyang de la shes pa'i snang ba gang yin zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs rtog pa med pa can las phyin ci log tu bshad par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du na rtogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyang de la shes pa'i snang ba gang yin zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs rtog pa med pa can las phyin ci log tu bshad par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya pa'i don to //
translated: Otherwise, the very absence of realization would have to be explained as a case of error in regard to the cognition that is the appearance of that.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i mngon sum la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i mngon sum la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to another‚Äù refers to the perception of blue, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the cognition of blue, etc.

original: yul gang la mthong ba'i yul de kho na rjes su dpag pa yin la /
analyzed: yul gang la mthong ba'i yul de kho na rjes su dpag pa yin la /
translated: The object of inference is just the object that is seen.

original: de'i phyir yul tha mi dad par rlom pa'i mngon sum pa yin gyi nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul tha mi dad par rlom pa'i mngon sum pa yin gyi nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the perception that is assumed to have a nondifferent object, not the cognition of the jewel in regard to the light of the jewel.

original: yul bzhin du yul gyi dbye bas tshad ma gzhan nyid du mngon par rlom pa'i phyir zhes zer ba ni nor bur shes pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul bzhin du yul gyi dbye bas tshad ma gzhan nyid du mngon par rlom pa'i phyir zhes zer ba ni nor bur shes pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is assumed that the valid cognition is different due to the difference in the object, as in the case of the object‚Äù means that the cognition of the jewel is in regard to the light of the jewel.

original: mngon sum thams cad la ni nges pa 'dren pa'i bya ba can rang gi yul las 'das nas de'i yul du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni don dam du ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum thams cad la ni nges pa 'dren pa'i bya ba can rang gi yul las 'das nas de'i yul du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni don dam du ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: All direct perception has the function of producing ascertainment, and it becomes the object of that after passing beyond its own object. This is taught by ‚Äúultimately.

original: thams cad 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang 'dus pa kho na yin te /üîΩre re ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa po mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang 'dus pa kho na yin te / re re ni ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚Äù Both direct perception and inference are included in the one who reveals the object of engagement of all.

original: de ni gnyi ga tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga tshad ma nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught that each is not the other by ‚Äúthat is valid cognition in both cases.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de nyid mngon sum ma ma zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mngon sum ma ma zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is direct perception‚Äù is the assertion of the author.

original: yang na rjes dpag nyid ces bya ba ni sh'akya blo'i'o //
analyzed: yang na rjes dpag nyid ces bya ba ni sh'akya blo'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr it is inference‚Äù is the assertion of ≈öƒÅkyamati.

original: 'od la nor bu'i shes pa ni /üîΩgzhan snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i snang ba tsam ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'od la nor bu'i shes pa ni / gzhan snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i snang ba tsam ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The cognition of a jewel in light

original: nor bu snang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nor bu snang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is not merely an appearance that is indistinguishable from the appearance of something else. This is taught by ‚Äúthe cognition of a jewel in light.üîΩ‚Äù

original: snang ba la khyad par med pa la ji ltar yul gzhan la yul de kho na zhes gzhan du ji ltar yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: snang ba la khyad par med pa la ji ltar yul gzhan la yul de kho na zhes gzhan du ji ltar yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: How can there be a difference in the object when there is no difference in the appearance? How can it be different?

original: de la la lar zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'khrul pa nyid du @42a * //
analyzed: de la la lar zhes bya ba ste / 'khrul pa nyid du @42a * //
translated: In this regard, in some cases means

original: yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: yang khyad par med do //
translated: that there is no difference in error.

original: spyi'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad par byas pa la'o //
analyzed: spyi'i rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad par byas pa la'o //
translated: The so-called inference of the general is in relation to what is differentiated.

original: ji ltar de kho na nyid rig pa po'i bsam pas rjes su dpag pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de kho na nyid rig pa po'i bsam pas rjes su dpag pa ni /
translated: Just as the inference of the one who knows reality is

original: bdag nyid kyi rnam pa la phyi rol du mngon par zhen pas 'khrul pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rnam pa la phyi rol du mngon par zhen pas 'khrul pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: an error due to the conception of external aspects in one's own form,

original: mngon sum rnam pa la mngon par zhen par mi byed do snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: mngon sum rnam pa la mngon par zhen par mi byed do snyam du sems pa la /
translated: so too one should not conceive of the aspects of direct perception.üîΩThe thought is, The mind that is without conception apprehends the object by the potency of the object, but it is not direct perception that takes as its object something else that is made present.

original: gang la don gyi nus pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la don gyi nus pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement The mind that is without conception apprehends the object by the potency of the object is taught by In that case....üîΩThe thought is, The mind that is without conception apprehends the object by the potency of the object, but it is not direct perception that takes as its object something else that is made present.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i blo ni don gyis nus pas don 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum yin gyi ngo bo gzhan mdun du byas pa ma yin la don yang bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i don du blo la bdag nyid gzhan gyis bar du chod par byed paüîΩzhes bya ba bstan pa ni /üîΩde lta zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i blo ni don gyis nus pas don 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum yin gyi ngo bo gzhan mdun du byas pa ma yin la don yang bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i don du blo la bdag nyid gzhan gyis bar du chod par byed paüîΩzhes bya ba bstan pa ni /üîΩde lta zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement The mind that is without conception apprehends the object by the potency of the object is taught by In that case....

original: rang dbang can ni bar du mchod pa can no //
analyzed: rang dbang can ni bar du mchod pa can no //
translated: The independent is the one who worships in the middle.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum pa'o //
translated: The real is the direct perceiver.

original: rtogs par bya ba gang la blo'am ma don ni ngo bo gzhan nye bar byed pa lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba gang la blo'am ma don ni ngo bo gzhan nye bar byed pa lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The object to be understood is the hidden, because the meaning of the word is the bringing forth of another entity.

original: de las gzhan dngos zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde'i rnam pa nyid kyis skye ba las tha dad pa'i blo'i bya ba'am /
analyzed: de las gzhan dngos zhes bya ba'o // de'i rnam pa nyid kyis skye ba las tha dad pa'i blo'i bya ba'am /
translated: The other entity is the hidden.üîΩThe activity of the mind that arises in the aspect of that is not the bringing forth of another entity.

original: ngo bo gzhan mdun du byas pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan mdun du byas pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The activity of the mind that arises in the aspect of that is not the bringing forth of another entity.

original: de'i rnam pa can du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who has that aspect is the direct perceiver.

original: de dag gnyi ga gzhan la yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga gzhan la yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The one who has both is the independent.

original: gang la mngon mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la mngon mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who has neither is the real.üîΩThe Buddhists say that the hidden is not accepted because there is no activity of the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i bya ba med pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur ba thob pa de ni sangs rgyas pa rnams mi 'dod pa yin no zhes zer ba ni de ltar ni dbang po'i bya ba med pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid du mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i bya ba med pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur ba thob pa de ni sangs rgyas pa rnams mi 'dod pa yin no zhes zer ba ni de ltar ni dbang po'i bya ba med pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid du mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The hidden is not accepted because there is no activity of the sense faculties.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po'i ngo bo mthong ba dang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul nyid kyang 'gal ba can yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po'i ngo bo mthong ba dang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul nyid kyang 'gal ba can yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Because it is contradictory for the nature of a thing to be seen and for the object to be hidden.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore is the reason.

original: gal te lkog tu gyur pa snad ba ma yin pa'i yul shes pa gang gi yin pa de ste /üîΩdngos po mthong ba ni dngos po mthong ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gal te lkog tu gyur pa snad ba ma yin pa'i yul shes pa gang gi yin pa de ste / dngos po mthong ba ni dngos po mthong ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: If the object is hidden, not manifest, then the cognition of itüîΩis not the seeing of a thing.üîΩIf the seeing of a thing were not the seeing of a thing,

original: dngos po mthong bar yang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid du mi 'gyur bar zer ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po mthong bar yang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid du mi 'gyur bar zer ba ni /
translated: then it would not be the cognition of a hidden object.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the understanding.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: gal te rtogs na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rtogs na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is an understanding,

original: phyed snga ma bshad pa ni //
analyzed: phyed snga ma bshad pa ni //
translated: The first half is explained:

original: dngos po la reg pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po la reg pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It does not touch the thing.

original: lan ni spyi'i yul can yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni spyi'i yul can yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: If it has a universal as its object,

original: spyi snang zhing khyad par mi snang ba yin na yul lkog tu @42b gyur pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: spyi snang zhing khyad par mi snang ba yin na yul lkog tu @42b gyur pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that the universal appears and the particular does not appear, then the object is hidden.

original: 'on te spyi 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te spyi 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: But if only the universal appears,

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the reply.

original: ji ltar de yul nyid yin pa ni don yul yin te zhes 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar de yul nyid yin pa ni don yul yin te zhes 'dri ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHow can that be the object?‚Äù is the question: ‚ÄúThe object is the meaning.‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the reply.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ma yin pa de bzhin gyis rtogs bzhin pa yang yod do zhes ci las yin /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ma yin pa de bzhin gyis rtogs bzhin pa yang yod do zhes ci las yin /
translated: If it is not cognized by its own nature, then how can it be cognized?

original: de ltar rtogs kyang gtso bo la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs kyang gtso bo la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: To explain that even though it is cognized, the primal substance and so on do not exist, he says:

original: ma mthong bdag nyid ngo bo de //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma mthong bdag nyid ngo bo de // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The nature of that which is not seenüîΩ‚ÄúThe nature of that which is not seen‚Äù

original: ma mthong ba'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: means the nature that is not seen.

original: gzhan las rtogs pa yin la thal ches par 'gyur ba sel ba yin te ;
analyzed: gzhan las rtogs pa yin la thal ches par 'gyur ba sel ba yin te ;
translated: To dispel the absurd consequence that it is cognized by another, he says:

original: de rtogs pa'i rten te /
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i rten te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is the basis of that cognition,

original: dmigs pas 'brel pa can gal te nges pa yin na de ltar 'gyur bar bstan te /
analyzed: dmigs pas 'brel pa can gal te nges pa yin na de ltar 'gyur bar bstan te /
translated: if it is related to it by being its object, then that is so.‚Äù

original: go byed nyid ni rtogs pa'i rten te /
analyzed: go byed nyid ni rtogs pa'i rten te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe basis of that cognition‚Äù is the cause of that cognition.üîΩ‚ÄúThe cause of that cognition‚Äù is the cause of the cognition of that.

original: de tshe zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi 'brel pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tshe zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi 'brel pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word then indicates the definition of the inferential mark of natural relation.

original: gzhan dag na re de rten ni bsgrub bya'i rten chos can dang 'brel pa can zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de rten ni bsgrub bya'i rten chos can dang 'brel pa can zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid de /
translated: Others say that the basis of that is the property of the subject, which is related to the property to be established.

original: chos can de dag gang gi rten yin pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos de dang 'brel pa can du nges pa'i phyir med pa mi 'byung bar bstan to zhes sems pa yin no //
analyzed: chos can de dag gang gi rten yin pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos de dang 'brel pa can du nges pa'i phyir med pa mi 'byung bar bstan to zhes sems pa yin no //
translated: They think that this shows that the non-existent does not occur, because it is ascertained to be related to the property to be established, which is the basis of those properties of the subject.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni rten de dad zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni rten de dad zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That itself is shown by the words that basis.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba'i dri ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba'i dri ba bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the question How?

original: 'brel pa can las dran pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa can las dran pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: is from the related object, memory arises.

original: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i lan gyi shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i lan gyi shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The answer is not because it is seen in that way,

original: 'bad rtsol la sogs pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol la sogs pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but rather by effort, etc.

original: thams cad kyi tshe yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad la yang zhes bya ba yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad la yang zhes bya ba yang 'thob bo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù is a term that indicates a general rule, so ‚Äúin all cases‚Äù is also implied.

original: de'i phyir 'dra ba'i rang gi ngo bo thams cad la thams cad du yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dra ba'i rang gi ngo bo thams cad la thams cad du yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of similarity is always present in all cases.

original: du ba ni zhes bya ba 'dis lkog tu gyur pa'i 'dra ba rtogs bzhin pa ni rang gi ngo bos kyang nges pa can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩmthong ba de dad de 'dra ba yin te don de byed pa nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: du ba ni zhes bya ba 'dis lkog tu gyur pa'i 'dra ba rtogs bzhin pa ni rang gi ngo bos kyang nges pa can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // mthong ba de dad de 'dra ba yin te don de byed pa nyid kyis sam /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe smoke‚Äù indicates that the cognition of a hidden similarity is not certain by nature.

original: gzhan du yang rung ba mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du yang rung ba mngon sum yin te /
translated: That which is seen is similar to that which has the nature of performing the same function or to that which is perceived as being present elsewhere.

original: gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not engaged elsewhere‚Äù indicates

original: de dang 'dra ba des zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba des zhes bya ba ste /
translated: that the similarity is to that which is present now.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthat which is similar to it‚Äù means that which is similar to what is seen.

original: da ltar bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ltar bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin regard to that‚Äù means in regard to that which is present now.

original: de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang 'dra bas so //üîΩde la zhes bya ba ni de'i don @43a * //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang 'dra bas so // de la zhes bya ba ni de'i don @43a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is similar to it‚Äù means that which is similar to what is seen.

original: byed pa can gyi da ltar ba la'o //
analyzed: byed pa can gyi da ltar ba la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin regard to that‚Äù means in regard to that which is present now.

original: 'dis kyang mngon sum dad de dang 'dra ba 'dzin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dis kyang mngon sum dad de dang 'dra ba 'dzin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
translated: This also shows that inference is similar to direct perception because it apprehends what is similar to that.

original: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, just like that.

original: gal te yang de dang 'dra ba rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ma yin yang de dang 'brel pa can rtogs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te yang de dang 'dra ba rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ma yin yang de dang 'brel pa can rtogs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though what is similar is not understood by intrinsic nature, it is shown that what is related to that is understood.

original: 'brel pa las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, also from the relation.

original: 'brel pa nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The relation itself is shown.

original: 'bras sogs rtags ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras sogs rtags ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, the reason such as effect, etc.

original: 'dis ni med na mi 'byung bar bshad pa khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni med na mi 'byung bar bshad pa khas len pa yin no //
translated: This explains that the non-occurrence of the effect is accepted.

original: 'bras bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni shing sha pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni shing sha pa nyid la'o //
translated: As for the effect, etc., it is in relation to the tree.

original: rgyu nyid du zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: As for the cause, etc., it is in relation to smoke, etc.

original: yod pa'i phyir skad cig pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'dra ba nyid rtogs pa kho na yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir skad cig pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'dra ba nyid rtogs pa kho na yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Even in the case of momentariness because of existence, it is shown that only what is similar is understood.

original: de ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, this is it.

original: gzhan gyi yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //üîΩ'bras bu las 'dra ba nyid rtogs pa yin gyi rang bzhin las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o // 'bras bu las 'dra ba nyid rtogs pa yin gyi rang bzhin las ni ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd of others‚Äù means of things.

original: dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes kha cig zer ba la /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes kha cig zer ba la /
translated: One understands the effect to be similar to the cause, but not the nature of the cause, because there is no example.

original: de sel ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de sel ba bstan pa ni /
translated: To refute that, he says,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa mtha' dag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa mtha' dag ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll inferences . . .‚Äù

original: de la brten nas mi bslu ba can no zhes bya bar 'brel to //üîΩji ltar mthong ba dran pa tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de la brten nas mi bslu ba can no zhes bya bar 'brel to // ji ltar mthong ba dran pa tshad ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBased on that‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúnon-deceptive.‚ÄùüîΩMemory of what was seen is valid knowledge, because it is the object of the example.

original: dpe med pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba'o don yin na ji lta ba ma yin pa mthong ba tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur bar zer ba ni /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba'o don yin na ji lta ba ma yin pa mthong ba tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur bar zer ba ni /
translated: If it is the object, then seeing what is not real would not be valid knowledge.

original: gal te mthong ba 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mthong ba 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúseeing is mistaken,‚Äù

original: mthong ba ni rang rig par mthar thug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba ni rang rig par mthar thug pa'i phyir /
translated: then seeing is self-awareness, because it is ultimate.

original: ji ltar mthong ba gzhan du dran pa mi srid par bstan pa ni mthong ba las 'khrul pa de yang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba gzhan du dran pa mi srid par bstan pa ni mthong ba las 'khrul pa de yang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is impossible to remember what was seen otherwise.

original: mthong ba yal bar bor ba yang dran pa kho nas phyi rol gyi yul du rnam par gzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba yal bar bor ba yang dran pa kho nas phyi rol gyi yul du rnam par gzhag pa yin la /
translated: Also, the forgetting of what is seen is posited as an external object by memory alone.üîΩAnd the memory of what is posited is valid knowledge, but not otherwise.

original: ji ltar gzhag pa dran pa tshad ma yin gyi gzhan du ni tshad ma yin par bstan pa ni dran pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhag pa dran pa tshad ma yin gyi gzhan du ni tshad ma yin par bstan pa ni dran pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is valid knowledge is ‚ÄúThat memory also . . .üîΩ‚Äù

original: nyer mtshon dag las zhes bya ba ni nges pa dag las so //
analyzed: nyer mtshon dag las zhes bya ba ni nges pa dag las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the examples‚Äù means from the certain examples.

original: rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin rang gi ngo bo dang ma 'brel ba las kyang ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin rang gi ngo bo dang ma 'brel ba las kyang ma yin nam /
translated: Just as it is understood by its own nature, is it not also understood from what is not related to its own nature?üîΩHow is it that it is not understood by inference of its own nature?

original: ji ltar rang gi ngo bo rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ma yin zhes zer ba la /üîΩde tshe go byed rjes su 'gro //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi ngo bo rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ma yin zhes zer ba la / de tshe go byed rjes su 'gro //
translated: He says,

original: zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThen the understood is related to it.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba dang 'dra ba ni rjes su dpag bar bya ba la go byed yin zhing go bya yang ngo //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba dang 'dra ba ni rjes su dpag bar bya ba la go byed yin zhing go bya yang ngo //
translated: That which is like what is seen at the time of apprehending the relation is the understood in the object of inference and the understanding.

original: des @43b na de'i dus can gyis 'di la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des @43b na de'i dus can gyis 'di la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is pervaded by that which has that time,

original: go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba de dang 'dra ba ni de'i spyi nyid du rtogs pa ni rang gi ngo bos so zhes bya ba'i don go byed yod na nges pa yin la /
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba de dang 'dra ba ni de'i spyi nyid du rtogs pa ni rang gi ngo bos so zhes bya ba'i don go byed yod na nges pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe understanding of the universal that is similar to the one that is the basis of the understanding is by means of its own nature‚Äù is that if there is a basis of the understanding, there is ascertainment.

original: go bya ni go byed kyi rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: go bya ni go byed kyi rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The object of understanding is similar to the basis of the understanding.

original: de la yang spyi'o zhes bshad pa la khyad par nyid ci'i phyir ma yin zhes bya bar ni rigs par bstan par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'brel pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa med par lung dang don gyi go ba la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bos sam /
analyzed: de la yang spyi'o zhes bshad pa la khyad par nyid ci'i phyir ma yin zhes bya bar ni rigs par bstan par mi 'gyur ro // 'brel pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa med par lung dang don gyi go ba la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bos sam /
translated: In response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is it not the particular itself?‚Äù he explains, ‚ÄúIt is the universal.‚Äù

original: gzhan du yang rang gi go byed ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩdes na lkog gyur ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang rang gi go byed ma yin par bstan pa ni / des na lkog gyur ces bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe understanding of the object and the basis of the understanding is by means of its own nature or otherwise‚Äù teaches that the understanding of the object and the basis of the understanding does not depend on apprehending a connection.

original: go byed kyi rjes su 'gro ba yang de yin la /üîΩspyi'i ngo bo yang de yin pa'i rgyu des na /
analyzed: go byed kyi rjes su 'gro ba yang de yin la / spyi'i ngo bo yang de yin pa'i rgyu des na /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúTherefore it is hidden‚Äù teaches that the universal that is the basis of the understanding is not ascertained in the particular that is the object of the understanding.

original: rtogs pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe understanding of the hidden object is by means of the universal that is the basis of the understanding‚Äù teaches that the universal that is the basis of the understanding is the cause of the understanding of the hidden object.

original: go byed spyi ni go bya khyad par la ma nges so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: go byed spyi ni go bya khyad par la ma nges so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe universal that is the basis of the understanding is not ascertained in the particular that is the object of the understanding‚Äù teaches that the universal that is the basis of the understanding is not ascertained in the particular that is the object of the understanding.

original: go bar byed pa de'i gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: go bar byed pa de'i gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That is called the other-dependent because it is what causes understanding.

original: rtags kyi khyad par nye bar mtshon na go byed kyi rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags kyi khyad par nye bar mtshon na go byed kyi rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa yin no //
translated: When the specific characteristics of the reason are indicated, all aspects of the cause of understanding are realized.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i lam ni lung med na /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i lam ni lung med na /
translated: And that is inference.

original: mi rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the path of meditation, such as the applications of mindfulness, not realized without scripture?

original: lud dang rigs pas rnam dpyod pas zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: lud dang rigs pas rnam dpyod pas zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Because it is said that it is analyzed by reasoning and scripture.

original: bden te de'i don yang rigs pa dang 'brel ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: bden te de'i don yang rigs pa dang 'brel ba kho na yin no //
translated: That is true, but its meaning is only connected with reasoning.

original: gal te yang lud las thog mar de rtogs par rigs pa ma yin yang tshad ma kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te yang lud las thog mar de rtogs par rigs pa ma yin yang tshad ma kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though it is not reasonable that it is first realized from scripture, it is valid knowledge because it is only inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa las dbang po las 'das pa rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa las dbang po las 'das pa rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate that what is beyond the senses is not realized from anything other than inference, it says:

original: 'brel pa can gyi chos las ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi chos las ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From a property that is related.

original: lus la sogs pa la chags pa ni yul gzhan la gnyen po brten kyang rgyab kyis phyogs pa thob par mi 'gyur la dang po nas de'i bsam pa dang ldan pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la chags pa ni yul gzhan la gnyen po brten kyang rgyab kyis phyogs pa thob par mi 'gyur la dang po nas de'i bsam pa dang ldan pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment to the body, etc. is not overcome by turning away from other objects, because one is possessed of the very intention of attachment from the beginning.

original: de'i phyir shes pa thams cad la sngar ram phyis kyang rung /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa thams cad la sngar ram phyis kyang rung /
translated: Therefore, in all cognitions, whether prior or subsequent,

original: 'brel pa can mthong ba tshad ma yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel pa can mthong ba tshad ma yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the valid cognition is that of seeing the related object, and not otherwise.

original: gnas gsum bar 'pho ba na lung tshad ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: gnas gsum bar 'pho ba na lung tshad ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
translated: When one moves from one place to another, is scripture a valid means of knowledge?üîΩIt is said:

original: mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa dag las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa dag las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: from direct perception and from the obscure.

original: de yang gtso bo'i don la mi bslu ba bsgrub pa'i bsgom pa dang / tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i shes pa'i rgyu rjes su dpag pa kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang gtso bo'i don la mi bslu ba bsgrub pa'i bsgom pa dang / tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i shes pa'i rgyu rjes su dpag pa kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the valid means of knowledge is only inference, which is the cause of cognition dependent on a single collection, and which establishes non-deception with regard to the primary object.

original: @44a * // rjes su dpag pa'am rjes su dpag pa nye bar 'jog pa yang rjes su dpag pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @44a * // rjes su dpag pa'am rjes su dpag pa nye bar 'jog pa yang rjes su dpag pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And the postulation of inference is also inference itself.

original: de de ltar tshad ma rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam pa gnyis nyams su myong bzhin pa las /
analyzed: de de ltar tshad ma rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam pa gnyis nyams su myong bzhin pa las /
translated: Thus, since the two valid cognitions are experienced as having different aspects,

original: tha dad pa'i nyams su myong ba gcig ma yin zhing gzhan du yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i nyams su myong ba gcig ma yin zhing gzhan du yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: they are not a single experience that is different from those two, nor are they different.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi gcig ni nam yang ma yin na /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi gcig ni nam yang ma yin na /
translated: But since they are never a single entity that is the nature of both,

original: gang gis de'i yul la gsum par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis de'i yul la gsum par 'gyur /
translated: how could their object be a third possibility?

original: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid kho na gcig ma yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid kho na gcig ma yin na /
translated: In the same way, if the object is not a single intrinsic identity,üîΩhow could it be a single valid cognition?

original: gang gis gcig kho na tshad mar 'gyur zhes bya pa 'dis gsum nyid dam gcig kyang gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis kyis bkag pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang gis gcig kho na tshad mar 'gyur zhes bya pa 'dis gsum nyid dam gcig kyang gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis kyis bkag pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This passage shows that the two possibilities of the object being a third possibility or a single entity are refuted by the two modes of valid cognition.

original: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong ba'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong ba'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
translated: The two objects are seen.

original: gzhal bya gzhan med pa'i phyir tshad ma gsum pa la sogs pa med par sngar bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan med pa'i phyir tshad ma gsum pa la sogs pa med par sngar bstan pa yin la /
translated: Since there is no other object of comprehension, the three means of valid cognition and so on do not exist. This was previously explained.

original: 'dir ni gzhan med kyang gnyis po des gcig tu gyur pa'i gsum pa 'phangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhan med kyang gnyis po des gcig tu gyur pa'i gsum pa 'phangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: Here, even though the other does not exist, the third, which is the combination of the two, is not implied. This is the distinction.

original: 'grel par yang de lta bu'i don du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'grel par yang de lta bu'i don du bshad par bya'o //
translated: And in the Commentary, this meaning should be explained.

original: gsum la sogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgra ni bag med pas brjod pa'am yang na gnyi ga ma yin pa la sogs pa sdud pa'i don du'o //üîΩde la re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid gcig po kho na spyi dang khyad par rtogs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum la sogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgra ni bag med pas brjod pa'am yang na gnyi ga ma yin pa la sogs pa sdud pa'i don du'o // de la re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid gcig po kho na spyi dang khyad par rtogs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in ‚Äúthree and so on‚Äù is a term of omission, or it is for the purpose of including both ‚Äúneither‚Äù and so on.üîΩIn that regard, first, the idea that ‚Äúthe two objects of comprehension do not exist‚Äù because the single particular itself is the object of the comprehension of universals and instances is as follows.

original: gzhal bya gnyis po med do snyam du sems pa ni 'on te spyi dang khyad par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis po med do snyam du sems pa ni 'on te spyi dang khyad par zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUniversal‚Äù and ‚Äúinstance‚Äù are said to be
