original: spyi med pas gzhan bya tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi med pas gzhan bya tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no universal, there is no difference between other things.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig po kho na rnam pa gnyis su rtogs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig po kho na rnam pa gnyis su rtogs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The one intrinsic nature is understood in two ways.

original: med pas gzhal bya ma yin phyir /
analyzed: med pas gzhal bya ma yin phyir /
translated: Because it is nonexistent, it is not an object of knowledge.

original: gcig nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid ni med pa nyid ces bya ba ni do bo'o //üîΩgzhal bya ba ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub pa la ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni med pa nyid ces bya ba ni do bo'o // gzhal bya ba ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub pa la ma nges pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIntrinsic nature‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúnonexistence.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason is inconclusive, because it is not established that what is nonexistent is not an object of knowledge.

original: med pa gzhal bya la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ma nges pa nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa gzhal bya la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni ma nges pa nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is ‚ÄúIs it not inconclusive?‚Äù

original: med pa ni med pa'i ngo bo ste gzhan gyi gzhal bya zhes bstan pa ni med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa ni med pa'i ngo bo ste gzhan gyi gzhal bya zhes bstan pa ni med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNonexistence‚Äù is the nature of nonexistence. The response to this is ‚ÄúNonexistence too.‚Äù

original: spyi'i yul la rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: spyi'i yul la rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if inference is not a valid cognition with respect to a universal object,

original: med par nges pa'i ngo bo ni gnyis pa thob pa kho na ste /
analyzed: med par nges pa'i ngo bo ni gnyis pa thob pa kho na ste /
translated: the nature of the ascertainment of nonexistence is only the second.

original: de rjes su @44b dpag pa'am gnyis par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de rjes su @44b dpag pa'am gnyis par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
translated: There is no difference between the two in terms of whether they are inference or the second. This is stated in the line:

original: de nges tshad ma gnyis ba nyid //
analyzed: de nges tshad ma gnyis ba nyid //
translated: Ascertainment of that is the second valid cognition.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is the second chapter, the chapter on the benefits of bodhicitta.

original: gal te yod pa gsal bar byed pa'i dbang po ni de'i khyad par dang ldan pa med pa yang gsal bar byed pa yin te bya ba dang ldan pa'i dbang po la de rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gal te yod pa gsal bar byed pa'i dbang po ni de'i khyad par dang ldan pa med pa yang gsal bar byed pa yin te bya ba dang ldan pa'i dbang po la de rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If you think that the sense faculty that illuminates the existent also illuminates the non-existent that does not possess that attribute, because the sense faculty that possesses activity is seen to be the cognizer of that, then:

original: med pa dbang skyes blo min te //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: med pa dbang skyes blo min te // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The non-existent is not the awareness arisen from the sense faculty.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.

original: des dben pa mthong ba las de dran na de med pa'i nges pa skye ba yin gyi dbang po las skyes pa'i bdag nyid rang la khyad par gzhan du sgro 'dogs pas ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des dben pa mthong ba las de dran na de med pa'i nges pa skye ba yin gyi dbang po las skyes pa'i bdag nyid rang la khyad par gzhan du sgro 'dogs pas ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: If you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.

original: dran pas phan btags pa'i dbang po nyid med pa'i shes pa'i rgyu ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /üîΩdon gyi stobs las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dran pas phan btags pa'i dbang po nyid med pa'i shes pa'i rgyu ma yin nam zhes zer ba la / don gyi stobs las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.

original: don gyi nye ba dang nye ba ma yin pa dag las snang ba'i dbye ba dang 'brel pa'i shes pa de ni de'i bskyed bya yin gyi /
analyzed: don gyi nye ba dang nye ba ma yin pa dag las snang ba'i dbye ba dang 'brel pa'i shes pa de ni de'i bskyed bya yin gyi /
translated: If you think that the sense faculty that possesses activity is the cognizer of the existent and the non-existent, then that is not so.

original: med pa'i nye ba dang cig shos dag las de'i snang ba'i dbye ba can gyi shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i nye ba dang cig shos dag las de'i snang ba'i dbye ba can gyi shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But consciousness does not have the appearance of difference in the case of the non-existent and the existent,

original: khyad par med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is observed without distinction.

original: don ni shes pa la dmigs pa nyid kho na skyed byed nyid yin pa med pa la yang 'di la khyad par med do snyam du sems pal /
analyzed: don ni shes pa la dmigs pa nyid kho na skyed byed nyid yin pa med pa la yang 'di la khyad par med do snyam du sems pal /
translated: The meaning is that the object itself, which is the cause of the production of consciousness, is also the cause of the production of the non-existent, because there is no difference in this case.

original: don gyi nus pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don gyi nus pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe potency of the object,‚ÄùüîΩbecause there is no difference in the appearance of the produced effect of the existent and the non-existent, the mere observation of that is the cause of the production of the object.

original: nye ba dang cig shos kyi bskyed bya snang ba'i dbye ba med pas de la dmigs pa tsam gyis don gyi bskyed bya nyid kyi du ba las me rtogs na mthong ba dang thal ba ni dus kyis bar du chod kyang rags pas phra mo'i shes pa la
analyzed: nye ba dang cig shos kyi bskyed bya snang ba'i dbye ba med pas de la dmigs pa tsam gyis don gyi bskyed bya nyid kyi du ba las me rtogs na mthong ba dang thal ba ni dus kyis bar du chod kyang rags pas phra mo'i shes pa la
translated: If fire is inferred from smoke, the seeing and the smoke are separated by time.

original: rang bzhin gyis bskal ba yin yang dbang po bskyed bya nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bskal ba yin yang dbang po bskyed bya nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the gross is naturally separated from the subtle, the gross is the cause of the production of the sense faculty.

original: gang gi phyir de'i tshe dbang po'i bya ba med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i tshe dbang po'i bya ba med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because at that time the activity of the sense faculty is not absent.

original: da la gzhan du 'jug pa'i dbang po yin no zhes 'di la yang cis mi 'dod /
analyzed: da la gzhan du 'jug pa'i dbang po yin no zhes 'di la yang cis mi 'dod /
translated: Why not accept that the sense faculty is the dominant condition for the arising of the cognition of the other object?

original: nya ba dang cig shos dag las snang ba la khyad par med pa ni de'i bskyed bya nyid la rgyu ni 'di la khyad par med do //
analyzed: nya ba dang cig shos dag las snang ba la khyad par med pa ni de'i bskyed bya nyid la rgyu ni 'di la khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference in the appearance of the fish and the other object, and the cause of that appearance is not different.

original: gal te gang gi med pa 'di yin pa de ni de'i khyad par can mngon sum gyi yul ma yin la 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang gi med pa 'di yin pa de ni de'i khyad par can mngon sum gyi yul ma yin la 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If the nonexistence of that is this, then that which has that difference is not the object of perception. What is it then?

original: yul nye ba la sogs pa des dben pa'i phyir bar du chod pa rtogs pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: yul nye ba la sogs pa des dben pa'i phyir bar du chod pa rtogs pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba ni /
translated: It is said that there is the fault of cognizing an obstructed object because of the absence of that which is near and so on.

original: 'on te sa phyogs dben pa dmigs pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te sa phyogs dben pa dmigs pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, it is said that it is because of the observation of the mere place that is devoid of that.

original: gcig gi rigs pa kho na'i mi snang ba la ltos nas mi rigs pa @45a * //
analyzed: gcig gi rigs pa kho na'i mi snang ba la ltos nas mi rigs pa @45a * //
translated: Is it not that the nonexistence of one is not the other, but rather the nonexistence of the other is the one?

original: ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /
translated: It is said that it is not so.

original: de nyid las gzhan rig pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid las gzhan rig pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it is the cognition of that itself as other.

original: snang bzhin pa gzhan ma yin na gang la ltos nas de gzhan yin /
analyzed: snang bzhin pa gzhan ma yin na gang la ltos nas de gzhan yin /
translated: If the other that appears does not exist, then in dependence on what is it other?

original: de mi snang na gzhan nyid mi 'grub bo zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de mi snang na gzhan nyid mi 'grub bo zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If it does not appear, then difference is not established.

original: de las gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by the words ‚Äúfrom that, difference.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid med pa'i khyad par can med par nges pa la mngon sum nyid ldog pa las zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid med pa'i khyad par can med par nges pa la mngon sum nyid ldog pa las zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúfrom the cessation of perception‚Äù mean that the cessation of perception is the means of knowing the absence of reality.

original: ldog pa ni med par nges par byed do snyam du sems pa ni 'gal ba ste mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa ni med par nges par byed do snyam du sems pa ni 'gal ba ste mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: The thought that the cessation of perception is the means of knowing absence is contradictory, i.e., inconsistent.

original: log pa ste med par gyur pas yod pa bzhin du med par yang nges par byed pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: log pa ste med par gyur pas yod pa bzhin du med par yang nges par byed pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not reasonable that the cessation of perception, i.e., the absence of perception, should be the means of knowing the existence of something, i.e., the absence of absence.üîΩThe cessation of perception is not the means of knowing the absence of absence.

original: mngon sum log pa ni ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum log pa ni ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: de'i ldog pas ster ba tu ldog par ni nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ldog pas ster ba tu ldog par ni nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: The cessation of the perception of existence is the means of knowing the absence of absence.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this he says:

original: mngon sum nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúperception‚Äù is the means of knowing.üîΩ‚ÄúHow do you know that the cognition of another does not exist?‚Äù

original: gzhan sems pa can du rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ci las shes par byed ces zer ba la /üîΩsmras sogs la ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan sems pa can du rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ci las shes par byed ces zer ba la /üîΩsmras sogs la ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He says: ‚ÄúIn the case of the cognition of another, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i ngo bo nges pa can ni gzhan sems pa can du rtogs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nges pa can ni gzhan sems pa can du rtogs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The ascertainment of its nature is the ascertainment of the cognition of the mind of another.

original: rnam pa ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba ni tshad ma can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba ni tshad ma can ma yin pa'o //
translated: In what way? means without a valid cognition.

original: thabs med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni tshad ma med pa nyid do //üîΩde ltar rtogs na gzhan sems pa can du rtogs par 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thabs med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni tshad ma med pa nyid do // de ltar rtogs na gzhan sems pa can du rtogs par 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /
translated: It is only without a means means without a valid cognition.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya'o //
translated: The statement If it were like that, . . . teaches that if it were like that, it would be the cognition of the mind of another.üîΩIf it were like that, . . . means if it were like that, it would be the cognition of the mind of another.

original: 'on te 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan la thabs med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan la thabs med par bstan pa'o //
translated: But if this . . . teaches that there is no means for others.

original: gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pas so //
translated: Others . . . refers to the Lokayatas.

original: med pa dang rgyu dang khyab byed la sogs pa'i nges pa yod pa ni bden yang /
analyzed: med pa dang rgyu dang khyab byed la sogs pa'i nges pa yod pa ni bden yang /
translated: Although there is a rule that nonexistence, cause, and pervader, etc., are not perceived,

original: de lta bu tshad ma yin na thal ches pa yin no zhes zer ba la /üîΩslu med phyir na tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: de lta bu tshad ma yin na thal ches pa yin no zhes zer ba la / slu med phyir na tshad ma nyid //
translated: if that were a valid cognition, it would be too much.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is nondeceptive, it is a valid cognition.

original: de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa smra ba po nyid dam nyid mtshams mi spyir ba la shi ba'i sems nyid khyab ba yin yang nges par byed pa ma yin pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa smra ba po nyid dam nyid mtshams mi spyir ba la shi ba'i sems nyid khyab ba yin yang nges par byed pa ma yin pa ma yin na /
translated: It is not the case that the mere fact that the speaker is not omniscient pervades the fact that he is not trustworthy.

original: des na mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is not deceptive.

original: ji ltar nye bar bstan pa tshad ma ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar bstan pa tshad ma ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: One might think that the teaching is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: la la dag tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: la la dag tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In some places,

original: smra ba po nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa 'gal ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: smra ba po nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa 'gal ba ma yin zhing /
translated: because of being a speaker, it is not contradictory to be omniscient, etc.

original: khyab par byed pa la sogs pa 'gal ba ma yin pa la 'bras bu 'gal ba ma yin zhing des khyab pa yang ma yin @45b no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa la sogs pa 'gal ba ma yin pa la 'bras bu 'gal ba ma yin zhing des khyab pa yang ma yin @45b no //
translated: It is not contradictory for the pervaders, etc., to be noncontradictory, and it is not contradictory for the effect to be pervaded by that.

original: de'i phyir the tshom za ba yin la 'bras bu'am khyab bya'am 'gal ba'i 'bras bu'am khyab bya zhes bya ba'i nges par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom za ba yin la 'bras bu'am khyab bya'am 'gal ba'i 'bras bu'am khyab bya zhes bya ba'i nges par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, there is doubt. The teaching of the effect or the pervaded or the effect or the pervaded that is contradictory

original: rtags la log par mthong ba gang gi yin pa de'i 'di lta bu'i rtags dang rtags ma yin pa mtshungs par byed pas rtags las nges pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rtags la log par mthong ba gang gi yin pa de'i 'di lta bu'i rtags dang rtags ma yin pa mtshungs par byed pas rtags las nges pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: The one who sees the sign as mistaken makes the sign and non-sign similar in this way, so there is no certainty from the sign.

original: dpyod par byed pa po las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dpyod par byed pa po las ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not from the one who analyzes.

original: de yang re zhig tshogs pa gcig par mtshungs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de yang re zhig tshogs pa gcig par mtshungs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: And that is similar in one group, he says.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is just dependent on one group.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu'am khyab bya zhes ci las yin gang gi phyir de la res 'ga' 'byung ba nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu nyid dam khyab bya nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu'am khyab bya zhes ci las yin gang gi phyir de la res 'ga' 'byung ba nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu nyid dam khyab bya nyid ma yin te /
translated: If it is a contradictory effect or pervaded, what is it from? Because it is sometimes just the effect of that or pervaded by that, it is not the effect of that or pervaded by that.

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: Because it is too much, he says.

original: gang las ni dngos po las te dngos 'gal la'o //
analyzed: gang las ni dngos po las te dngos 'gal la'o //
translated: From what? From a thing, from a direct contradiction.

original: 'di'i ni rgol ba po'i'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ni rgol ba po'i'o //
translated: This is the opponent's.

original: rtogs pa grub pa ni nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa grub pa ni nges pa nyid do //
translated: The establishment of understanding is just certainty.

original: nges pa'i ngo bo mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma nges pa las ldog pa'i dngos po de de ltar rtogs pa'i yul gyi 'bras bu'am khyab bya yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i ngo bo mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma nges pa las ldog pa'i dngos po de de ltar rtogs pa'i yul gyi 'bras bu'am khyab bya yin no //
translated: The ascertained entity is the object of the result or pervaded of the realization of that entity which is the opposite of the uncertain nonconcordant side.

original: gang gi phyir de la nges pa ni de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'am khyab bya ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la nges pa ni de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'am khyab bya ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Because ascertainment is not the result or pervaded of that,

original: nges pa nyid kho na la de ltar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa nyid kho na la de ltar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is only ascertainment that is so described.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i yul rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i yul rtogs pa'o //
translated: That which is called realization is the realization of the object of ascertainment.

original: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bo'o //üîΩde'i 'bras bu nyid dam de'i ngo bo nyid 'di grub na de nges par yod pa yin te de med na de nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bo'o // de'i 'bras bu nyid dam de'i ngo bo nyid 'di grub na de nges par yod pa yin te de med na de nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: That entity is its own entity.

original: rang gi rgyu'am ngo bo dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'am ngo bo dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: If its result or its entity is established, then it definitely exists, because if it does not exist, it does not exist. This is taught by its own cause or entity.

original: gal te yang smra ba po nyid la sogs pa las du ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni bsgrub bya gzhan nyid khyad par med kyang bsgrub bya'i 'bras bu dang khyab bya nyid kyi de las khyad par yod pa'i phyir gzhan du 'di dag gi 'bras
analyzed: gal te yang smra ba po nyid la sogs pa las du ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni bsgrub bya gzhan nyid khyad par med kyang bsgrub bya'i 'bras bu dang khyab bya nyid kyi de las khyad par yod pa'i phyir gzhan du 'di dag gi 'bras
translated: Although the nature of smoke, etc. is not different from the probandum, etc. in terms of being other than the speaker, etc., the effect of the probandum and the pervaded are different from that.

original: bu nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de dag gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bu nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzhan nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de dag gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the reason for the otherness of the nature of their effect, etc. is their characteristic.

original: 'grel par bshad pa ni gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'grel par bshad pa ni gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: The explanation in the commentary is very clear.

original: gal te res 'ga' rgyu'am rang bzhin yin yang /
analyzed: gal te res 'ga' rgyu'am rang bzhin yin yang /
translated: If sometimes it is a cause or a nature,

original: gzhan gyi tshe yang de ltar yin pa ci las she na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe yang de ltar yin pa ci las she na /
translated: why is it also like that at other times?

original: de ltar dogs pa yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar dogs pa yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is the doubt,

original: de 'di ltar 'bras bu dang khyab bya yod na rgyu dang khyab byed yod par brjod de /
analyzed: de 'di ltar 'bras bu dang khyab bya yod na rgyu dang khyab byed yod par brjod de /
translated: it is said that when the effect and the pervaded exist, the cause and the pervader exist.

original: de yod na yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because when they exist, they exist.

original: @46a * // de nyid kyi phyir de dag med par nges na 'bras bu dang khyab bya dag med par nges par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: @46a * // de nyid kyi phyir de dag med par nges na 'bras bu dang khyab bya dag med par nges par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, when they are ascertained to be nonexistent, the result and the pervasion are ascertained to be nonexistent.

original: rang gi ngo bo'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by the words ‚Äúown nature‚Äù and so on.üîΩ‚Äú

original: bltar rung zhes bya ba ni ngo bo'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: bltar rung zhes bya ba ni ngo bo'i khyad par ro //
translated: Suitable to appear‚Äù is a particular nature.üîΩ‚Äú

original: mthong ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni rkyen gzhan tshang ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni rkyen gzhan tshang ba'o //
translated: Cause of perception‚Äù is the presence of other conditions.üîΩ‚Äú

original: bltar rung min pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bltar rung min pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Not suitable to appear‚Äù is the nonperception of nature.üîΩ‚Äú

original: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rgyu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rgyu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing that‚Äù is possessing the natural cause.

original: 'di la ji skad bstan pa dang ldan pa zhes zer ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di la ji skad bstan pa dang ldan pa zhes zer ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not correct to say that this is ‚Äúpossessing what has been taught,‚Äù

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag gis rung ba ma yin pa'i mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag gis rung ba ma yin pa'i mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nonperception of a related object and the nonperception of a cause or a pervader ascertain the absence of the suitable object.

original: 'brel pa can yang yin la de med kyang yod na 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'brel pa can yang yin la de med kyang yod na 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is related and exists even when it is absent, what is the contradiction?

original: gang gi phyir 'di 'brel pa can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di 'brel pa can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is called ‚Äúrelated,‚Äù

original: de med na med pa dang yod par yang 'gal la med pa ni 'brel yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med na med pa dang yod par yang 'gal la med pa ni 'brel yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it does not exist, then existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive, and nonexistence is related.üîΩIf one accepts mere seeing and then clarifies the hidden, then even the house, garden, and so on that one accepts would not be seen when one goes to another place.

original: mthong ba tsam khas blangs nas lkog tu gyur pa gsal bar byed na khas blangs pa'i khyim dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa yang yul gzhan du song ba mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba tsam khas blangs nas lkog tu gyur pa gsal bar byed na khas blangs pa'i khyim dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa yang yul gzhan du song ba mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: spyi yi blo ni tshad min na //
analyzed: spyi yi blo ni tshad min na //
translated: The cognition of universals is not valid cognition.

original: zhes bya ba ste spyi'i blo ni lkog tu gyur pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste spyi'i blo ni lkog tu gyur pa'i blo'o //
translated: The cognition of universals is the cognition of the hidden.

original: de med pa ni rang gis khas blangs pa'i lkog tu gyur pa de yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pa ni rang gis khas blangs pa'i lkog tu gyur pa de yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that does not exist, then even the hidden that one accepts would not exist.

original: pha rol gyi dngos bzhin ni kho bo cag 'dod pa'i 'jig rten pha rol bzhin no //
analyzed: pha rol gyi dngos bzhin ni kho bo cag 'dod pa'i 'jig rten pha rol bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of the other side, that is, like the case of the other world that we accept.

original: ma mthong ba'i khyim dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa ni yang mthong ba de'i phyir ma mthong bas khyad par du byas pa'i ma mthong ba ni med par go bar byed la 'jig rten pha rol la yad dus thams cad du ma mthong ba yang yod do
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i khyim dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa ni yang mthong ba de'i phyir ma mthong bas khyad par du byas pa'i ma mthong ba ni med par go bar byed la 'jig rten pha rol la yad dus thams cad du ma mthong ba yang yod do
translated: But there is also nonseeing of the world beyond at all times.

original: zhe na khyod kyis 'dod pa'i dbang po la sogs pa la yang dus thams cad du ma mthong ba yod do zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhe na khyod kyis 'dod pa'i dbang po la sogs pa la yang dus thams cad du ma mthong ba yod do zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to that is that even the eye faculty and so on that you assert exist is not seen at all times.

original: de min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by the words ‚ÄúIf it is not so.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs gnas skabs su mthong du zin kyang de med pa'o zhes bya ba yang mi rigs te /üîΩrgyu med na mthong ba khas blangs pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩmed par rtogs pa yin na ni //
analyzed: gnas skabs gnas skabs su mthong du zin kyang de med pa'o zhes bya ba yang mi rigs te / rgyu med na mthong ba khas blangs pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni / med par rtogs pa yin na ni //
translated: Even if one sees it at some point, it is illogical to say that it does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is because it is contradictory to accept that it is seen if it does not exist. This is indicated by the words ‚ÄúIf it is understood as nonexistent.‚Äù

original: khyim dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa ma mthong ba ni de'i tshe med bsam rig na mi ltar khyad par du byed ces zer ba la /
analyzed: khyim dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa ma mthong ba ni de'i tshe med bsam rig na mi ltar khyad par du byed ces zer ba la /
translated: If one thinks that the nonseeing of a house, garden, and so on is nonexistent at that time, then one would have to say that the qualification is a human.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, when?‚Äù

original: rung ba nyid la zhes bya ba ni rgyu rnams kyi nus pa la la'o //
analyzed: rung ba nyid la zhes bya ba ni rgyu rnams kyi nus pa la la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of the capacity of causes‚Äù means in the case of the power of causes.

original: nus pa @46b yang de yod na yod pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis rtogs kyi /üîΩgzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nus pa @46b yang de yod na yod pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis rtogs kyi / gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: And since the power exists when the effect exists, the power is understood by a reason based on the nature of things.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not understood by any other means. This is indicated by the words ‚Äúa reason based on the nature of things.‚Äù

original: blo yang yin la skye ba yang yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo yang yin la skye ba yang yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition that arises‚Äù means

original: gnyis gnyis pa la gcig bzhin pa'i ngo bo zhes bstan pa ni skye ba dang blo'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis pa la gcig bzhin pa'i ngo bo zhes bstan pa ni skye ba dang blo'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: that the two are the same in nature. This is indicated by the words ‚Äúthe arising of the cognition.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu mthong ba dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro bas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong ba dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe perception of the effect‚Äù means by the relation of effect to cause.

original: mig gam nus pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: mig gam nus pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: The eye and the power are also the intrinsic nature of the effect.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir mngon sum kho nar rtogs pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir mngon sum kho nar rtogs pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /
translated: But since they are entities, aren‚Äôt they also understood by perception?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la ste gzung bya ba rnam rtog med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la ste gzung bya ba rnam rtog med pa'o //
translated: The intrinsic nature of the effect is not understood by perception.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum ni rang gi rnam pa la don du zhe na spyis zhen par byed la /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum ni rang gi rnam pa la don du zhe na spyis zhen par byed la /
translated: Conceptual perception is the apprehension of the aspect of an object as the object itself.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs bya nges pa bas ni mi gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs bya nges pa bas ni mi gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: It is not as clear as the ascertainment of the object of perception,üîΩbut it is not the case that it does not make the object clear.

original: 'on kyang zhen par byed pa yin gyi ngo bo gzhan gyi spyi gsal bar byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhen par byed pa yin gyi ngo bo gzhan gyi spyi gsal bar byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that it does not make the universal of another entity clear is

original: rnam rtog med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúwithout conceptual thought.‚Äù

original: spyis 'dzin par rjes su dpag pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: spyis 'dzin par rjes su dpag pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that it is only inference that apprehends the universal isüîΩ‚Äúin regard to that.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa la'o //üîΩde 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid gcig po gzhal bya la /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa la'o // de 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid gcig po gzhal bya la /
translated: That is, in regard to the eye, etc.üîΩThe object of knowledge is the single particular.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i shes pa'i yul yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i shes pa'i yul yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The object of the knowledge of the particular and the universal is that particular.

original: shes pa'i dbye ba kho na tshad ma'i dbye ba yin pas gcig nyid tshad ma yin no zhes gsal nas da ltar ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i ngo bo gcig pa'i gzhal bya gsum pa yod pa'i phyir tshad ma gsum par 'gyur ro zhes gsal ba'i don
analyzed: shes pa'i dbye ba kho na tshad ma'i dbye ba yin pas gcig nyid tshad ma yin no zhes gsal nas da ltar ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i ngo bo gcig pa'i gzhal bya gsum pa yod pa'i phyir tshad ma gsum par 'gyur ro zhes gsal ba'i don
translated: Now, in order to clarify the point that there are three objects that are the same nature as their own characteristics, he states, ‚Äúbecause there is a third object that is the same nature as its own characteristic, there are three valid knowledges.‚Äù

original: du nye bar bkod pa ni gzhal bya nges na kha dog ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du nye bar bkod pa ni gzhal bya nges na kha dog ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúWhen the object is ascertained, color‚Äù is a summary of that.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum kho na'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum kho na'i yul yin gyi /
translated: A particular is the object of direct perception alone.

original: spyi'i ni rjes su dpag pa kho na'i yin te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni kha dog mi rtag pa nyid spyi'i zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i ni rjes su dpag pa kho na'i yin te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni kha dog mi rtag pa nyid spyi'i zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A universal is the object of inference alone, because it is accepted that the particular is the impermanence of color and the universal is the impermanence of product.

original: de blo ste gnyis ga'i bdag nyid kyi blo mngon sum yin te spyi'i snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de blo ste gnyis ga'i bdag nyid kyi blo mngon sum yin te spyi'i snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That cognition, which is the nature of both, is direct perception, because it is the appearance of a universal.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not inference, because it is not a subsequent cognition.

original: khyad par gyi cha snang ba'i phyir dang rtags med pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bstan pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi cha snang ba'i phyir dang rtags med pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bstan pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and because the particular is seen, and because there is no reason.

original: khyad par mthong ba la ni rtags yod kyang rjes su dpag pa ma yin te spyi'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba la ni rtags yod kyang rjes su dpag pa ma yin te spyi'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there is a reason for seeing the particular, it is not inference, because it does not have a universal for its object.

original: de bstan pa ni /üîΩkhyad par mthong ba rtags dad ni //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni / khyad par mthong ba rtags dad ni //
translated: This is shown by the wordsüîΩ‚ÄúThe particular is seen, and there is a reason.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.üîΩ

original: ci'i phyir spyi yul ma yin @47a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir spyi yul ma yin @47a * //
translated: Why is it not a universal?

original: zhe na / de dang lhan cig rtags kyi 'brel pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhe na / de dang lhan cig rtags kyi 'brel pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it does not grasp the connection of the reason together with it. This is shown by the wordsüîΩ‚ÄúThe reason is not grasped.

original: rtags dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtags dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the sign.üîΩ

original: tshad ma gzhan pa de ni khyad par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan pa de ni khyad par mthong ba ste /
translated: That other means of valid knowledge is the seeing of the particular.

original: mngon sum yin te dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum yin te dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is perception, because it is not born from a sense faculty.

original: rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not inference,üîΩbecause it does not have a universal for its object.

original: spyi yul ma yin pas 'di'i shugs kyis tshad ma gzhan grub pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: spyi yul ma yin pas 'di'i shugs kyis tshad ma gzhan grub pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: This is the establishment of another means of valid knowledge by implication.

original: mang po nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mang po nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: mngon sum dang khyad par mthong ba yang gcig la'am khyad par la zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dgag pa dang sbyar bas gnas skabs kyi mang po nyid kyi rtog pa dgag pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang khyad par mthong ba yang gcig la'am khyad par la zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dgag pa dang sbyar bas gnas skabs kyi mang po nyid kyi rtog pa dgag pa yin te /
translated: And the perception of difference is also refuted by the application of the negation in the phrase ‚Äúeither in one or in difference,‚Äù which will be explained later. Thus, the conception of plurality in the context of the momentary is refuted.

original: gcig nyid kyis rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyis rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the exclusion of oneness.

original: de smra ba ni dper na khyad par mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya la'o //
analyzed: de smra ba ni dper na khyad par mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya la'o //
translated: The proponent of this view says, ‚ÄúFor example, the perception of difference is in regard to the object of cognition.‚Äù

original: de ltar gcig nyid dang gsum nyid gsal bar mi 'gyur zhes zer ba ni gcig ma yin pa yang ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar gcig nyid dang gsum nyid gsal bar mi 'gyur zhes zer ba ni gcig ma yin pa yang ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, he says that oneness and three-ness are not clearly manifest, meaning that they are not even not one.

original: khyad par mthong ba'i tshad mas khyad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba'i tshad mas khyad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the valid cognition that perceives difference apprehends difference.

original: bshad pa gsum pa 'jug pa ni gcig nyid kho na'o zhes bya ba'am gyi sgra ni 'jug pa'am zhes rgyu mtshan gyi rtog pas mang po nyid kho nar sgrub par byed pa de la ni gcig nyid du sgrub pa ma yin ti mang po nyid dngos su 'gog
analyzed: bshad pa gsum pa 'jug pa ni gcig nyid kho na'o zhes bya ba'am gyi sgra ni 'jug pa'am zhes rgyu mtshan gyi rtog pas mang po nyid kho nar sgrub par byed pa de la ni gcig nyid du sgrub pa ma yin ti mang po nyid dngos su 'gog
translated: The third explanation is that the word ‚Äúor‚Äù in the line ‚Äúor it is only one‚Äù indicates that the reason for the doubt is that it is established as many, and it is not established as one.üîΩ

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third explanation is that the entry is only one. The word ‚Äúor‚Äù is a reason for the thought of multiplicity. The proof of multiplicity is not the proof of unity, because the negation of multiplicity is explicit.

original: de'i phyir drang ba'i don nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir drang ba'i don nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is interpretable in meaning.

original: nus dang nus min nyid ces bya ba drang ba'i don nyid yin no //
analyzed: nus dang nus min nyid ces bya ba drang ba'i don nyid yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúCapable and incapable‚Äù is interpretable in meaning.

original: tha dad par snang ba yang mngon par zhen pas gcig nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la zlos pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad par snang ba yang mngon par zhen pas gcig nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la zlos pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The appearance of difference is also the object of the conception of unity. The repetition is not taught.

original: bden mod kyi 'di yang zhes bya ba'i rigs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir zlos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'di yang zhes bya ba'i rigs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir zlos pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúTrue, but this is also‚Äù is the only reasoning, so it is not a repetition.

original: kha dog kyang mi rtag pa bzhin du rtog pa'i yul spyi kho nas yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: kha dog kyang mi rtag pa bzhin du rtog pa'i yul spyi kho nas yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Color is also only the universal, the object of conception, as impermanence is taught.

original: skyon 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: skyon 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ste //
translated: ‚ÄúThis fault does not arise‚Äù is the reason.

original: mi rtag pa nyid bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir kha dog kyang spyi kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir kha dog kyang spyi kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that color is a universal, like impermanence, because it is the object of conceptualization.

original: gal te kha dog la sogs pa'i spyi mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dad sbyor ba la ji ltar khyad par rnams la mngon par zhen pa'am /üîΩ'jug pa yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: gal te kha dog la sogs pa'i spyi mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dad sbyor ba la ji ltar khyad par rnams la mngon par zhen pa'am / 'jug pa yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: If the universal of color, etc. is connected with impermanence, etc., how can there be attachment to or engagement with the particulars?

original: dngos med ngo bo min ni dngos po las gzhan pa'i spyi yin te /
analyzed: dngos med ngo bo min ni dngos po las gzhan pa'i spyi yin te /
translated: The universal is not the nature of a non-entity, because it is different from an entity.

original: sgra mi rtag pa'am kha dog gam zhes bya ba @47b 'dis de nyid de dngos po nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa'am kha dog gam zhes bya ba @47b 'dis de nyid de dngos po nyid kyi'o //
translated: The word or in impermanent sound or color, etc. indicates that it is the nature of an entity.

original: de bzhin ni mngon sum du mi byed pas so //üîΩgrub phyir ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin ni mngon sum du mi byed pas so // grub phyir ni nges pa'o //
translated: It is like that because it is not made manifest.üîΩIt is established because it is ascertained.

original: rab bsgrub phyir ni nges par mthong bas byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab bsgrub phyir ni nges par mthong bas byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is definitely seen because it is made manifest.

original: gzhan du mngon du byed pa na mdon du byed pa'i yul ma grub pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du mngon du byed pa na mdon du byed pa'i yul ma grub pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If it is made manifest in another way, is the object that is made manifest not established?

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The word elsewhere refers to this.

original: dngos su mi snang ba'i yul la gzhan la de snang ba'i yul du ji ltar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: dngos su mi snang ba'i yul la gzhan la de snang ba'i yul du ji ltar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How can an object that does not actually appear be the object that appears to another?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not at all reasonable to say that it is established as other than its own characteristic.

original: de nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: That itself is its own characteristic.

original: grub phyir ni zhen pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: grub phyir ni zhen pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of being established, it is conceived.

original: gal te yang rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin na zhen par byed pa yin la zhen pa yang rang gi ngo bo mi snang ba yin na zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin na zhen par byed pa yin la zhen pa yang rang gi ngo bo mi snang ba yin na zhen pa yin te /
translated: Even if its own characteristic does not appear, it is conceived. And if it is conceived, it is conceived as not appearing as its own nature.

original: mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad du mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad du mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: Because of being incompatible, it is the same in all cases.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bo snang ba ni nges pa yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa zhen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bo snang ba ni nges pa yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa zhen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the appearance of its own nature is ascertained, it is incompatible. The meaning of ‚Äúconceived‚Äù is ‚Äúnot appearing.‚Äù

original: gal te brtags pas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar gyi kha dog nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis spyi'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te brtags pas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar gyi kha dog nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis spyi'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not so because of being imagined,‚Äù up to ‚ÄúIt is not so because of being a universal,‚Äù the meaning of the passage is as follows. Color and impermanence are universals because they are the natures of universals.

original: dngos po ma yin pa nyid du the tshom za ba dang 'brel pa yin te nges bskyed pa'i phyir dang der zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa nyid du the tshom za ba dang 'brel pa yin te nges bskyed pa'i phyir dang der zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is related to the doubt that it is not a real thing because it generates certainty and because it adheres to that.

original: de la zhes bya ba la mi snang ba'i phyir ni mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la mi snang ba'i phyir ni mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In regard to that, it is not manifest because it is not directly perceived.

original: dngos su ma 'brel yang zhes bya ba ni dngos su mi snang ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: dngos su ma 'brel yang zhes bya ba ni dngos su mi snang ba la yang ngo //
translated: Even though it is not directly related, it is also not directly perceived.

original: gal te dngos su mi snang ba yin yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na zhes pas yul yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos su mi snang ba yin yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na zhes pas yul yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin na /
translated: If it is not directly perceived, it is the intrinsic identity alone that is the object, not something else.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang de ltar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang de ltar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If that is so, then the conception of ƒ™≈õvara and so on would also be like that.

original: dngos po ji lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po ji lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What kind of thing is it?

original: rtags las skyes pa'i rtog pa ni rtags kyi rgyu dang khyab byed dag las 'brel pas 'brel pa can de mngon du byed kyang der zhen pa'i phyir de'i yul can yin gyi cig shos na mi yin te /
analyzed: rtags las skyes pa'i rtog pa ni rtags kyi rgyu dang khyab byed dag las 'brel pas 'brel pa can de mngon du byed kyang der zhen pa'i phyir de'i yul can yin gyi cig shos na mi yin te /
translated: A conception that arises from a sign is related to the cause of the sign and the pervasion. Even though it manifests the related object, it is the object of that because it adheres to that, not the other.

original: de dang 'brel pa med pas de'i yul nyid du rnab par gzhag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa med pas de'i yul nyid du rnab par gzhag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not related to that.

original: dngos gang zhes bya ba ni yod pa yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos gang zhes bya ba ni yod pa yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat thing‚Äù means an existent, not the other.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni me ma yin pa dang shing ma yin pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis yin gyi yod pa la sogs pas ni ma yin no //üîΩde 'dra ba de ni zhes bya ba ni du ba ma yin pa @48a * //
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni me ma yin pa dang shing ma yin pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis yin gyi yod pa la sogs pas ni ma yin no // de 'dra ba de ni zhes bya ba ni du ba ma yin pa @48a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat kind‚Äù means by the nature of not being fire, not being fuel, etc., not by the nature of existent, etc.

original: dang shing sha pa ni ma yin pa las log pa'i ngo bo yod pa dang / rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang shing sha pa ni ma yin pa las log pa'i ngo bo yod pa dang / rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat kind‚Äù means not smoke, not a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree, but the nature of the opposite of that, existent, not arising from grass, etc.

original: rtags kyang 'bras bu'am khyab bya yin la de'i ni rgyu ni sbyor bar byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni rgyu nyid kyis sam khyab par byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rtags kyang 'bras bu'am khyab bya yin la de'i ni rgyu ni sbyor bar byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni rgyu nyid kyis sam khyab par byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The reason is the effect or the pervaded, and its cause is the reason for the application, by the nature of cause or by the nature of pervader.

original: sems kyi zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa rtags ma yin pa'i phyir brgyud pa brtan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa rtags ma yin pa'i phyir brgyud pa brtan par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMind‚Äù is the cause of the reason, because ignorance is not a reason. It is a stable continuum.

original: de ltar yang rgyu byed pa yin pa de'i phyir rtags 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang rgyu byed pa yin pa de'i phyir rtags 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Thus, because it is the cause, the reason is the effect.

original: sems la ni gnyi ga yang khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: sems la ni gnyi ga yang khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not correct to say that both are pervasives in the case of mind,üîΩbecause if it were, what would be the point of this?

original: gal te na cung zad 'gas khyab par byed pa yin na ni 'di las cir 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir des bskyed pa ni rtags kyis bskyeng pa'i rtags can gyi blo nyid do //
analyzed: gal te na cung zad 'gas khyab par byed pa yin na ni 'di las cir 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir des bskyed pa ni rtags kyis bskyeng pa'i rtags can gyi blo nyid do //
translated: The point is that the cognition of the reason, which is produced by that, is the cognition of the possession of the reason, which is produced by that.

original: rgyu ji ltar bur gyur pa'i dngos po la ni yul la 'am rgyu mtshan la ste rtags kyi sgo nas de las byung ba'i phyir gzhan med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ji ltar bur gyur pa'i dngos po la ni yul la 'am rgyu mtshan la ste rtags kyi sgo nas de las byung ba'i phyir gzhan med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The object or the reason of the cause, which is of such a kind, is not nonexistent, because it is the source of that.

original: rtag tu snang ba las lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni thob par bya ba'i yul nyid la 'brel ba'i yul du nges pa can nyid yin la /
analyzed: rtag tu snang ba las lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni thob par bya ba'i yul nyid la 'brel ba'i yul du nges pa can nyid yin la /
translated: The cognition of the imperceptible object that is always hidden from view is ascertained as the object that is related to the object to be attained.

original: 'brel pa can mi bslu ba yang mi bslu ba can gyi ngo bo ni tshad ma nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don bshad nas /
analyzed: 'brel pa can mi bslu ba yang mi bslu ba can gyi ngo bo ni tshad ma nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don bshad nas /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe cognition of the object is valid cognition‚Äù is explained as follows: The cognition of the object is valid cognition because it is nondeceptive with regard to the object.üîΩThe verse is stated in order to refute the misconceptions of other commentators.

original: bshad pa byed pa gzhan rnams kyi log par rtog pa'i ched du yang tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa byed pa gzhan rnams kyi log par rtog pa'i ched du yang tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The verse states:

original: de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the cognition of the sign and the cognition of the objectüîΩare nondeceptive because they are related to the nondeceptive.

original: rtags can gyi shes pa bzhin du der zhen pa'i rtags kyi shes pa yang de dang 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir mi bslu ba can yin no //
analyzed: rtags can gyi shes pa bzhin du der zhen pa'i rtags kyi shes pa yang de dang 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir mi bslu ba can yin no //
translated: The cognition of the object is nondeceptive because it is related to the nondeceptive cognition of the sign, just as the cognition of the object is.

original: 'di nyid skyed par byed pa'i phyir rtags kyi shes pas yang de la zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid skyed par byed pa'i phyir rtags kyi shes pas yang de la zhen pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of the sign is also related to the object because it produces the cognition of the object.

original: gang gi phyir tha mi dad par zhen pa nyid kyis der zhen pa nyid ni ma yin te mngon sum la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha mi dad par zhen pa nyid kyis der zhen pa nyid ni ma yin te mngon sum la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the cognition of the object is not related to the object by being undifferentiated from it, because that does not exist in perception.

original: mngon sum nyid kyang de ma yin te ma bzung ba'i rgyun la zhen pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyang de ma yin te ma bzung ba'i rgyun la zhen pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not perception because it produces the cognition of the object related to the object that is not apprehended.

original: gal te don dang 'brel pa zhen pa dang thob pa la sogs pa yod pas tshad ma nyid yin yang ji ltar 'khrul pa can yin te /
analyzed: gal te don dang 'brel pa zhen pa dang thob pa la sogs pa yod pas tshad ma nyid yin yang ji ltar 'khrul pa can yin te /
translated: If it is valid cognition because it is related to the object, and because there is adherence, attainment, etc., how can it be erroneous?

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: Because of contradiction.

original: de'i ngo bor de'i rtags can la zhen par byed pa'i phyir rtags dang rtags can gyi shes pa dag la sngar ji skad bstan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor de'i rtags can la zhen par byed pa'i phyir rtags dang rtags can gyi shes pa dag la sngar ji skad bstan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Because of adherence to the sign as having the nature of that, the cognition of the sign and the cognition of the sign-possessor are erroneous, as previously explained.

original: de yi ngo bos stong de dab //
analyzed: de yi ngo bos stong de dab //
translated: That is empty of the nature of that.

original: ces bya ba ni de mngon @48b sum du byed pa dang bral ba dag go zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi tshig go //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de mngon @48b sum du byed pa dang bral ba dag go zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi tshig go //
translated: This is the statement of the reason: ‚ÄúThey are devoid of the realization of that.‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed pa ni ma 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed pa ni ma 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: Realization of its own nature is non-erroneous.

original: 'grel pa byed pas ni rtags dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du dbye ba med pa'i rtags kyi shes pa ni rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa yin la rtags can gyi shes pa ni 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas ni rtags dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du dbye ba med pa'i rtags kyi shes pa ni rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa yin la rtags can gyi shes pa ni 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa yin par bshad do //
translated: The commentator explains that the cognition of the sign, which is not differentiated as possessing or not possessing the sign, is natural inference, and the cognition of the sign-possessor is inferential cognition of the effect.

original: du ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas gtso bo nyid du yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rtags can gyi shes pa bzhin du rtags kyi shes pa yang rtags kyi yul can yin la rtags can med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi nges pa'i
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas gtso bo nyid du yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rtags can gyi shes pa bzhin du rtags kyi shes pa yang rtags kyi yul can yin la rtags can med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi nges pa'i
translated: Beginning from ‚Äúsmoke, etc.,‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe principal,‚Äù the inferential cognition is like the cognition of the sign, in that it has the sign as its object, and it is ascertained to be non-deceptive, in that it does not occur if the sign does not exist.

original: ngo bo'i rtags kyi bya ba la rtags can yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir gzhan dag gi rang gi 'dod ba bkod ba yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo'i rtags kyi bya ba la rtags can yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir gzhan dag gi rang gi 'dod ba bkod ba yin no //
translated: The sign is also engaged in the activity of the sign, which is the nature of the ascertainment.

original: 'dis kyang pha rol po gzhan gyi rtsod pa sel bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'dis kyang pha rol po gzhan gyi rtsod pa sel bar ston pa ni /
translated: This also shows the elimination of the opponent‚Äôs objection.

original: des na ji skad du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na ji skad du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, as it is said‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bsal nas /
analyzed: de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bsal nas /
translated: Having refuted the claim that it is not the object of that,

original: yul gcig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtags can khyad par du byas pa'i rtags rtogs pa'i mngon sum ma yin par smra ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gcig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtags can khyad par du byas pa'i rtags rtogs pa'i mngon sum ma yin par smra ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äúbecause it has the same object‚Äù means that the sign that is distinguished by the sign is not asserted to be a direct perception that realizes the sign, because it is not a direct perception.

original: de 'di ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa bkod pa sel bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de 'di ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa bkod pa sel bar byed pa ni /
translated: This is the elimination of the opponent‚Äôs objection.

original: 'brel pa nyid kyis rtags 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid kyis rtags 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The relation itself is called the apprehension of the reason.

original: thun mong gi chos dag gi ni spyi'i ngo bo dag gi 'brel pa ni mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: thun mong gi chos dag gi ni spyi'i ngo bo dag gi 'brel pa ni mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: The relation of the general natures of the common properties is not perceived,

original: de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the object of that.

original: rjes su dpag pas 'dzin pa yin na thug pa med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas 'dzin pa yin na thug pa med par bstan pa ni /
translated: If it is apprehended by inference, there is the fault of infinite regress, as stated in the following.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that were so,

original: 'on te goms pa las mngon sum gyi bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags la de nyid du 'dzin pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'on te goms pa las mngon sum gyi bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags la de nyid du 'dzin pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If you think that the apprehension of the reason is a direct perception that arises only when there is the object to be established,

original: de'i tshe mngon sum de rtags can snang ba nyid yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon sum de rtags can snang ba nyid yin /
translated: then that direct perception would be the appearance of the reason.

original: de mi snang ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: de mi snang ba nyid yin na /
translated: If it is not the appearance of that,

original: de med na mi 'byung ba nyid kho na mi 'dzin to zhes zer ba ni 'on te rtags ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba nyid kho na mi 'dzin to zhes zer ba ni 'on te rtags ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it does not apprehend the fact that it does not occur in the absence of that.üîΩIf you say that, then the reason,

original: ji ste de zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: ji ste de zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: is the inference.

original: rtags can med na mi 'byung ba nyid 'dzin pa nyid ni rtags kyi bya ba yin la /
analyzed: rtags can med na mi 'byung ba nyid 'dzin pa nyid ni rtags kyi bya ba yin la /
translated: The apprehension of the fact that it does not occur in the absence of the reason is the function of the reason.

original: 'di la rtags can 'dzin pa rjes su 'jug ba yang yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la rtags can 'dzin pa rjes su 'jug ba yang yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that the apprehension of the sign is also included in that.üîΩFrom great familiarity with it,

original: shin tu goms pa las zhes bya ba ste du ba'i ngo bo ni sprad bu'i tshogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la goms pa yin na /
analyzed: shin tu goms pa las zhes bya ba ste du ba'i ngo bo ni sprad bu'i tshogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la goms pa yin na /
translated: if one is familiar with the nature of smoke, which is characterized by the assembly of causes,

original: me ma rtogs kyang ches @49a * //
analyzed: me ma rtogs kyang ches @49a * //
translated: even without understanding fire,

original: gsal bar nyams su myong bas nye bar mtshon pa pa ni rtags yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal bar nyams su myong bas nye bar mtshon pa pa ni rtags yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the sign is indicated by the very clear experience.

original: goms pa med pa ni ji ltar rtags 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: goms pa med pa ni ji ltar rtags 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: If one is not familiar with it, how can one apprehend the sign?

original: du ba de nyid du zhes bya ba smos te de'i tshe yang me 'dzin pa ma yin yang rtags 'dzin pa la yang 'jug pa yin no//
analyzed: du ba de nyid du zhes bya ba smos te de'i tshe yang me 'dzin pa ma yin yang rtags 'dzin pa la yang 'jug pa yin no//
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that very smoke‚Äù means that even at that time, although one does not apprehend fire, one does engage in the apprehension of the sign.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa nyid du nges pa ni rtags 'dzin pa yin par brjod pa gang yin pa de rtags can 'dzin pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa nyid du nges pa ni rtags 'dzin pa yin par brjod pa gang yin pa de rtags can 'dzin pa kho na yin te /
translated: The apprehension of the sign that is stated to be the ascertainment of the mere relation to something else is just the apprehension of the signifier.

original: rtogs pa can med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa can med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is because there is no understanding.

original: de'i me dang 'brel pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i me dang 'brel pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That is called ‚Äúthe connection with fire.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa las byung ba'i rjes su dbag pa ni med pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las byung ba'i rjes su dbag pa ni med pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The inference that arises from non-apprehension has a non-existent object.

original: rtags dang rtags can gyi shes pa dag la brgyud pas kyang dngos po dang 'brel pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can gyi shes pa dag la brgyud pas kyang dngos po dang 'brel pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the cognition of the sign and the signifier connected with the thing indirectly?

original: dngos po gzhan ni med par bsams nas dngos po'i yul nyid do zhes brjod pas shes pa dang shes bya gzhan dag gi 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan ni med par bsams nas dngos po'i yul nyid do zhes brjod pas shes pa dang shes bya gzhan dag gi 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Thinking that another thing does not exist, it is said to have a thing as its object. It is not the case that the connection of other cognitions and objects is not so,

original: mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because it is direct perception.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rtogs bya la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rtogs bya la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúTherefore, in the case of the thing to be understood.‚Äù

original: khyab byed ni khyab bya'i rgyu mtshan nam de'i ngo bo yang rung dngos po bsgrub par bya ba la yin gyi med pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyab byed ni khyab bya'i rgyu mtshan nam de'i ngo bo yang rung dngos po bsgrub par bya ba la yin gyi med pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: The pervader is the reason for the pervaded or its nature, but it is not the case that it is the thing to be established, because it is not nonexistent.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las skyes pa nyid dngos po bsgrub bya la ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las skyes pa nyid dngos po bsgrub bya la ste /
translated: The identity with that and the arising from that are the thing to be established.

original: dngos po rtogs par bya ba yin gyi med pa la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po rtogs par bya ba yin gyi med pa la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is an existent thing that is to be understood, not a non-existent.

original: gal te dngos po rtogs par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rtogs par bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is an existent thing that is to be understood,

original: dngos po ma yin pa la yang 'bras bu 'gal ba dang / 'gal bas khyab par dmigs pa yang ji ltar yin zhe na //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa la yang 'bras bu 'gal ba dang / 'gal bas khyab par dmigs pa yang ji ltar yin zhe na //
translated: then how is it that a non-existent thing is also perceived as the effect of an incompatible thing and as pervaded by an incompatible thing?

original: de dag kho na de la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag kho na de la yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not just those,

original: de las dngos po grub pa nyid sngar thob pa yin no zhes de ltar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de las dngos po grub pa nyid sngar thob pa yin no zhes de ltar bstan zin to //
translated: because the establishment of an existent thing has already been obtained previously.

original: khyab bya khyab byed nyid grub na /
analyzed: khyab bya khyab byed nyid grub na /
translated: When the pervaded and the pervader are established,

original: de yang ste khyab bya ni de'i blo ste khyab par byed pa'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: de yang ste khyab bya ni de'i blo ste khyab par byed pa'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba la /
translated: then that is, the pervaded is the cognition of that, the cause of the cognition of the pervader.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni khyab byed yin la khyab bya yang de yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni khyab byed yin la khyab bya yang de yin pa'o //
translated: And that is also, the pervader is also the pervaded.

original: dgag pa ste pha rol po rnams kyi 'dod pa'i med pa dang / kho bo cag gi med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la gegs byed pa 'ga' yang med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dgag pa ste pha rol po rnams kyi 'dod pa'i med pa dang / kho bo cag gi med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la gegs byed pa 'ga' yang med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The negation, the non-existence of others' assertions and our own non-existence, is taught to be without any obstruction in the probandum.

original: 'gag pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe very cessation‚Äù is the cessation of the object.

original: ji ltar 'brel pa yin zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni gsal bar byed pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel pa yin zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa ni gsal bar byed pa'i ched du'o //
translated: The commentary on ‚Äúhow can there be a relation?‚Äù is for the purpose of clarifying.

original: thams cad du @49b zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang mi snang ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du @49b zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang mi snang ba la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every case‚Äù means in the case of both the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: 'brel pa med pa ci las she na /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa ci las she na /
translated: How can there be a relation if there is no object?

original: dmigs pa ni dngos po rnams 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin la gang zhig gang gi yin pa de'i med pa ni /üîΩmi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni dngos po rnams 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin la gang zhig gang gi yin pa de'i med pa ni / mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: A valid cognition is that which apprehends things. The non-apprehension of something is the non-apprehension of that which is the object of a valid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir 'dzin par byed pa ni gzung bar bya ba 'jog par byed pa yin gyi de med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dzin par byed pa ni gzung bar bya ba 'jog par byed pa yin gyi de med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because that which apprehends is that which posits the object, it is not the case that the non-apprehension of something is the non-apprehension of its non-existence.

original: tshad ma gzhan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is another valid cognition,

original: re zhig mngon sum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig mngon sum ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not perception,

original: dngos po'i nye ba dang cig shos dag gis nang ba tha dad par 'dzin pa'i phyir de med pas med pa la ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i nye ba dang cig shos dag gis nang ba tha dad par 'dzin pa'i phyir de med pas med pa la ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because it apprehends the difference of the thing from the near and the distant. Therefore, it is not the case that the non-apprehension of something is the non-apprehension of its non-existence.

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa yang 'brel pa med na mi 'gyur la med par rtogs pa ni yod do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa yang 'brel pa med na mi 'gyur la med par rtogs pa ni yod do //
translated: And even in the case of inference, etc., if there is no relation, there is no [inference, etc.], but the cognition of non-existence is [possible].

original: de'i phyir sdud par byed pa yod pa nyid kyis gzhan du mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdud par byed pa yod pa nyid kyis gzhan du mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the impossibility of anything else is taught by the existence of the collector.

original: grub pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The establishment is the ascertainment.

original: don gyis zhes bya ba ni med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyis zhes bya ba ni med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The by implication is because of the cognition of non-existence.

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa ni shugs kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa ni shugs kyis so //
translated: The no other mode is by implication.

original: bzlog pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa bzlog pa ste 'dzin byed gzhan bkag na de med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa bzlog pa ste 'dzin byed gzhan bkag na de med pa kho na'o //
translated: The very reversal is the reversal of the collector. When the other collector is negated, it is only non-existence.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: The in every case is not only in the case of non-apprehension of intrinsic nature.

original: 'gal pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa la yang ngo zhes shes par byed do zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi yin no //
analyzed: 'gal pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa la yang ngo zhes shes par byed do zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi yin no //
translated: It is also in the case of establishing a contradictory effect, it is to be understood.

original: de yang mi dmigs pa la zhes bya ba ni spyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / gzhi ma thun pa nyid med pa'i phyir brjod byas stong pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa la zhes bya ba ni spyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / gzhi ma thun pa nyid med pa'i phyir brjod byas stong pa yin no //
translated: And that is in the case of non-apprehension, because it is included by the universal, and because there is no common locus, it is empty of the expressed.

original: gang du zhes bya ba ni snang ba 'am mi snang ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni snang ba 'am mi snang ba la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere‚Äù means in the visible or invisible.

original: de dgag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i 'o //
analyzed: de dgag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i 'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a negation‚Äù means it is not a thing.

original: rnam pa gcig bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig bstan pa ni /
translated: One kind is indicated:

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means

original: dmigs par rigs pa ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs par rigs pa ni snang ba'o //
translated: that the object is reasonable.

original: gal te gzhan gyi med par rtogs pa ni ji ltar yin du zin kyang khyod kyi ji ltar yin /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi med par rtogs pa ni ji ltar yin du zin kyang khyod kyi ji ltar yin /
translated: If the non-existence of the other is understood, how is it for you?

original: tshad ma las byung ba'i rtogs pa ni dngos su 'brel pa can ma yin pa ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: tshad ma las byung ba'i rtogs pa ni dngos su 'brel pa can ma yin pa ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: The understanding that arises from a valid cognition is not actually related.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIt is non-apprehension.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa las gzhan du dgag pa yin na 'brel pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las gzhan du dgag pa yin na 'brel pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: If non-apprehension is different from negation, there is no relation.

original: kho bo cag gi ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ma yin te /
translated: But it is not for us.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis de'i bar dag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes de'i don la yang tshigs su bcad pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis de'i bar dag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes de'i don la yang tshigs su bcad pa 'di yin no //
translated: Because of non-difference, it is that itself. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: grub pa ni bsgrubs pas so /
