analyzed: grub pa ni bsgrubs pas so /
translated: ‚ÄúEstablished‚Äù means accomplished.

original: tshad mas ni dmigs pa'i tshad ma la brtan nas so //
analyzed: tshad mas ni dmigs pa'i tshad ma la brtan nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy a valid cognition‚Äù means by a valid cognition of perception.

original: smra ba po rnams kyi @50a * //
analyzed: smra ba po rnams kyi @50a * //
translated: of the disputants

original: tha snyad pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: of the logicians

original: don gyis bzlog pa nyid ni ma grub pa dang dgag pa pa dang tshad ma ma yin pa dang mi dmigs pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyis bzlog pa nyid ni ma grub pa dang dgag pa pa dang tshad ma ma yin pa dang mi dmigs pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opposite of the object is nonestablishment, negation, invalidity, and nonapprehension.

original: bsgrub pa ste dmigs pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub pa ste dmigs pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The establishment of the object is the apprehension of the object.

original: dgag pa ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa bzhin du sgrub pa ni ma yin par mi 'gyur la yod pa ni yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa bzhin du sgrub pa ni ma yin par mi 'gyur la yod pa ni yin no //
translated: Negation is not like that, but establishment is.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la rigs pa 'di ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la rigs pa 'di ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this reasoning for the nonapprehension of the nature?

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The apprehension of the contradictory, etc., is not so,

original: yul du mi rung ba nyid kyis mi dmigs pas dgag pa la dbye ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: yul du mi rung ba nyid kyis mi dmigs pas dgag pa la dbye ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni /
translated: because nonapprehension is not suitable as an object, and because there is a division of negation.

original: 'gal ba yang zhes bya ba ste dngos sam zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang zhes bya ba ste dngos sam zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The contradictory is also, that is, the apprehension of the contradictory.

original: brgyud pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brgyud pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Indirectly means by the cause of the contradictory, etc.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba'o //
translated: Here means the cause of the contradictory.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid la med pa ni rmongs pa la tha snyad tsam bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid la med pa ni rmongs pa la tha snyad tsam bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that non-existence is established as a mere convention for the confused?

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa tsam ni yod pa la yang yod pa'i phyir dang / sbyor ba'i dbye ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa tsam ni yod pa la yang yod pa'i phyir dang / sbyor ba'i dbye ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: And since mere non-observation of the non-appearing is also present in the existent, and since the division of the syllogism would be non-existent, what is the use of this?

original: de la yang 'gal ba ma dmigs pa'i dus na yod pa'i snang ba dmigs pa nyid de dang 'dra ba ma thong bas rjes su dpog pa ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la yang 'gal ba ma dmigs pa'i dus na yod pa'i snang ba dmigs pa nyid de dang 'dra ba ma thong bas rjes su dpog pa ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: In response to this, it is explained that when there is non-observation of the contradictory, the observation of the existent appearance is similar to that, and the inference is the cause of the convention of non-existence.

original: dgag pa de yang de rgyu 'am //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dgag pa de yang de rgyu 'am // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: And that negation is the effect of that cause.

original: gang gi zhe na de'i ste dgag bya grang ba'i'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhe na de'i ste dgag bya grang ba'i'o //
translated: What is that? It is the cold.

original: dgag bya de'i shugs kyis 'bras bu'i'o //
analyzed: dgag bya de'i shugs kyis 'bras bu'i'o //
translated: The effect of that object of negation is the effect of the negation.

original: rgyu 'am ni grang ba nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'am ni grang ba nyid kyi'o //
translated: The cause is cold itself.

original: de nyid ni grang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni grang ba'o //
translated: That itself is cold.

original: de'i 'bras bu spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa la dgag pa la yang mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa la dgag pa la yang mthong ba ste /
translated: The effect of that is the bristling of the body-hairs, and so on.

original: tshad ma nyid med pa ston par byed pa ni mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa ste 'bar ba'i ngo bo mngon sum pa ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa dro ba'i reg pa grang ba mi dmigs pa rtogs par byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas
analyzed: tshad ma nyid med pa ston par byed pa ni mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa ste 'bar ba'i ngo bo mngon sum pa ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa dro ba'i reg pa grang ba mi dmigs pa rtogs par byed pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas
translated: The inference of nonapprehension is the proof of the absence of a valid cognition. The direct perception of fire is dependent on a single collection, because the inference of the touch of heat proves the nonapprehension of cold.

original: mi dmigs pa grub po //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa grub po //
translated: Thus nonapprehension is established.

original: des na mi dmigs pa la yang 'gal ba'i 'brel pa gang yin zhes bya ba bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa la yang 'gal ba'i 'brel pa gang yin zhes bya ba bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the question What is the relation of contradiction in nonapprehension? is resolved.

original: de la tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i me'i gzugs kyi dro ba'i bdag nyid kyi reg pa dpog pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i me'i gzugs kyi dro ba'i bdag nyid kyi reg pa dpog pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: In that case, the touch of the nature of heat in the form of fire, which is dependent on a single collection, is inferred.

original: 'gal ba ni @50b grang ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni @50b grang ba'o //
translated: The contradiction is cold.

original: med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni grang ba'i'o //üîΩde lta ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa la'o //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni grang ba'i'o // de lta ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa la'o //
translated: The absence is of cold.üîΩThe opposite is of nonapprehension.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba la sogs pa bsgrub pas mi dmigs pa la rjes su dpag pa med na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba la sogs pa bsgrub pas mi dmigs pa la rjes su dpag pa med na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if there is no inference in nonapprehension due to the establishment of contradiction, etc.,

original: dngos po gcig ces bya ba ni 'gal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gcig ces bya ba ni 'gal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúone thing‚Äù refers to the contradictory, etc.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni grang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni grang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúanother‚Äù refers to the cold, etc.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gang gis so //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gang gis so //
translated: The term ‚Äúfrom which‚Äù refers to the means of valid knowledge.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the non-coexistence.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩ'brel pa 'dzin par byed pa kho nas gzhal bya grub na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid mi dmigs pa'o // 'brel pa 'dzin par byed pa kho nas gzhal bya grub na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of the means of valid knowledge is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: 'brel par grub par bya ba la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel par grub par bya ba la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the object of valid knowledge is established by the mere apprehension of the relation, inference would not be a different means of valid knowledge. This is stated in the line: ‚ÄúIn order to establish the relation.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni me dmigs pa'i ngo bo ste grang ba ma dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni me dmigs pa'i ngo bo ste grang ba ma dmigs pa'o //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe engagement‚Äù refers to the non-apprehension of fire, i.e., the non-apprehension of the cold.

original: du ba me la nges pa nyid du mngon sum gyis grub na du ba mthong ba las me rjes su dpag par 'gyur gyi ;
analyzed: du ba me la nges pa nyid du mngon sum gyis grub na du ba mthong ba las me rjes su dpag par 'gyur gyi ;
translated: If the relation between smoke and fire is established by perception, then fire would be inferred from the perception of smoke.

original: 'gal ba me dmigs 'di la ni med par nges pa nyid de lta byor 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba me dmigs 'di la ni med par nges pa nyid de lta byor 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: But in the case of the contradictory, the non-apprehension of fire, there is no such ascertainment of the absence of fire.

original: mi dmigs pa dang med pa dag la dbye ba me dpa'i phyir 'gal ba can gyi med par rtogs so zhes mi dmigs par rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don gyi tha mi dad pa med na rjes su dpag ba med pas rtsod pa'i gnas su 'gyur
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang med pa dag la dbye ba me dpa'i phyir 'gal ba can gyi med par rtogs so zhes mi dmigs par rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don gyi tha mi dad pa med na rjes su dpag ba med pas rtsod pa'i gnas su 'gyur
translated: Since there is no difference between non-apprehension and non-existence, the opponent says that the non-apprehension of the object of negation is the apprehension of the negation of the object of negation.

original: ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to this is:

original: me las grang ba med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: me las grang ba med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no cold without fire.‚Äù

original: grang ba las gzhan pha ni grang ba med pa ste /
analyzed: grang ba las gzhan pha ni grang ba med pa ste /
translated: Cold is not different from fire.

original: de'i 'bras bu las kyang gzhan pa ni med pa yod par yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu las kyang gzhan pa ni med pa yod par yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to this is: ‚ÄúNor is there anything else that is not the effect of fire.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdro ba'i reg pa la gzugs ni grang ba med pa'i ngo bo la 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o // dro ba'i reg pa la gzugs ni grang ba med pa'i ngo bo la 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: The response to this is: ‚ÄúWhen there is a cold sensation.‚ÄùüîΩThe form that is the effect of a hot sensation is not cold.

original: grang ba med pa yang de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo de'i 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: grang ba med pa yang de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo de'i 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The cold sensation is not different from that form.

original: de la rgyu med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to this is: ‚ÄúIt is not without a cause.‚Äù

original: des na rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called inference.

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum kho na'i rjes su dpag pa las rjes su dpag par bya ba grub pa na rjes su dpag pa med pa'i rtsod pa'i gnas gang yin pa de yang mngon sum las rjes su dpag ba tha dad pa med na de grub pasüîΩde nyid 'grub po zhes bya ba mi rigs so zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum kho na'i rjes su dpag pa las rjes su dpag par bya ba grub pa na rjes su dpag pa med pa'i rtsod pa'i gnas gang yin pa de yang mngon sum las rjes su dpag ba tha dad pa med na de grub pas de nyid 'grub po zhes bya ba mi rigs so zhes zer ba ni /
translated: and the object to be inferred is established by inference alone, which is related to direct perception, then when the object to be inferred is established, the basis of debate, which is without inference, is established by direct perception alone.üîΩIf that is so, then it is not tenable to say that it is established by inference alone.

original: gal te de lta na ni zhes bya ba nas tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes @51a * //üîΩbya ba'i bar du'o //üîΩdmigs pa'i ngo bo yod pa nyid la mi dmigs pa nyid med pa de'i phyir yang rjes su dpag pas med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni mes med par sgrub kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni zhes bya ba nas tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes @51a * // bya ba'i bar du'o // dmigs pa'i ngo bo yod pa nyid la mi dmigs pa nyid med pa de'i phyir yang rjes su dpag pas med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni mes med par sgrub kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.

original: mi dmigs pas med pa'i dbye ba med la gzhan dmigs pa mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas med pa'i dbye ba med la gzhan dmigs pa mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: If you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established by direct perception.üîΩIf you say that, then the object to be inferred would not be established by inference alone, because the object to be inferred is established

original: med pa na ci zhig gang gris sgrub par byed ces bstan pa ni me nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa na ci zhig gang gris sgrub par byed ces bstan pa ni me nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: What is there that is established by what? This is taught by ‚Äúfire itself.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa las med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du gzhan dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo las so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du gzhan dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo las so //
translated: Just as non-existence is from non-apprehension, so too is existence from the nature of the apprehension of something else.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad las gzhan bsgrub par bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad las gzhan bsgrub par bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the probandum is not different from the expression.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa nyid med pa sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir rang gi sgras brjod na yang zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa nyid med pa sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir rang gi sgras brjod na yang zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: In the order taught, because non-apprehension itself establishes non-existence, therefore, when expressed by one‚Äôs own word, it is ‚Äúnon-apprehension.‚Äù

original: yang gi sgras ni rang gi sgra ma yin pas brjod pa ste 'gal ba sgrub pa la me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni rang gi sgra ma yin pas brjod pa ste 'gal ba sgrub pa la me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means expressed by one‚Äôs own word, and the establishment of the contradictory is ‚Äúbecause of the existence of fire.‚Äù

original: ma brjod par yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: ma brjod par yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso unexpressed‚Äù means another.

original: 'gal ba'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir 'grel par ni de'i sgra ni rang gi sgra zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir 'grel par ni de'i sgra ni rang gi sgra zhes bshad do //
translated: Because it is a contradictory situation, in the commentary the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is explained as one‚Äôs own word.

original: rgol ba po gang gi mi dmigs pa de gzhan dmigs pa'i ngo bo mngon sum las sam rjes su dpag pa las 'grub pa med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin par mi 'dod cing dngos po rnams kyi med pa nyid ci las kyang bsgrub par byaüîΩba yin no zhes 'dod pa de dag gi de ni yid smon gyi la thu tsam yin no zhes bstan pa ni //
analyzed: rgol ba po gang gi mi dmigs pa de gzhan dmigs pa'i ngo bo mngon sum las sam rjes su dpag pa las 'grub pa med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin par mi 'dod cing dngos po rnams kyi med pa nyid ci las kyang bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes 'dod pa de dag gi de ni yid smon gyi la thu tsam yin no zhes bstan pa ni //
translated: We do not accept that it is a means of establishing a convention, nor do we accept that the non-existence of things is established by anything.

original: gal te de ni tshad min des //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de ni tshad min des // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is not valid cognition,üîΩthen it is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba nye bar bstan pas sam /
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba nye bar bstan pas sam /
translated: ‚ÄúEverything‚Äù means that it is taught to be contradictory,

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or it means ‚Äúby another means of valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: gang la tshad ma gzhan med par sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi lung la sogs pa 'dod pa de la yang de lta bur 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang la tshad ma gzhan med par sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi lung la sogs pa 'dod pa de la yang de lta bur 'gyur la /
translated: If one asserts that a scripture, etc. is a means of establishing something for which another means of valid knowledge does not exist, then that is the case.

original: de nyid rnam pa 'gas mi dmigs pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa 'gas mi dmigs pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin na /
translated: And that itself is included in some types of non-observation.

original: 'dis ma mtshon pa'i sbyor ba'i dbye bas 'phangs pa nyid yin par bstan pa ne /
analyzed: 'dis ma mtshon pa'i sbyor ba'i dbye bas 'phangs pa nyid yin par bstan pa ne /
translated: This is not the only type of syllogism that can be used to prove the nonexistence of a cause.

original: de dang dgag bya dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang dgag bya dang ngo //
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúAnd the contradictory, and the effect, and the nature.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba ni me la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni me la sogs pa'o //
translated: The contradictory is fire and so on.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni du ba la sogs pa de brjod pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩji skad bstan pa'i mi dmigs pa dang bral ba'i sbyor ba la sogs pa grub pa ma yin @51b par bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni du ba la sogs pa de brjod pa la sogs pa'o // ji skad bstan pa'i mi dmigs pa dang bral ba'i sbyor ba la sogs pa grub pa ma yin @51b par bstan pa ni //
translated: The effect is smoke and so on.

original: 'gal ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe nonestablishment of the proof of the contradictory,‚Äù in order to show that the syllogism and so on that are devoid of the nonexis-tence as described above are not established.

original: 'gal ba bsgrub pa ma grub par /
analyzed: 'gal ba bsgrub pa ma grub par /
translated: The nonestablishment of the proof of the contradictory.

original: thabs dang bcas pa ni dgag pa la rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag mi dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang bcas pa ni dgag pa la rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag mi dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The nonestablishment of the proof of the contradictory is the nonexis-tence of the cause and the pervader, together with the nonexistence of the contradictory.

original: ci zhe na 'gal ba bsgrub pa ma byas pa ste rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi'i mi dmigs pa ma bstan par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci zhe na 'gal ba bsgrub pa ma byas pa ste rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi'i mi dmigs pa ma bstan par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is it? It is the nonestablishment of the proof of the contradictory, that is, the nonexistence of the four kinds of nonexistence of the nature.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i mi dmigs pa dang bral ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i mi dmigs pa dang bral ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe nonestablishment of the proof of the contradictory,‚Äù in order to show that the syllogism and so on that are devoid of the nonexis-tence as described above are not established.

original: smra ba ni tshig ste shi ba'i sems nyid la sogs pa gang gi dang po yin pa de las thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'jig rten gzhan te nying mtshams sbyor ba bkag pa ni 'gal ba bsgrub pa las 'gyur ba yin te gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smra ba ni tshig ste shi ba'i sems nyid la sogs pa gang gi dang po yin pa de las thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'jig rten gzhan te nying mtshams sbyor ba bkag pa ni 'gal ba bsgrub pa las 'gyur ba yin te gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech is words. If it is the first of the mind of the dead, etc., then omniscience and other worlds, i.e., rebirth, are refuted. This is a contradiction, because there is no other.

original: smra ba po nyid la sogs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa de yod na med pa'am de bsal na gnas par rtogs pa grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smra ba po nyid la sogs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa de yod na med pa'am de bsal na gnas par rtogs pa grub pa ma yin te /
translated: If omniscience, etc., exist, then speech, etc., do not exist. If omniscience is refuted, it is not established that speech, etc., exist.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are beyond the senses.

original: skad cig pa ma yin pa nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams la bdag nyid du sgro btags pa snang du rung ba yin na skad cig pa nyid dang 'gal ba yin te de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin pa nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams la bdag nyid du sgro btags pa snang du rung ba yin na skad cig pa nyid dang 'gal ba yin te de bstan pa ni /
translated: Nonmomentariness is the superimposition of identity on blue, etc., which is suitable to appear. It is contradictory to momentariness. The teaching of that is

original: dbang po las 'das zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbeyond the senses.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa dang lan dag gtan med pa 'gal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang lan dag gtan med pa 'gal ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it contradictory to say that afflictions and their antidotes are utterly nonexistent?

original: de yod na de ches shin tu 'grib pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du shes pa dang tshig dag la yang brtag par bya'o zhe na 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yod na de ches shin tu 'grib pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du shes pa dang tshig dag la yang brtag par bya'o zhe na 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: because if it exists, it is very much diminished.üîΩIn the same way, one should investigate knowledge and words.

original: shes pa 'phel pa yang tshig la 'grib pas log par sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa 'phel pa yang tshig la 'grib pas log par sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is unreasonable, because the increase of knowledge is established as the opposite of the diminution of words.üîΩThe explanation is:

original: gal te shes pa khyad par du 'phel pa'i rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te shes pa khyad par du 'phel pa'i rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is said that knowledge is increased,

original: shes pa'i rgyu mtshan tshig yin te de 'phel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyu mtshan tshig yin te de 'phel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the reason for knowledge is words, because they increase. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar na shes pa thams cad dang / tshig dag lhan cig par ma mthong yang 'gal ba rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa thams cad dang / tshig dag lhan cig par ma mthong yang 'gal ba rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, although all knowledge and words are not seen together, there is no realization of contradiction.

original: phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because of the realization of the opposite, it is explained:

original: gal te smra po rig min na //
analyzed: gal te smra po rig min na //
translated: If the speaker is not known,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said.

original: gang gi phyir de 'phel ba la 'grib pa ni 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'phel ba la 'grib pa ni 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the increase of that is not established as a contradiction, this is the meaning.

original: de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi smra ba po nyid ni grang ba mi dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi dro ba'i rig pa bzhin du 'gal @52a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi smra ba po nyid ni grang ba mi dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi dro ba'i rig pa bzhin du 'gal @52a * //
translated: The one who speaks of the distinction of non-apprehension in this way is like the cognition of heat that has the distinction of non-apprehension of cold.

original: ba can ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni de 'dra zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba can ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni de 'dra zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Do you think that it is contradictory?

original: de lta na ni mi dmigs pa nyid sgrub byed yin te 'dis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni mi dmigs pa nyid sgrub byed yin te 'dis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: If so, non-apprehension itself is the proof, because this proves it.

original: bsgrub bya nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni sgrub byed nyid mi dmigs pa khyad par dang ldan par brjod par bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgrub bya nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ni sgrub byed nyid mi dmigs pa khyad par dang ldan par brjod par bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reason for ascertaining the probandum should be stated as the proof itself, which is non-apprehension with a distinction. This is the meaning.

original: khyad par mi ldan na ma nges pa yin par bstan pa ni nges byed min par te sgrub byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par mi ldan na ma nges pa yin par bstan pa ni nges byed min par te sgrub byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it does not have a distinction, it is inconclusive. This is shown by the phrase not a determiner, meaning not a proof.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa tsam las med par ma nges na dngos po yod par nges par 'gyur ro zhes zer na yang de phyir shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa tsam las med par ma nges na dngos po yod par nges par 'gyur ro zhes zer na yang de phyir shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that if non-apprehension alone does not ascertain non-existence, then existence would be ascertained, the response is for that reason, very much so.

original: res 'ga' lkog tu gyur pa ni yod pa dang med pa nyid du tshad ma dag gis nges par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: res 'ga' lkog tu gyur pa ni yod pa dang med pa nyid du tshad ma dag gis nges par byed pa yin la /
translated: Sometimes, the object is hidden, and one ascertains its existence or nonexistence by means of a valid cognition.

original: dbang po ni thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po ni thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: The sense faculties are always hidden.

original: don gyis go ba rtogs pa yin gyi thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes pha rol po khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyis go ba rtogs pa yin gyi thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes pha rol po khas len pa yin no //
translated: The opponent accepts that one understands the object by inference, but not by omniscience.üîΩBut if one knows everything, one sees all things clearly, and this is not incompatible with conceptual thought.

original: thams cad shes pa ni dngos po thams cad gsal bar mthong ba yin zhing rnam par rtog pa dang 'gal ba ma yin nam de'i 'bras bu tshig dang yang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa ni dngos po thams cad gsal bar mthong ba yin zhing rnam par rtog pa dang 'gal ba ma yin nam de'i 'bras bu tshig dang yang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The result of omniscience is incompatible with speech.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la smra ba po nyid 'bras bu 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la smra ba po nyid 'bras bu 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Therefore, one thinks that it follows that the speaker himself is incompatible with omniscience.

original: 'on te gyur na yang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te gyur na yang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But even if it were so, it would be called omniscience.

original: thams cad mthong bar gsal ba yin yang da ltar ba nyid bzhin du rtog pa 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mthong bar gsal ba yin yang da ltar ba nyid bzhin du rtog pa 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Even though one sees everything clearly, conceptual thought operates just as it does in the present.

original: ma brtags ma dpyad par tshig 'jug pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba ni lung rigs rnams kyi dang rnam par rtog pas kyang phyi rol nyid rang gi gzugs brnyan lta bur de nyid du zhe na pas brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ma brtags ma dpyad par tshig 'jug pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba ni lung rigs rnams kyi dang rnam par rtog pas kyang phyi rol nyid rang gi gzugs brnyan lta bur de nyid du zhe na pas brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of the above passage is this: The external world is not expressed by the words of the scriptures or by the concepts of reasoning, because it is not perceived in reality, like a reflection.

original: tshig gi rgyu mtshan rtogs pas de yod kyang de rig pa yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: tshig gi rgyu mtshan rtogs pas de yod kyang de rig pa yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: But even though it does not exist, the existence of the awareness of it is due to the understanding of the reason for the words.

original: brda byed pa po'i rtog pa ni bag chags kyi gnas skabs can yod na de'i phyir tshig med pa ci las yin zhes bla na med pa'i theg pa mi shes pa ma yin pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: brda byed pa po'i rtog pa ni bag chags kyi gnas skabs can yod na de'i phyir tshig med pa ci las yin zhes bla na med pa'i theg pa mi shes pa ma yin pa dag gi'o //
translated: And if the thought of the one who uses the conventional symbol exists, then why is there no word? This is the thought of those who are not ignorant of the unexcelled vehicle.

original: de gnyi ga yang lhan cig tshigs su bcad pa gcig brjod pas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang lhan cig tshigs su bcad pa gcig brjod pas bstan pa ni /
translated: Both of these are indicated by a single verse:üîΩThe external world is not expressed by the words of the scriptures or by the concepts of reasoning, because it is not perceived in reality, like a reflection.

original: don kun gsal ba nyid du ni //
analyzed: don kun gsal ba nyid du ni //
translated: But even though it does not exist, the existence of the awareness of it is due to the understanding of the reason for the words.üîΩAnd if the thought of the one who uses the conventional symbol exists, then why is there no word? This is the thought of those who are not ignorant of the unexcelled vehicle.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Both of these are indicated by a single verse:

original: goms pa las brjod par 'dod pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba la brjod par 'dod pa ni sngar yin la brda byed pa po'i goms pa las ni phyis tshig 'jug par 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: goms pa las brjod par 'dod pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba la brjod par 'dod pa ni sngar yin la brda byed pa po'i goms pa las ni phyis tshig 'jug par 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom practice, the desire to speak arises‚Äù means that the desire to speak arises earlier, and from the practice of the speaker, the word arises later.

original: @52b dpag tu yod pa las gzhan pa ni dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: @52b dpag tu yod pa las gzhan pa ni dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúInfinite‚Äù means other than finite.

original: tshig ces bya ba dang mi 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba dang mi 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe word does not arise‚Äù means that it does not arise.

original: tshig rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i phyogs la lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i phyogs la lan btab pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOf the words‚Äù means that the reply is to the position just stated.

original: kun bslangs pas zhes bya ba ni lus kyi las so //
analyzed: kun bslangs pas zhes bya ba ni lus kyi las so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy instigation‚Äù means by bodily action.

original: nye ba zhes bya ba ni ches dang por nye ba ste /
analyzed: nye ba zhes bya ba ni ches dang por nye ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúProximity‚Äù means the closest proximity.

original: sngar ma mthong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngar ma mthong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúNot previously seen‚Äù means not previously seen.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis de snga ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis de snga ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDirectly‚Äù means by omniscience.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba yang dper na me dang grang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba yang dper na me dang grang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMutually contradictory‚Äù means, for example, ‚Äúhot and cold.‚Äù

original: gal te chos ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis tha mi dad par sgro btags na yang 'gal ba can ni 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te chos ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis tha mi dad par sgro btags na yang 'gal ba can ni 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If it is said that the dharma is different, then even if it is imagined to be non-different from another, the contradiction is shown:

original: tha dad tha dad med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad tha dad med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúdifferent and non-different.‚Äù

original: kha ba med pa ni grang ba med pa na'o //
analyzed: kha ba med pa ni grang ba med pa na'o //
translated: If there is no snow, there is no cold.

original: med pa skye ba ni med pa'i bdag nyid thob pa yin na yod pa dang med pa gcig pa nyid du khas len pa ni 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa skye ba ni med pa'i bdag nyid thob pa yin na yod pa dang med pa gcig pa nyid du khas len pa ni 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If non-existence arises, it would obtain the nature of non-existence. It is contradictory to accept that existence and non-existence are the same. This is the meaning.

original: tha dad med pa zhes bya ba ni khas len pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: tha dad med pa zhes bya ba ni khas len pa'i yul yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-different‚Äù is the object of acceptance.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The very acceptance by another is shown:

original: skye ba ni yod pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni yod pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúarising from existence.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba yang zhes bya ba kho na ma yin te zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang zhes bya ba kho na ma yin te zhes bstan to //
translated: It is not just a contradiction that is shown.

original: tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad par khas lan na 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad par khas lan na 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-different‚Äù means there is no contradiction in accepting difference.

original: dngos po med par bstan pa dang cig shos cig ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med par bstan pa dang cig shos cig ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that non-existence is shown and the other is not.

original: ma tshang ba med par rgyu can yod pa gzhan yod na med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid rjes su brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ma tshang ba med par rgyu can yod pa gzhan yod na med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid rjes su brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe existence of the possessor of the cause without incompleteness‚Äù is a reference to the characteristic of contradiction called ‚Äúthe realization of nonexistence when there is the existence of another.‚Äù

original: ma tshang ba med rgyu can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma tshang ba med rgyu can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of the possessor of the cause without incompleteness‚Äù is the cause.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExistence‚Äù means the persistence of a continuum.

original: gang du 'di mthong zhe na med dang grang ba la'o //
analyzed: gang du 'di mthong zhe na med dang grang ba la'o //
translated: Where is this seen? In the absence of heat and cold.

original: gal te gzhan gyis zhes bya ba 'dis 'gal ba nyid rnam par dpyod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis zhes bya ba 'dis 'gal ba nyid rnam par dpyod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúby another‚Äù analyzes the contradiction.

original: gal te rgyu yod gyur na ni //
analyzed: gal te rgyu yod gyur na ni //
translated: If the cause exists,

original: zhes bya ba ni skad cig phyi ma'i rgyun la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skad cig phyi ma'i rgyun la'o //
translated: the expression ‚Äúif the cause exists‚Äù refers to the continuum of the subsequent moment.

original: rgyu med na des byas pa'i 'bras bu mi skye ba ni 'gal bar byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu med na des byas pa'i 'bras bu mi skye ba ni 'gal bar byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe effect produced by that does not arise if the cause does not exist‚Äù shows that the nonarising of the effect produced by that is not a contradiction.

original: 'on te rgyu yod min na yang //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu yod min na yang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the cause does not exist,üîΩthe expression ‚Äúif the cause does not exist‚Äù refers to the continuum of the subsequent moment.

original: rgyu med pa'i ngo bo'i ma tshang ba nyid 'gal ba can gyis byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i ngo bo'i ma tshang ba nyid 'gal ba can gyis byas pa ma yin te /
translated: The incompleteness of the nature of the cause is not produced by a contradiction.

original: rang nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gal te med pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrang gi ngo bo @53a * //
analyzed: rang nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni gal te med pa zhes bya ba'o // rang gi ngo bo @53a * //
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúBecause it exists.‚Äù

original: ste nus pa can gyi ngo bos so //
analyzed: ste nus pa can gyi ngo bos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIts own nature‚Äù means its own nature that possesses the capacity.

original: yod pa yang 'gal ba can gyis phyin ci log tu byed par mi nus so zhes bstan pa ni yod pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa yang 'gal ba can gyis phyin ci log tu byed par mi nus so zhes bstan pa ni yod pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt cannot be made nonexistent‚Äù means that it cannot be made nonexistent by something that is contradictory to it.

original: de'i rgyu ni ma tshang ba med pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni ma tshang ba med pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts cause‚Äù means the cause that is complete.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba ni ma tshang ba med par skyes pa ma yin pa ni ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba ni ma tshang ba med par skyes pa ma yin pa ni ma tshang ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts own nature‚Äù means that which is not born complete.

original: me gang gi lhan cig byed pa ma yin gyi grang ba de las me med pa dang lhan cig pa'i grang ba ni grang ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: me gang gi lhan cig byed pa ma yin gyi grang ba de las me med pa dang lhan cig pa'i grang ba ni grang ba skyed par byed do //
translated: The fire that is not a co-originator of cold is the fire that is not co-present with cold. The cold that is co-present with the fire that is not a co-originator of cold is the cold that produces cold.

original: lhan cig byed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: lhan cig byed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThe co-originator . . .‚Äù

original: zhan pa dang ches zhan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhan pa dang ches zhan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe weak and the weaker‚Äù means the weak and the weaker.

original: grang bar shin tu gsal ba la mi gsal ba'i me ni ci tsam ma tshang bar byed kyang /
analyzed: grang bar shin tu gsal ba la mi gsal ba'i me ni ci tsam ma tshang bar byed kyang /
translated: No matter how much the fire that is not very clear cold is incomplete,

original: gsal bar 'gyur ba grang ba ni de las bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal bar 'gyur ba grang ba ni de las bzlog pa yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is cold.

original: ches shin tu ba'i de las bzlog pa las ches shin tu gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: ches shin tu ba'i de las bzlog pa las ches shin tu gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction, because the opposite of that is the cause of the opposite of that, and the cause of the opposite of that is the cause of the opposite of that.

original: skad cig phyi ma ldog pa nyid des byas pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la rgyu'i byed pa ni skye ba la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig phyi ma ldog pa nyid des byas pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la rgyu'i byed pa ni skye ba la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Isn‚Äôt the cessation of the subsequent moment caused by that? The activity of the cause is the generation of the effect.

original: rang gi rang bzhin de 'di ni rang gi rgyus nges par bstan par byas pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin de 'di ni rang gi rgyus nges par bstan par byas pa ni /
translated: This is its intrinsic nature.

original: yang na grang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na grang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, it is the cause of cold.üîΩEven in the case of a very bright flame, darkness and cold, which are the causes of that, would not be the causes of that flame, but the causes of the generation of that flame.

original: ches gsal bar 'bar ba'i me'i 'bar ba la yang de ltar gyur pa'i rgyu dang nye bar ldan pa mun pa dang / grang ba dag gi rgyu nyid de dag gi rgyur mi 'gyur gyis skyes zin pa gsal ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ches gsal bar 'bar ba'i me'i 'bar ba la yang de ltar gyur pa'i rgyu dang nye bar ldan pa mun pa dang / grang ba dag gi rgyu nyid de dag gi rgyur mi 'gyur gyis skyes zin pa gsal ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The cause of the generation of that flame is not the cause of the bright flame that has already arisen.

original: shin tu gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: de nyid kyis na zhes bya ba ni snang ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na zhes bya ba ni snang ba skyes pa'o //
translated: By that, the light is generated.

original: snang ba 'byung ba las snga rol na yod pa'i'o //
analyzed: snang ba 'byung ba las snga rol na yod pa'i'o //
translated: It is prior to the appearance of the light.

original: snang ba dang dus mtshungs par ni zhig pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩrang bzhin gang gis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang dus mtshungs par ni zhig pa ma yin par bstan pa ni / rang bzhin gang gis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed at the same time as the light‚Äù is made in order to show that the destruction of the light is not simultaneous with the appearance of the light.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúby any intrinsic reality‚Äù is stated in order to show that the destruction of the light is not simultaneous with the appearance of the light.

original: sa phyogs na zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa phyogs na zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin a particular place‚Äù means ‚Äúin some place.‚Äù

original: yang zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan na yod pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan na yod pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúin another place.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba khyad par ma yin no zhes zer ba ni dus gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba khyad par ma yin no zhes zer ba ni dus gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúat that very time, it is not different‚Äù means ‚Äúat another time.‚ÄùüîΩIf you think that the nonapprehension of something in another place is not the arising of something else at another time, but rather the existence of something else in another place, then the verse says,üîΩ‚ÄúIt is the nonapprehension of something at another time.‚Äù

original: gal te yul gzhan du ma dmigs pa de nyid yul gzhan na yod pa ni dus gzhan na 'byung ba ma yin gyi de nyid du gzhan du yin no snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩdus gzhan ma mthong 'jig yin na //
analyzed: gal te yul gzhan du ma dmigs pa de nyid yul gzhan na yod pa ni dus gzhan na 'byung ba ma yin gyi de nyid du gzhan du yin no snyam du sems pa ni / dus gzhan ma mthong 'jig yin na //
translated: If you think that the nonapprehension of something in another place is not the existence of something else in another place, but rather the existence of something else in another time, then the verse says,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the nonapprehension of something at another time.‚Äù

original: yul gzhan na med kyang yul gzhan na yod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yul gzhan na med kyang yul gzhan na yod pa bzhin du /
translated: If you think that the nonapprehension of something in another place is not the existence of something else in another time, but rather the existence of something else in another place, then the verse says,üîΩ‚ÄúIt is the nonapprehension of something at another time.‚Äù

original: dus gzhan na med pa dus gzhan du grub pa chos can tha @53b dad par rtog pas mi mthun pa nyid brjod pa ni gtan tshigs kyi rgya nyams par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus gzhan na med pa dus gzhan du grub pa chos can tha @53b dad par rtog pas mi mthun pa nyid brjod pa ni gtan tshigs kyi rgya nyams par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthe opponent‚Äôs reason is defeated‚Äù is that the opponent‚Äôs reason is defeated because the opponent conceives of the subject as different at different times, and the opponent‚Äôs reason is defeated because the opponent states that the subject is not different at different times.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par nyid //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par nyid //
translated: The difference between cause and effect

original: ces bya ba ni grang ba ni grang ba gzhan skyed na me dang lhan cig skyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni grang ba ni grang ba gzhan skyed na me dang lhan cig skyed par mi nus so //
translated: If cold produces another cold, it cannot produce fire.

original: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni me dang bral ba grang ba'i rang bzhin skyed par byed pa bzhin du skad cig pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ni skad cig pa skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni me dang bral ba grang ba'i rang bzhin skyed par byed pa bzhin du skad cig pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ni skad cig pa skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Just as that is so, that is, just as cold, which is of the nature of cold, produces fire, which is free from cold, so too, that which is not momentary produces that which is momentary.

original: de bzhin du sngon po nyid la sogs pa rnams kyang sngon po 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin skyed par byed pa yin gyi ser po la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin skyed par byed nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon po nyid la sogs pa rnams kyang sngon po 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin skyed par byed pa yin gyi ser po la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin skyed par byed nus pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, blue, etc., produces that which is of the nature of blue alone, and not that which is of the nature of yellow, etc.

original: me dang lhan cig pa las de dang bral ba'i grang ba ni sngon po dang ser po kho na bzhin du 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: me dang lhan cig pa las de dang bral ba'i grang ba ni sngon po dang ser po kho na bzhin du 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cold that is separated from fire by being together with fire is contradictory, just like blue and yellow. This is shown by ‚ÄúTherefore, . . .‚Äù

original: rgyu'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pas so //
analyzed: rgyu'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of the cause‚Äù means as it has been explained.

original: med pa'i sgrub pa'i 'gal ba dmigs pa gang yin pa de ma yin no zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: med pa'i sgrub pa'i 'gal ba dmigs pa gang yin pa de ma yin no zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe contradiction of the non-existence that is the perception of the non-apprehension of something is not that.‚Äù

original: bzlog pa la ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'jig rten pha rol yang yod pa las so //
analyzed: bzlog pa la ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'jig rten pha rol yang yod pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe opposite‚Äù means from the existence of omniscience and a world beyond.

original: ji ltar dmigs pa las yod pa grub pa de bzhin du mi dmigs pa las kyang med pa grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa las yod pa grub pa de bzhin du mi dmigs pa las kyang med pa grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Just as existence is established from the apprehension, is non-existence not also established from the non-apprehension?üîΩHow is it that the non-apprehension does not ascertain?

original: mi dmigs pa nges par mi byed pa ji ltar yin snyam du sems pa la ji ltar dngos po nyid bsgrub pa na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nges par mi byed pa ji ltar yin snyam du sems pa la ji ltar dngos po nyid bsgrub pa na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the thing itself is established . . .‚Äù

original: sgrub pa ni dmigs pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni dmigs pa las ma yin no //
translated: The establishment is not from the apprehension.

original: dngos po rnams kyi ste lkog tu gyur pa rnams kyi sgrub par byed pa ni nges pa la'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ste lkog tu gyur pa rnams kyi sgrub par byed pa ni nges pa la'o //
translated: The proof of things, i.e., of hidden phenomena, is by means of inference.

original: de bzhin du dngos po nyid ldog pa ni ldog par byed pa yin gyi dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po nyid ldog pa ni ldog par byed pa yin gyi dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Similarly, the negation of a thing is by means of a negation, not by means of an observation.

original: 'dis grub par byed pas sgrub par byed pa ste 'brel pa can no zhes bstan pa ni ji ltar 'brel ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis grub par byed pas sgrub par byed pa ste 'brel pa can no zhes bstan pa ni ji ltar 'brel ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúrelation‚Äù is used to indicate that the proof is a related entity.

original: dper na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po sgrub par rtogs par byed pa pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po sgrub par rtogs par byed pa pa'i tshig go //
translated: For example, the words ‚Äúeffect‚Äù and ‚Äúpervasion‚Äù are used to indicate the proof of a thing.

original: 'dod pa tsam las byung ba dang dngos po ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes zhar la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam las byung ba dang dngos po ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes zhar la bstan pa ni /
translated: The words ‚Äúmere desire‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-entity‚Äù are used to indicate the non-proof.

original: 'dis ni rtogs pas sbyar ba'i chos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtogs pas sbyar ba'i chos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is used to indicate the property to be established.

original: sgrub byed ma yin pa ci las she na /
analyzed: sgrub byed ma yin pa ci las she na /
translated: Why is it not a proof?

original: gang las gang na'ang srid phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang las gang na'ang srid phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is possible anywhere.

original: dngos su ba'i chos spyi bstan pa sgrub byed yin gyi @54a * //
analyzed: dngos su ba'i chos spyi bstan pa sgrub byed yin gyi @54a * //
translated: The explicit teaching of the general property is the proof,üîΩnot the other.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: ci dngos po thams cad nyid rang log pas dngos po thams cad nyid ldog par byed dam 'on te cung zang kho na yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ci dngos po thams cad nyid rang log pas dngos po thams cad nyid ldog par byed dam 'on te cung zang kho na yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: Is it that all things are negated by the negation of themselves, or is it that only some are?

original: de la yang khyab par byed pa'i chos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la yang khyab par byed pa'i chos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In this regard, the so-called ‚Äúpervasive property‚Äù is the pervader.

original: khyab byed ni rang log pas khyab bya ldog par byed de /
analyzed: khyab byed ni rang log pas khyab bya ldog par byed de /
translated: The pervader is negated by the negation of itself, and the pervaded is also negated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgrub byed kyang thams cad ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgrub byed kyang thams cad ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the proof is not of all things, but of what?

original: de log pas gang yin pa gang 'jug pas 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de log pas gang yin pa gang 'jug pas 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is of that which is pervaded by the pervader.

original: de'i phyir dngos nyid sgrub pa na //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos nyid sgrub pa na //
translated: Therefore, the statement,üîΩ‚ÄúThe proof of the nature of things

original: dngos po rnams kyi sgrub byed 'dod //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi sgrub byed 'dod //
translated: Is asserted to be the proof of things,‚Äù

original: ces bya ba yang thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba yang thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: is not about all things.

original: spyi ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa snga ma'i don mdor bsdu bas sdud par byed pa'i phyir bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: spyi ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa snga ma'i don mdor bsdu bas sdud par byed pa'i phyir bsdu ba yin te /
translated: It is a compendium because it summarizes the meaning of the earlier verse that generally teaches the definition of the reason.

original: rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is the meaning of the definition‚Äù is this:

original: khyab par byed pa log pa ni rang log pa yin la /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa log pa ni rang log pa yin la /
translated: The reversal of the pervasion is the reversal of the property of the subject.

original: de yang mngon sum gyis grub pa yin nam gzhan dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de ji skad rnam pa 'gar zhes brjod ces zer ba la /
analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyis grub pa yin nam gzhan dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de ji skad rnam pa 'gar zhes brjod ces zer ba la /
translated: And that is established by direct perception or by the nature of the object itself. So why is it said, ‚Äúin any way‚Äù?

original: med pa la ni de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: med pa la ni de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of nonexistence‚Äù means

original: tshad ma med pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: the absence of a valid cognition is nonapprehension.

original: de nyid kyi khyab par byed pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyab par byed pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: That is the pervasion of the property of the subject itself.

original: med pa la ni zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa la ni zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of nonexistence‚Äù refers to the probandum.

original: shin tu rmongs pa'i don du rtags brjod pa gang gi phyir yin pa de'i phyir de ltar brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu rmongs pa'i don du rtags brjod pa gang gi phyir yin pa de'i phyir de ltar brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reason is stated for the sake of those who are very confused. Therefore, it is said in that way. This is the meaning.

original: rmongs pa ma yin pa rnams la yang rtags nyid ci'i phyir ma yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rmongs pa ma yin pa rnams la yang rtags nyid ci'i phyir ma yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: Why is it not a reason for those who are not confused?

original: gnag rdzi mo'i bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnag rdzi mo'i bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the so-called ‚Äúcowherdess argument.‚Äù

original: ma bsgribs pa zhes bya ba la bsgribs pa ni lkog tu gyur pa mi rigs pa ma grangs pa yin la /
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa zhes bya ba la bsgribs pa ni lkog tu gyur pa mi rigs pa ma grangs pa yin la /
translated: Unconcealed means not concealed, not hidden, not unreasonable, and not unmentioned.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ma bsgribs pa ste rtags la ltos pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ma bsgribs pa ste rtags la ltos pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is unconcealed, not relying on a reason.

original: gang gi phyir dmigs su rung ba ma dmigs pa ni med pa nyid kyi tha dad kyi yul can nyid du byas pa rnams la yang nges pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs su rung ba ma dmigs pa ni med pa nyid kyi tha dad kyi yul can nyid du byas pa rnams la yang nges pa yin la /
translated: Because the non-observation of what is suitable to be observed is the very basis for the absence of something, it is ascertained for those who have done the enumeration.

original: des na de'i nges pa la khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa rjes su dran pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: des na de'i nges pa la khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa rjes su dran pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of that is the recollection of the non-observation of the pervader, etc.

original: rnam 'grel gyi rigs pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi rigs pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: This is said to contradict the reasoning of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika.

original: yang na brjod pa gang yin pa de shin tu rmongs pa'i don du zhes ngag gi don mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na brjod pa gang yin pa de shin tu rmongs pa'i don du zhes ngag gi don mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Or, what is said is for the sake of great confusion, holding the meaning of the words to be supreme.

original: shes pa gcig la 'drel ba la gang @54b gi tshad ma med pa nyid de kho na'i mi dmigs pa yin gyi mi snang ba'i med pa'am /
analyzed: shes pa gcig la 'drel ba la gang @54b gi tshad ma med pa nyid de kho na'i mi dmigs pa yin gyi mi snang ba'i med pa'am /
translated: In the case of a single cognition, the non-apprehension of just that which has no valid cognition is non-apprehension, not the non-appearance of non-existence,

original: med pa'i tha snyad la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad la ni ma yin te /
translated: or the convention of non-existence, because of non-apprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa'i bar du rmongs pa'i don du yin no zhes bya ba ni bshad pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa'i bar du rmongs pa'i don du yin no zhes bya ba ni bshad pa gzhan yin no //
translated: Up to this point, it is said to be for the purpose of confusion. This is another explanation.

original: dmigs pa log pa yang rang bzhin mi dmigs ngo bo ni dngos po'i ldog byed nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: dmigs pa log pa yang rang bzhin mi dmigs ngo bo ni dngos po'i ldog byed nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the negation of the object also the negation of the nature, and isn't the negation of the thing itself the negation of the object?

original: dngos po nyid log bzhin pa ni ji ltar ldog byed yin par brjod snyam du sems la 'grel pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po nyid log bzhin pa ni ji ltar ldog byed yin par brjod snyam du sems la 'grel pa bshad pa ni /
translated: How can that which is being negated be said to be the negator?

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang go bar byed pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang go bar byed pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary explains: Isn't the non-apprehension of the nature also the non-apprehension of the object?

original: gnag rdzi mo la sogs pa yang rnam par dpyod pa dang / ma bral ba na 'di la mi rmongs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnag rdzi mo la sogs pa yang rnam par dpyod pa dang / ma bral ba na 'di la mi rmongs pa yin no //
translated: Even cowherdesses and so on, when not separated from analysis, are not confused about this.

original: de lta na rmongs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na rmongs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what is confusion?

original: grangs can zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: grangs can zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said to be the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: gang du tshad ma lnga po dag /
analyzed: gang du tshad ma lnga po dag /
translated: where the five valid cognitions

original: dngos po'i ngo bor ma skyes pa //üîΩdngos po'i med pa rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bor ma skyes pa // dngos po'i med pa rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: do not arise as the entity of an entity,

original: de la med pa tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: de la med pa tshad ma nyid //
translated: non-entity is realized?

original: ces bya ba'i rigs pa ma yin nam zhes pa la shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la tshad ma lnga po log pa yang rang bzhin nam khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rigs pa ma yin nam zhes pa la shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la tshad ma lnga po log pa yang rang bzhin nam khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: In response to that, it is taught that even the negation of the five valid cognitions in regard to something extremely hidden is only the non-observation of a nature or a pervader:

original: mi dmigs pa ni 'di tsam zhig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni 'di tsam zhig ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is just non-observation.

original: mi dmigs pa de yang dngos su med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de yang dngos su med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can no //
translated: Moreover, that non-observation has the result of ascertaining non-existence.

original: 'di tsam zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Just this will be explained.

original: rgyu 'am rang bzhin te khyab par byed par snang bar 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu 'am rang bzhin te khyab par byed par snang bar 'dod pa yin la /
translated: A cause or nature that is a pervader is what is asserted to appear.

original: snang ba med pa ni ma dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba med pa ni ma dmigs pa ste /
translated: The non-appearance of that is non-observation.

original: rung ba mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rung ba mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with ‚Äúthe non-observation of a possible object.‚Äù

original: thams cad du mngon sum log pa ni med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin zhing rjes su dpag pa lung la sogs pa'i yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du mngon sum log pa ni med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin zhing rjes su dpag pa lung la sogs pa'i yang ma yin no //
translated: In all cases, the negation of perception is not a proof of nonexistence, nor is it inference, scriptural authority, or the like.

original: gang gi phyir de ni dngos po mthong ba ma yin zhing khyab par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni dngos po mthong ba ma yin zhing khyab par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not a perception of a thing, nor is it a pervasion.

original: rgyu 'am rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni snang du rung ba tsam nye bar mtshon pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu 'am rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni snang du rung ba tsam nye bar mtshon pa yin la /
translated: The terms cause and nature merely indicate that which is suitable to appear.

original: byed pa po dang khyad byed dang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rnams ni med /
analyzed: byed pa po dang khyad byed dang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rnams ni med /
translated: The nonapprehension of an agent, differentiator, and nature are proofs.

original: sgrub par byed pa yin par 'di tsam zhig ces bya bas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yin par 'di tsam zhig ces bya bas bstan pa yin te /
translated: This much is indicated by the term ‚Äúproof.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyi sgra ni dngos po'i ngo bo dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo la yang 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir 'grel par rnam pa gsum kho na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sgra ni dngos po'i ngo bo dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo la yang 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir 'grel par rnam pa gsum kho na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the term nature applies to the nature of a thing and the nature of a pervasion, the commentary states ‚Äúonly three.‚Äù

original: gzhan ma yin pa ni rgyu la sogs pa las gzhan pa'o //üîΩrnam @55a * //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa ni rgyu la sogs pa las gzhan pa'o //üîΩrnam @55a * //
translated: Nondifference is the opposite of cause and so on.üîΩThe nonapprehension of a nature is a proof.

original: pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rung ba nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rung ba nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot in any other way‚Äù means that it is not suitable.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang / mi dmigs pa de dag gis bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang / mi dmigs pa de dag gis bskyed pa yin la /
translated: It is produced by those effects, natures, and non-apprehensions.

original: des na zhes bya ;
analyzed: des na zhes bya ;
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means

original: ba ni rtags can gyi shes pas so //
analyzed: ba ni rtags can gyi shes pas so //
translated: by the cognition that has the sign.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means impermanent with respect to color and so on.

original: dngos po'i chos ma yin pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos ma yin pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Impermanence and so on are not properties of real things.

original: gal te dngos med ngo bo min /
analyzed: gal te dngos med ngo bo min /
translated: If non-things are not natures,

original: de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: that itself is the definition.

original: de ltar grub par bsgrubs phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar grub par bsgrubs phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established in that way.

original: zhes bya bas rjes su dpag par rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya bas rjes su dpag par rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin nam /
translated: Thus, is inference not a cognition that has a real thing as its object?

original: de bzhin du mngon sum gyi rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yang yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon sum gyi rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yang yin na /
translated: In the same way, if the cognition of inference is also a direct perception,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi dang sbyor ba'i kha dog gi spyi'i snang ba da lta ci zhig yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi dang sbyor ba'i kha dog gi spyi'i snang ba da lta ci zhig yin /
translated: what is the appearance of the generality of impermanence and the generality of color that is connected to it now?

original: gang du kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gang du kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The idea is that because it is applied to the universal color.

original: gal te kha dog 'di mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te kha dog 'di mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were said, This color is impermanent,

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'i yid las so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'i yid las so //
translated: By inference means from the connecting mind.

original: de bstan pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of that is the universal and particular characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang kha dog nyid kyang tha snyid 'dog par ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam pa 'di dag tu mngon sum gyis sam rjes su dpag pas kho dog la sogs pa'i spyi bzung nas rnam pa gzhan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang kha dog nyid kyang tha snyid 'dog par ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam pa 'di dag tu mngon sum gyis sam rjes su dpag pas kho dog la sogs pa'i spyi bzung nas rnam pa gzhan bstan pa ni /
translated: The particular characteristic and the universal characteristic are not designated as color, therefore, having grasped the universal of color and so on by direct perception or inference in these aspects, the teaching of other aspects is

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: by impermanence and so on.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni sngon du byung ba'i tshad ma'i bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni sngon du byung ba'i tshad ma'i bya ba bstan to //
translated: By this much, the activity of the previous valid cognition is taught.

original: de'i 'og tu yid kyi mtshams sbyor ba ste //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yid kyi mtshams sbyor ba ste //
translated: After that, the connecting of the mind,

original: sbyor ba bstan pa ni yid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba bstan pa ni yid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of the connection is of the mind.

original: gzhan du mngon sum gyi nges pa'am rjes su dpag pa la ni rim pa 'di ma yin te ;üîΩgzung ba la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du mngon sum gyi nges pa'am rjes su dpag pa la ni rim pa 'di ma yin te ; gzung ba la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: In other cases, there is no such order in the case of a cognition of perception or inference.üîΩBecause the object is grasped by the subject.

original: de lta tshad ma nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta tshad ma nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is taught by the verse:üîΩIf it is valid cognition, it is either distinct or indistinct.

original: tshad ma nyid yin na so so ba'am so so ba ma yin pa zhes sems pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid yin na so so ba'am so so ba ma yin pa zhes sems pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the thought.

original: yang na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas mi rtag pa'i kha dog spyi la sbyor ba yin na /
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas mi rtag pa'i kha dog spyi la sbyor ba yin na /
translated: Or, if the valid cognition of inference is applied to the universal of impermanent color,

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa'i chos can la tshad ma gzhan thob pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa'i chos can la tshad ma gzhan thob pa'i skyon med do //
translated: there is no fault of obtaining another valid cognition in the subject established by perception.

original: mngon sum gyis rim pa ni kha dog gi mtshan nyid la sbyor ba ni yid kyi nges pa ste tshad ma ma yin par bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rim pa ni kha dog gi mtshan nyid la sbyor ba ni yid kyi nges pa ste tshad ma ma yin par bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The order of perception is taught to be mental certainty applied to the definition of color, but it is not valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: zhar la byung ba'i tshad ma nyid ni dgag par 'os pa yin pa'i phyir zhar la byung ba @55b bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhar la byung ba'i tshad ma nyid ni dgag par 'os pa yin pa'i phyir zhar la byung ba @55b bstan pa ni /
translated: The digression is taught because it is appropriate to refute valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse says by inference.

original: chos can te spyi mngon sum gyis sam rjes su dpag pas 'dzin na tshad ma gzhan yul de la'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos can te spyi mngon sum gyis sam rjes su dpag pas 'dzin na tshad ma gzhan yul de la'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the universal, i.e., the subject, is apprehended by perception or inference, then another valid cognition does not have that as its object.

original: gnyi ga la skabs kyis byung ba'i rgol ba gnyis la re zhig kha dog la sogs pa ni gzugs dang rol sogs pa mngon sum gyis grub pa mi rtag pa nyid ni med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de 'grub mi srid do zhes zer ba ni mi
analyzed: gnyi ga la skabs kyis byung ba'i rgol ba gnyis la re zhig kha dog la sogs pa ni gzugs dang rol sogs pa mngon sum gyis grub pa mi rtag pa nyid ni med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de 'grub mi srid do zhes zer ba ni mi
translated: In both cases, the two opponents who have arisen in the context are as follows. First, it is said that color, etc. and form, etc. are established by perception, but impermanence does not exist as an entity, so it is impossible to establish it.

original: rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is called impermanence.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po las mi rtag pa nyid gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po las mi rtag pa nyid gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Impermanence is not different from things like blue,

original: mtha'i skad cig ma mthong ba la tha dad par ma nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha'i skad cig ma mthong ba la tha dad par ma nges pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not ascertained as different in seeing the final moment.

original: sngar yang dngos po dmigs pa tha mi dad pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi snying po can nyid kho na yin no zhes bstan pa ni gzhan du med ces zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar yang dngos po dmigs pa tha mi dad pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi snying po can nyid kho na yin no zhes bstan pa ni gzhan du med ces zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught that even before, the essence of impermanence is not different from the observed thing.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa las so //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa las so //
translated: The word before is from the conceptualization.

original: gal te kha dog la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa mi rtag pa nyid yin na kha log la sogs pa mi rtag go zhes brjod bya tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te kha dog la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa mi rtag pa nyid yin na kha log la sogs pa mi rtag go zhes brjod bya tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If impermanence is not different from color, etc., then it cannot be said that color, etc., are impermanent, because the expressed meaning is not different.

original: gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur gyi rnam grangs nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la du ma'i dngos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur gyi rnam grangs nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la du ma'i dngos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One might think that there would not be a common locus, but rather a mere synonym.

original: ldog pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan gyi brjod bya'i khyad par las ni skyon 'di med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldog pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan gyi brjod bya'i khyad par las ni skyon 'di med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
