translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe reason for the distinction in the contradistinction‚Äù is that there is no fault due to the distinction in the expressed meaning.

original: mtshungs pa can rnams kyi zhes bya bas don dam pa pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid du dogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mtshungs pa can rnams kyi zhes bya bas don dam pa pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid du dogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: By ‚Äúthose that are similar,‚Äù is the doubt of ultimate diversity not refuted?

original: don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lan gyi don to //
analyzed: don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lan gyi don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not ultimate‚Äù is the meaning of the reply.

original: re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid brjod bya ma yin zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid brjod bya ma yin zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: First, the teaching that its own characteristic is not the expressed meaning is

original: du ma'i dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du ma'i dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe many things.‚Äù

original: rnam par brtags pa don dam pa pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa don dam pa pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the ultimate is not the object of conceptual activity isüîΩ‚Äúthe ultimate.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù means ‚Äúdistinct.‚Äù

original: brtags pa'i spyi la gzhi mthun pa gsum gyis yin na /
analyzed: brtags pa'i spyi la gzhi mthun pa gsum gyis yin na /
translated: If the commonness of the imagined is the three common bases,

original: rnam par rtog pa gzung ba la 'dzin pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzung ba la 'dzin pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: how can the apprehension of the object of the imagination be the subject?

original: bstan pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyi'i chos dngos po rnams kyi de dang de las tha dad pa mngon sum gyis grub pa rten yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyi'i chos dngos po rnams kyi de dang de las tha dad pa mngon sum gyis grub pa rten yin te /
translated: The response: The commonness of the imagination is the basis of the things, because the direct perception establishes their difference from that and from each other.

original: brtags pa ni de mthong ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa ni de mthong ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The imagination is based on it, because it arises from the perception of it.

original: 'on te tha dad pa mthong ba yang nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa mthong ba yang nges pa ma yin te /
translated: But if the perception of the difference is not certain,

original: 'ga' zhig la des pa'i phyir rjes su dpag par 'dod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la des pa'i phyir rjes su dpag par 'dod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: the desire to infer is indicated:

original: de ma grub na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnges pa'am zhes bya ba ni gzhi mi mthun @56a * //
analyzed: de ma grub na zhes bya ba'o // nges pa'am zhes bya ba ni gzhi mi mthun @56a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is not established.‚Äù

original: ba ste ba lang ngam rta'am skyes bu bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ba ste ba lang ngam rta'am skyes bu bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù means a different basis, like a cow, a horse, or a man.

original: dngos po snang bzhin ba la de'i rtog pa ni tha snyad la mthar thug pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po snang bzhin ba la de'i rtog pa ni tha snyad la mthar thug pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the imagination of that in the appearance of a thing just a convention?

original: lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di ni ba lang yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du 'di me dang ldan pa yin te du ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes me yod par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di ni ba lang yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du 'di me dang ldan pa yin te du ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes me yod par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Just as one says, ‚ÄúThis is a cow because it has a dewlap, etc.,‚Äù so one says, ‚ÄúThis has fire because it has smoke.‚Äù

original: gal te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called an inference from an effect.

original: 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa la dngos po ma mthong ba kho nas gzhan la brten pa yin par bstan pa ni gal te der yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa la dngos po ma mthong ba kho nas gzhan la brten pa yin par bstan pa ni gal te der yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In an inference from an effect, one infers the other thing, i.e., the cause, only from the non-perception of the thing, i.e., the effect. This is shown in the words, ‚ÄúIf there, etc.‚Äù

original: tshad ma gzhan 'jug na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan 'jug na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If another valid cognition is operative, i.e., if it depends on another valid cognition.

original: de 'dzin na ni med des na'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin na ni med des na'o //
translated: If it grasps that, it does not exist.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa me 'dzin pa ni de tha mi dad pa khyad par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa me 'dzin pa ni de tha mi dad pa khyad par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The grasping of that, i.e., the grasping of the particular of that, i.e., of fire, is not different from the grasping of that, i.e., of smoke.

original: me'i khyad par las tha dad pa tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: me'i khyad par las tha dad pa tsam ma yin te /
translated: It is not just different from the particular of fire.

original: de mi 'dzin na yang thams cad mi 'dzin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi 'dzin na yang thams cad mi 'dzin pa de'i phyir /
translated: If it does not grasp that, it does not grasp everything. Therefore,

original: lkog shal la sogs pa'i ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa dngos po 'dzin pa las 'di tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa'i ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa dngos po 'dzin pa las 'di tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the conception of a cow, such as a dewlap, is not different from the apprehension of a thing.

original: skra shad la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyis dmigs pa rnams la yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyis dmigs pa rnams la yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
translated: With respect to the hair, etc., means with respect to the objects perceived by those who have eye disease, not with respect to all.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration that it is because it is a future event is ‚Äúthe reason of essence.‚Äù

original: lkog shal la sogs pa la mthong ba na ba lang nyid ces tha snyad byed pa ma yin nam me la ni ma mthong na ji ltar tha snyad byed ce na de dang 'brel pa can mthong ba'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa la mthong ba na ba lang nyid ces tha snyad byed pa ma yin nam me la ni ma mthong na ji ltar tha snyad byed ce na de dang 'brel pa can mthong ba'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: But is not the convention ‚Äúcow‚Äù made when a dewlap, etc., is seen? And since it is not seen in fire, how can the convention be made? There is no fault, because it is seen in what is related to it.

original: de bstan pa ni rtags rtogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni rtags rtogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The demonstration of that is ‚Äúbecause of the understanding of the reason.‚Äù

original: gal te yang spyi'am khyad par ma mthong na de dang 'brel pa can la de dang tha snyad yin pas de'i tha snyad ni de la'am /
analyzed: gal te yang spyi'am khyad par ma mthong na de dang 'brel pa can la de dang tha snyad yin pas de'i tha snyad ni de la'am /
translated: If one does not see a universal or a particular, then there is no difference between the expression of that and the expression of that which is related to that.

original: de dang 'brel pa can la zhes bya bar khyad par med do //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can la zhes bya bar khyad par med do //
translated: The expression is either of that or of that which is related to that.

original: gang gis kyang ma rtogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gis kyang ma rtogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúis not understood by anyone‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: spyi rtogs pa yin na yang ma rtogs pa'i khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi rtogs pa yin na yang ma rtogs pa'i khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: If a universal is understood, then there is no difference in the understanding of that which is related to it.

original: gal te rtogs pa nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa la the tshom ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa la the tshom ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: If it is understood, then it is not doubt, because it is understood.

original: ma rtogs pa la ni 'di spyi'am khyad par yin zhes bya ba 'byung ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la ni 'di spyi'am khyad par yin zhes bya ba 'byung ba kho na yin la /
translated: But if it is not understood, then there is the question of whether it is a universal or a particular.

original: ma rtogs pa blo la mi gnas pa ni the tshom gyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa blo la mi gnas pa ni the tshom gyi yul ma yin te /
translated: That which is not understood and does not appear to the mind is not the object of doubt,

original: the tshom ni der mngon par zhen @56b ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i phyir the tshom las 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: the tshom ni der mngon par zhen @56b ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i phyir the tshom las 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: because doubt has the nature of adherence to that. Therefore it is not reasonable to say that one engages in doubt because of that.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po las gzhan ma yin la dngos po'i chos nyid yin na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du rdo rje pha lam la sogs pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni gal te mi rtag pa la sogs paüîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po las gzhan ma yin la dngos po'i chos nyid yin na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du rdo rje pha lam la sogs pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: were not different from a thing, then a diamond, etc., would be impermanent, like a pot, etc.

original: de la mtha'i skad cig mthong ba'i lam med par nges pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la mtha'i skad cig mthong ba'i lam med par nges pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no certainty that the final moment is not seen on the path of seeing.

original: la lar ni rdo rje pha lam la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: la lar ni rdo rje pha lam la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In some cases, it is in a diamond, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du'o //
translated: That is, in impermanence.

original: yongs su mi shes pa ni ma des pa'o//
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa ni ma des pa'o//
translated: Ignorance is non-understanding.

original: 'dra ba nyid gzhan rgyun du 'jug pas yod pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dra ba skyed par byed pa med pa'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no zhes 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid gzhan rgyun du 'jug pas yod pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dra ba skyed par byed pa med pa'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no zhes 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Because of the existence of continuity through mere similarity, and because of the absence of a cause of dissimilarity, there is the error that ‚Äúthat is this.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir mthong ba yang tha dad par nges pa gsal po med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni mig 'phrul gyi ri lu dag gi tha dad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba yang tha dad par nges pa gsal po med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni mig 'phrul gyi ri lu dag gi tha dad pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not clearly ascertained that it is seen as different, it is shown that it is not seen at all, like the difference of the magic eye-lotion.

original: ri lu gcig bstan nas de las gzhan bstan na tha dad pa yin yang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: ri lu gcig bstan nas de las gzhan bstan na tha dad pa yin yang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir //
translated: When one eye-lotion is shown and another is shown, although they are different, they are similar.

original: de nyid yin pa'i blo la ni mthong ba yang ma mthong ba dang 'dra ba yin te ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid yin pa'i blo la ni mthong ba yang ma mthong ba dang 'dra ba yin te ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the cognition that they are the same, even though it is seen, it is as if it is not seen, because it is not ascertained.

original: de phyi ma'i ri lu gzhan gyis mthong ba bor nas rtog pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: de phyi ma'i ri lu gzhan gyis mthong ba bor nas rtog pa bskyed nas /
translated: When the later eye-lotion is seen, the previous one is discarded and a conception is generated.

original: bsgribs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgribs pa yin gyi /
translated: It is obscured.

original: mthong ba yang de bro nas skye ba'i phyir mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni phan tshun spangs pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba yang de bro nas skye ba'i phyir mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni phan tshun spangs pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is shown that the seeing is the same as the previous one, because it arises from it, by ‚Äúthrough mutual exclusion.‚Äù

original: de nyid 'di'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i snang ba gcig tu byed la /
analyzed: de nyid 'di'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i snang ba gcig tu byed la /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the same as that‚Äù makes the appearance of the previous and the later one into one.

original: de la sngar mthong ba dang / mthong bar bya ba yang 'das pa yin la 'das pa la de ltar rtogs pa ni mi rigs te 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sngar mthong ba dang / mthong bar bya ba yang 'das pa yin la 'das pa la de ltar rtogs pa ni mi rigs te 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that regard, the previously seen and the object of seeing are also past, and it is not reasonable to realize the past in that way, because of being past.

original: de bzhin du da ltar ba yang gegs bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir tha dad par go bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar ba yang gegs bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir tha dad par go bar mi nus so //
translated: Similarly, the present cannot be understood as distinct because it cannot be obstructed.

original: 'di las de tha dad par ma mthong ba 'di nge las tha dad par mthong ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di las de tha dad par ma mthong ba 'di nge las tha dad par mthong ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that this is not seen as distinct from that is not seen as distinct from that is:

original: tha dad dngos po de zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad dngos po de zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The entity that is distinct is called that.

original: mthong du rung ba dang mthong ba yang ngo //
analyzed: mthong du rung ba dang mthong ba yang ngo //
translated: It is suitable to be seen and is seen.

original: des zhes bya ba ni snga mas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni snga mas so //
translated: By that, it is said that the previous one is not seen as distinct from that.

original: mi mthun pa'i skad cig ma mi skye ba yang la lar skye na yang /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i skad cig ma mi skye ba yang la lar skye na yang /
translated: Even if an incompatible moment does not arise, or if it arises somewhere,

original: la lar don gyi rgyu la mi rtag pa nyid du rtog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: la lar don gyi rgyu la mi rtag pa nyid du rtog pa ma yin nam /
translated: is it not conceived that the cause of the object is impermanent?

original: rdo rje pha lam la sogs pa la 'dra ba gzhan mthong ba'i phyir nye bar mi mtshon par rigs la /
analyzed: rdo rje pha lam la sogs pa la 'dra ba gzhan mthong ba'i phyir nye bar mi mtshon par rigs la /
translated: Because of seeing another similarity in diamond and so on, it is reasonable to not indicate it.

original: gzhan du @57a * //
analyzed: gzhan du @57a * //
translated: Otherwise,

original: mi 'dra ba byung ba na gcig kyang gzhan du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba byung ba na gcig kyang gzhan du 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If there were a difference, then even one would become another.

original: mi 'dra ba ma byung yang de mthong bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba ma byung yang de mthong bar bstan pa ni /
translated: But even though there is no difference, it is seen as such.

original: ji ltar rtags med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtags med ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is shown by the words, ‚ÄúHow could there be a sign?‚Äù

original: phyis 'byung ba dang 'brel pa med pa snga ma gang gi yin pa de phyis 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba dang 'brel pa med pa snga ma gang gi yin pa de phyis 'byung ba yin no //
translated: That which is related to what occurs later is prior to that, which occurs later.

original: ci las she na mar dang sdod bu la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la yang dang po bzhin du ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci las she na mar dang sdod bu la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la yang dang po bzhin du ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? Because the collection of oil and cotton, etc. is dependent, as before.

original: de ltar bstan pa ni sgron ma la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa ni sgron ma la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is shown by the words, ‚ÄúThe lamp, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThat which is related to what occurs later is the final moment.

original: 'brel pa med pa phyis 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni mtha'i skad cig ma'o zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa phyis 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni mtha'i skad cig ma'o zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o //
translated: This is according to some.

original: de ni la lar de yongs mi shes te zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi tshig gis rtogs pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni la lar de yongs mi shes te zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi tshig gis rtogs pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the word ‚Äúsometimes‚Äù in the verse.

original: sgron ma dus gzhan gnas pa skad cig ma dang po nyid la skyed par kong bu dang sdong bu la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la rjes su dpag pa don med par bstan nas /
analyzed: sgron ma dus gzhan gnas pa skad cig ma dang po nyid la skyed par kong bu dang sdong bu la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la rjes su dpag pa don med par bstan nas /
translated: Having shown that it is pointless to infer that the lamp is produced in the first moment of its existence from the collection of the lamp-bowl, wick, etc.,

original: mi la sogs pa yang skad cig ma dang po nyid la bdag nyid thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa don med par bstan pa ni /üîΩde bzhin du gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi la sogs pa yang skad cig ma dang po nyid la bdag nyid thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa don med par bstan pa ni / de bzhin du gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he shows that it is pointless to infer that a man, etc. is produced in the first moment of his existence from the collection of his parents, etc.

original: de dus gzhan du gnas pa yang yin la 'dzin pa yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dus gzhan du gnas pa yang yin la 'dzin pa yang yin pa'o //
translated: In the same way, if he were to exist at another time, he would also be apprehended.üîΩHe would be apprehended means that he would be apprehended by the cognition that perceives him.

original: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan mthong bar ltos pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan mthong bar ltos pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: The apprehension is a conceptual cognition that depends on the perception of another and another.

original: rtog pa gnyis pa la bstan pa ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtog pa gnyis pa la bstan pa ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second moment is shown in the line:üîΩSimultaneously, he would be apprehended.

original: cig car kho na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig kho na la rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cig car kho na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig kho na la rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word simultaneously means that he would be apprehended in a single moment.

original: dus ring zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan dang gzhan du rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dus ring zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan dang gzhan du rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: The word long means that he would be apprehended at another time and another time.

original: dngos po las tha mi dad pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dngos po bzhin du 'dzin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po las tha mi dad pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dngos po bzhin du 'dzin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt impermanence, which is not different from a thing, grasped just like the thing?

original: de lta yin na ni rtsod pa med do snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni rtsod pa med do snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If that is so, there is no dispute.

original: dngos po las tha mi dad par yang nus pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos su gyur pa ni de 'dzin pas gzung ba la yang rmongs pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po las tha mi dad par yang nus pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos su gyur pa ni de 'dzin pas gzung ba la yang rmongs pa med do //
translated: But even though impermanence is not different from a thing, the characteristic of impermanence is grasped by the apprehension of that thing, and there is no confusion about that.

original: 'bras bu ni mtha'i skad cig mthong ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mtha'i skad cig mthong ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The effect is not seen in the final moment,

original: ma mthong ba ci las yin zhen de ma thag med pa'i ste bar du chod pas so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ci las yin zhen de ma thag med pa'i ste bar du chod pas so //
translated: because it is not seen. What is it? It is the absence of the immediately preceding condition, because it is interrupted.

original: gang gi phyir mi 'dra ba'i rgyu rnams thams cad du 'di las nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi 'dra ba'i rgyu rnams thams cad du 'di las nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Because dissimilar causes do not exist here at all.

original: mtha'i skad cig mthong ba na mi rtag pa nyid ji lta ba kho nar snang yang ci'i phyir nges pa med ces zer ba la nges gsal med pa'i phyir ro ste ma goms pas nye bar ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha'i skad cig mthong ba na mi rtag pa nyid ji lta ba kho nar snang yang ci'i phyir nges pa med ces zer ba la nges gsal med pa'i phyir ro ste ma goms pas nye bar ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when the final moment is seen, impermanence appears just as it is. Why is there no ascertainment? Because there is no clear ascertainment, because it is not familiar, because it is not well-defined.

original: 'grel par ni dpe nyid kyi @57b sgo nas 'bras bu'i nus pa gsungs pa yin no zhes 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'grel par ni dpe nyid kyi @57b sgo nas 'bras bu'i nus pa gsungs pa yin no zhes 'chad pa ni /
translated: The Commentary explains that the example itself teaches the potency of the effect.

original: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example,

original: de nyid ni rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rmongs pa'o //
translated: is confused.

original: bzlog pa'i ched du yod pa'i phyir skad cig pa yin no zhes rnges su dpag pa brjod pa yin gyi de'i ngo bo bsgrub pa'i ched du ma yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i ched du yod pa'i phyir skad cig pa yin no zhes rnges su dpag pa brjod pa yin gyi de'i ngo bo bsgrub pa'i ched du ma yin no //
translated: For the sake of refuting that, it is inferred that it is momentary. But it is not for the sake of establishing its nature.

original: dngos po grub pa kho nas de nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po grub pa kho nas de nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established just by the establishment of the thing.

original: goms pa las de de'i mtshon pa po rnams ni mtha'i skad cig ma mthong ba med kyang mthong ba nyid las nges par byed par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: goms pa las de de'i mtshon pa po rnams ni mtha'i skad cig ma mthong ba med kyang mthong ba nyid las nges par byed par bstan pa ni /
translated: From familiarity, those who are its representatives, even without seeing the final moment, ascertain it from seeing it. This is taught:

original: rnam pa thams cad nges par byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad nges par byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt ascertains all aspects.‚Äù

original: de thams cad kyang yin la rnam pa yang yin pas rnam pa de dag mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang bdag med pa dang stong pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang yin la rnam pa yang yin pas rnam pa de dag mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang bdag med pa dang stong pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Since it is all and it is an aspect, those aspects are impermanent, suffering, selfless, and empty in nature.

original: rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa zhes 'don pa la yang nus pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnam pa du ma dang ldan ba la phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa zhes 'don pa la yang nus pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnam pa du ma dang ldan ba la phyir skyon med do //
translated: Also, in the reading ‚Äúendowed with all aspects,‚Äù there is no fault in the sense of being endowed with many aspects such as potency and impermanence.

original: blo'i chen po nyid kyang goms pa las gsal ba nyid do //üîΩyod pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang bral ba'i don la ni khyad par la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa brtags pa'i yul can ma yin nam /
analyzed: blo'i chen po nyid kyang goms pa las gsal ba nyid do // yod pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang bral ba'i don la ni khyad par la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa brtags pa'i yul can ma yin nam /
translated: Also, the greatness of the mind is just the clarity that comes from practice.üîΩBut is it not the case that inference, which has as its object the examination of a difference based on a difference in meaning that is free from the differentiation of existence, impermanence, and so on, is not the object of the desire to quickly establish something, because it is easy to find in everything?

original: myur bar sgrub par byed par 'dod pa las byung ba'i rtog pa ni thams cad rnyed par sla ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la thams cad las ni ldog pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: myur bar sgrub par byed par 'dod pa las byung ba'i rtog pa ni thams cad rnyed par sla ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la thams cad las ni ldog pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thinking this, he says, ‚ÄúFrom all that is different,‚Äù and so on.

original: de dang de las ldog pa'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan gyi blo du ma de dang de'i chos can du ston par byed cing rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dang de las ldog pa'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan gyi blo du ma de dang de'i chos can du ston par byed cing rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The mind that has as its reason the thing that is different from this and that, and that demonstrates this and that property possessor, is what engages inference.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa tsam las byung ba rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa tsam las byung ba rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The same is true of the other sense-cognitions.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.

original: tha dad rten can bzhin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa tha dad pa can bzhin no zhes bya bas bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: tha dad rten can bzhin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa tha dad pa can bzhin no zhes bya bas bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dbye ba bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.

original: sgra rnams kyang brda yod na khyad par 'di kho na rjod par byed par bstan pa ni /üîΩci ltar brdar btags pa ni ji ltar bskul ba'o //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyang brda yod na khyad par 'di kho na rjod par byed par bstan pa ni / ci ltar brdar btags pa ni ji ltar bskul ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.

original: rtags dang bde ba la sogs par snang ba'i yul la ni rang bzhin gyis med kyang de las bzlog par snad ba med pa ni /üîΩnye bar mtshan pa med pa yang tshad ma'i rtogs par byed pa mi srid do snyam du sems pa la 'khrul rgyu med na de yis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtags dang bde ba la sogs par snang ba'i yul la ni rang bzhin gyis med kyang de las bzlog par snad ba med pa ni / nye bar mtshan pa med pa yang tshad ma'i rtogs par byed pa mi srid do snyam du sems pa la 'khrul rgyu med na de yis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.

original: goms pas gsal ba nyid la sogs pas glo bur du byung ba can rnams la 'khrul pa'i sa bon med na /
analyzed: goms pas gsal ba nyid la sogs pas glo bur du byung ba can rnams la 'khrul pa'i sa bon med na /
translated: The word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù in the line ‚Äúlike those with different bases‚Äù indicates that the cognitions have different objects.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i snang ba yod par skyed par byed pa ni mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i snang ba yod par skyed par byed pa ni mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: The production of the appearance of impermanence, suffering, etc. is the connecting.

original: @58a * // de'am gzhan la rtogs par byed pa ni rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: @58a * // de'am gzhan la rtogs par byed pa ni rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: The understanding of that or another by inference.

original: 'grel par yang 'di bzhin du go bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'grel par yang 'di bzhin du go bar bya'o //
translated: And the commentary should be understood in this way.

original: skye ba can zhes bya ba ni skye ba len pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba can zhes bya ba ni skye ba len pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving birth‚Äù means taking birth.

original: sngar mthong ba zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa'i shes pas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa'i shes pas mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously seen‚Äù means seen by momentary cognition.

original: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni brjed pa las so//
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni brjed pa las so//
translated: ‚ÄúAs it is‚Äù means from forgetting.

original: 'di la 'khrul pa'i sa bon med pa ni rjes su dpag pa las de bzhin du gyur pa gzhan gyis rab tu sbyar pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul pa'i sa bon med pa ni rjes su dpag pa las de bzhin du gyur pa gzhan gyis rab tu sbyar pa yin la /
translated: Here, the seed of error is not applied by another in the same way by inference.

original: gzhan gyi yang gzhan las so zhes thogs pa med pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yang gzhan las so zhes thogs pa med pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: And the other‚Äôs is from another, so there is no fault because there is no obstruction.

original: tshad ma'i bya ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la snga ma snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma'i tshig 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: tshad ma'i bya ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la snga ma snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma'i tshig 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The meaning is that the words of the later are produced from the earlier in the supreme grasping of the function of valid cognition.

original: yang na snga ma snga ma rjes su tshol ba med kyang kho bo cag la sogs pa nyid kyis ma dmigs pas mi rtag pa nyid grub par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yang na snga ma snga ma rjes su tshol ba med kyang kho bo cag la sogs pa nyid kyis ma dmigs pas mi rtag pa nyid grub par bstan pa ni /
translated: Or else, even without the prior investigation of the prior state, impermanence is established by our non-apprehension of it, etc.

original: yang na 'dir yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dir yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or else, here also means

original: kho bo cag gi gnas skabs la yang ngo //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi gnas skabs la yang ngo //
translated: in our situation.

original: ji ltar zhe na sngar byung zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na sngar byung zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How? Prior to its occurrence means

original: mtha' gnyi ga'i mi 'byung ba bar du byung ba'i dngos po ni mi rtag pa yin gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha' gnyi ga'i mi 'byung ba bar du byung ba'i dngos po ni mi rtag pa yin gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that a thing that occurs in between, not occurring in either of the two extremes, is impermanent.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: dngos po sngar dang phyis kyang yod par khas len pa 'di ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba kha cig gi yin par bstan pa ni gzhan dag smra ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po sngar dang phyis kyang yod par khas len pa 'di ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba kha cig gi yin par bstan pa ni gzhan dag smra ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the assertion of others, that is, of some, that a thing is accepted as existing prior to and subsequent to its occurrence.

original: byung ba tsam gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa tsam gyis mi rtag pa nyid du smra ba la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: byung ba tsam gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa tsam gyis mi rtag pa nyid du smra ba la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: It is not by mere occurrence means that is not the same as the assertion of impermanence by mere existence, is it?

original: gang phyir 'di yang sngar dang phyis kyang nub pa kho nas mi rtag pa nyid do zer na rgyu med pa nyid kyis dam pa'i de kho na nyid kyi snang ba tshe dang ldan pa la ji ltar yin /
analyzed: gang phyir 'di yang sngar dang phyis kyang nub pa kho nas mi rtag pa nyid do zer na rgyu med pa nyid kyis dam pa'i de kho na nyid kyi snang ba tshe dang ldan pa la ji ltar yin /
translated: If you say that it is impermanent because it is only extinguished later, then how could the vision of the reality of the holy ones be so, due to the absence of a cause?

original: med pa'i dus na dngos po med cing /
analyzed: med pa'i dus na dngos po med cing /
translated: When it does not exist, it is not a thing.

original: yod pa'i dus na yang de dag ma yin na de dag gi ji ltar yin /
analyzed: yod pa'i dus na yang de dag ma yin na de dag gi ji ltar yin /
translated: And when it exists, it is not those. So how could it be so?

original: mi rtag pa nyid dam yod pa nyid dam de dang 'brel pa ni gnyis po de'i bar du gcod par byed pa dag / dngos po'i dus su 'byung ba yang dngos po la 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dam yod pa nyid dam de dang 'brel pa ni gnyis po de'i bar du gcod par byed pa dag / dngos po'i dus su 'byung ba yang dngos po la 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The impermanence or existence or connection with those is interrupted by those two. It is thought that it would occur at the time of the thing and would be a thing.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says, ‚ÄúWhose?‚Äù

original: mtha' gnyis ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag gi'o //
translated: The two extremes are nonexistence before and nonexistence after.

original: chos pa ni bar du gcod par byed pa yod pa'am de dang 'brel pa yang rung ba mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos pa ni bar du gcod par byed pa yod pa'am de dang 'brel pa yang rung ba mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: Impermanence is the interruption of a thing that exists or is connected with it.

original: des ni smra ba bos brjod pa ste sems pa'o //
analyzed: des ni smra ba bos brjod pa ste sems pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the opponent‚Äôs position. It is the thought.

original: yod pa de dang 'brel pa'i dus sum byung na med pa dag ji ltar de dag gi khyad par yin yang blos byas pa'i khyad par du yod pa na @58b yang cis mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa de dang 'brel pa'i dus sum byung na med pa dag ji ltar de dag gi khyad par yin yang blos byas pa'i khyad par du yod pa na @58b yang cis mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If non-existence occurs at the time of the connection with existence, how can non-existence be the distinction of those?

original: de nyid mi rtag cis ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid mi rtag cis ma yin //
translated: And if it exists as a distinction made by the mind, why is it not so?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated in the line:üîΩHow is it not impermanent?

original: med pa dag dang dus tha dad pa'i dngos po 'brel pa med pas drug pa la sogs par mi rigs na /
analyzed: med pa dag dang dus tha dad pa'i dngos po 'brel pa med pas drug pa la sogs par mi rigs na /
translated: If things that are different from non-existence are not connected with non-existence, it is not tenable that they are the sixth, etc.

original: mtha' mngon par 'dod pa dag la yang yod pa bar du gcod par byed pa'am /
analyzed: mtha' mngon par 'dod pa dag la yang yod pa bar du gcod par byed pa'am /
translated: But if you assert that they have an end, then existence would be an obstruction to them,üîΩor the sixth, etc. would be connected with them. How is this? This is indicated in the line:

original: 'brel pa la yang drug pa la sogs pas sbyor ba ji ltar yin pa bstan pa ni mtha' la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa la yang drug pa la sogs pas sbyor ba ji ltar yin pa bstan pa ni mtha' la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWith respect to the end.‚Äù

original: mtha' gang dag la yod pa dang 'brel pa dag gi bar du gcod par byed pa de dag gang gi yin /
analyzed: mtha' gang dag la yod pa dang 'brel pa dag gi bar du gcod par byed pa de dag gang gi yin /
translated: To what do those that obstruct the existence of those that have an end belong?

original: yod pa dang 'brel pa dag gi ni ma yin te rgyug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang 'brel pa dag gi ni ma yin te rgyug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not belong to those that are connected with existence, because they are nonexistent.

original: dngos po'i yang ma yin te dus tha dad pa nyid kyis 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni yod pa nyid dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i yang ma yin te dus tha dad pa nyid kyis 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni yod pa nyid dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Nor is it a real entity, because there is no relationship due to the difference in time. This is indicated by the words ‚Äúthe relationship of existence.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa med pas zhes bya ba ni dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsnga na med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid 'bras bus stong pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pas zhes bya ba ni dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro // snga na med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid 'bras bus stong pa ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-difference‚Äù means non-division.üîΩ‚ÄúNon-existence prior to‚Äù means that the cause is not empty of the effect.

original: zhig nas med pa yang 'bras bu rgyus stong pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: zhig nas med pa yang 'bras bu rgyus stong pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existence after destruction‚Äù means that the effect is not empty of the cause.üîΩIf you think this, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: gal te rgyu 'bras zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rgyu 'bras zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If the effect is not in the assemblage, how could it arise from the assemblage?

original: med pa bzhin du 'bras bu dang rgyu dag kyang yod pa'i dus kyi dngos po dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir snga na med pa ni dngos po'i ma yin zhes nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir zhig nas med pa zhes bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: med pa bzhin du 'bras bu dang rgyu dag kyang yod pa'i dus kyi dngos po dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir snga na med pa ni dngos po'i ma yin zhes nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir zhig nas med pa zhes bya ba yang yin no //
translated: Just as the effect is not related to the entity that exists at the time of the cause, in the same way, the effect is not related to the entity that existed prior to the cause, because it does not exist. Therefore, ‚Äúnon-existence prior to‚Äù is a term that illustrates ‚Äúnon-existence of a real entity.‚Äù ‚ÄúNon-existence after destruction‚Äù is also like this.

original: ma yin par dgag pa yang dgag pa'i khyad par gyi ming can ni 'bras bu'am rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa yang dgag pa'i khyad par gyi ming can ni 'bras bu'am rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the negation of non-existence is a term that indicates a particular negation, namely, the effect or the cause.

original: dgag pa dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgag pa dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not free from negation.

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i phyogs las 'bras bu dang rgyu ni mtha' gnyis kyi phyogs te phyogs gzhan no de'i nyams pa ni de nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i phyogs las 'bras bu dang rgyu ni mtha' gnyis kyi phyogs te phyogs gzhan no de'i nyams pa ni de nyams pa yin te /
translated: The effect and cause in terms of the position of prior non-existence and post-disintegration non-existence are the two extremes, i.e., other positions. Their impairment is their impairment.

original: med pa khas blangs pa'i longs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: med pa khas blangs pa'i longs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because of the acceptance of non-existence, it is said that it is not tenable.

original: phyogs gzhan la brten par yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan la brten par yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is also based on other positions.

original: kha cig gi bshad pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: kha cig gi bshad pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of some is stated:

original: 'dis ni snga na med pa'i khyad par can yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni snga na med pa'i khyad par can yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the distinction of prior non-existence.

original: snga na med pa'i khyad par can ni rgyu ma yin gyi 'on kyang yod pa dang 'brel ba'i 'du ba ni 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: snga na med pa'i khyad par can ni rgyu ma yin gyi 'on kyang yod pa dang 'brel ba'i 'du ba ni 'bras bu'am /
translated: The distinction of prior non-existence is not the cause, but rather the connection with existence is the effect, or

original: rang gi rgyu'am 'du ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu la der byed na rgyun brjod do zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'am 'du ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu la der byed na rgyun brjod do zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: the cause of the connection from one's own cause. If the effect is made there, the continuum is stated. This is taught:

original: yod pa nyid dang rang rgyud dang // zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang rang rgyud dang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Existence itself and one's own continuum.

original: re zhig dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo byed pa ma yin te /
translated: First, the nature of an entity is not a cause,

original: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not accepted.

original: yod pa dang 'du ba dag kyang rtag @59a * //üîΩpa yin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang 'du ba dag kyang rtag @59a * // pa yin te /
translated: And existence and conjunction are permanent,üîΩbecause they are not causes,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is that they do not have an effect.

original: 'bras bu skye bzhin ba'am skyes pa'i 'bras bu rang gi rgyu la 'brel par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gzhung gnyis bsdu ba'i phyir phal cher zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye bzhin ba'am skyes pa'i 'bras bu rang gi rgyu la 'brel par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gzhung gnyis bsdu ba'i phyir phal cher zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the effect that is in the process of arising or has arisen is related to its cause, the phrase ‚Äúfor the most part‚Äù is used to include the two passages.

original: gang zhig med pa de byed do zhes bya ba ni rim pa yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig med pa de byed do zhes bya ba ni rim pa yin la /
translated: The order is that which is nonexistent causes.

original: 'di khyed kyi 'dod pa la ni ma yin zhes bstan pa ni gang zhig med pa des byed na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di khyed kyi 'dod pa la ni ma yin zhes bstan pa ni gang zhig med pa des byed na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But this is not the case for your assertion, as is shown by the phrase ‚Äúif that which is nonexistent causes.

original: log pa'i dngos po nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni sngar med pa kho na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: log pa'i dngos po nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni sngar med pa kho na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù The phrase ‚Äúonly that which did not previously exist‚Äù shows that it is only a nonexistent entity.

original: de lta mod kyi dngos po'i dus na med pa snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag dngos po mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi dngos po'i dus na med pa snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag dngos po mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /
translated: Even so, non-existence at the time of the thing, prior non-existence and subsequent non-existence are taught to be the impermanence of the thing.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste sgro 'dogs pa ni don la reg pa dang bral ba'i blo dag ni tha dad pa med pa'i don rnams la yang sgra rnams su brjod bya tha dad par byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste sgro 'dogs pa ni don la reg pa dang bral ba'i blo dag ni tha dad pa med pa'i don rnams la yang sgra rnams su brjod bya tha dad par byed /
translated: Therefore, means that the intellects which are devoid of contact with the object superimpose difference on objects which are not different, and they make the words,

original: sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: sbyor bar byed /
translated: apply them,üîΩand connect them.

original: 'brel par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ya nga gi sgras don tha dad par 'dod pa rnams la rtogs pas sbyar ba 'brel pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ya nga gi sgras don tha dad par 'dod pa rnams la rtogs pas sbyar ba 'brel pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúalas‚Äù teaches that the connection is the application of the understanding to those who assert the difference of the objects.

original: gal te dngos po la yod dngos po zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gal te dngos po la yod dngos po zhes bya ba nas /
translated: If one says that the existent thing is the thing,

original: don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the ultimate is not.

original: de 'di ltar yin gyi mtshams sbyor ba'i kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa nyid sbyar ba de'i phyir / gzhal bya gzhan med do zhes nye bar sdud pa ni /
analyzed: de 'di ltar yin gyi mtshams sbyor ba'i kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa nyid sbyar ba de'i phyir / gzhal bya gzhan med do zhes nye bar sdud pa ni /
translated: Since it is like this, impermanence is applied to the color of the connection, and therefore, there is no other object of comprehension.

original: des na kha dog gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na kha dog gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthe color, etc.‚Äù

original: tshad ma'i rjes su byung ba de nyid 'di yin no zhes rjes su 'brangs pa spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyi yul can ni tshang ma gzhan no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: tshad ma'i rjes su byung ba de nyid 'di yin no zhes rjes su 'brangs pa spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyi yul can ni tshang ma gzhan no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The cognition that arises from the valid cognition is the same as that, and the other valid cognition is the cognition that has a universal and particular for its object.

original: yang nas yang du zhes bya ba ste tshad mas mthong ba la slar yang ngo shes pa ni tshad ma snga ma dang yul la khyad par med pa yin te /
analyzed: yang nas yang du zhes bya ba ste tshad mas mthong ba la slar yang ngo shes pa ni tshad ma snga ma dang yul la khyad par med pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúAgain and again‚Äù means that the recognition of what has been seen by the valid cognition is not different from the previous valid cognition and its object.

original: de dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the same as the one that has been established and experienced.

original: bgrod bya ma yin pa sgyug mo la sogs pa la bgrod pa ni skad cig ma'i rgyun la ltos nas yin gyi skad cig ma gcig gi yul ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bgrod bya ma yin pa sgyug mo la sogs pa la bgrod pa ni skad cig ma'i rgyun la ltos nas yin gyi skad cig ma gcig gi yul ni ma yin te /
translated: The intercourse with a mother-in-law, etc., which is not to be done, is in relation to a continuum of moments, but not in relation to a single moment.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun la gcig tu tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa la bgrod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun la gcig tu tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa la bgrod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúintercourse with a mother-in-law, etc., which is not to be done‚Äù is that the designation of a single cause and effect is in relation to a continuum.

original: de 'di ltar mngon sum gyi rjes su byung ba'i zhen pa dad rjes su dpag pa la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: de 'di ltar mngon sum gyi rjes su byung ba'i zhen pa dad rjes su dpag pa la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the object of memory is not a separate object of cognition, because it is a memory that arises from the direct perception of an object, and because it is a memory that arises from the inference of an object.

original: tha snyad tsam yin te yid las byung ba'i @59b spyi tsam gyi yul yin pa de'i phyir gzhal bya gzhan ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad tsam yin te yid las byung ba'i @59b spyi tsam gyi yul yin pa de'i phyir gzhal bya gzhan ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is a mere convention, because it is an object that is a mere universal that arises from the mind.

original: mthong nas slar log pa shing la sogs pas bar du chod pa na ci da dung yang yod dam zhes the tshom za bas de nyid rjes su dpog par byed kyi de dang 'dra ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong nas slar log pa shing la sogs pas bar du chod pa na ci da dung yang yod dam zhes the tshom za bas de nyid rjes su dpog par byed kyi de dang 'dra ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: Having seen it, when one turns away and an object such as a tree obstructs the view, one wonders, ‚ÄúIs it still there?‚Äù and infers that very object, not a similar object.

original: de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: This is an inference arising from the sense faculties.

original: spyi'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: spyi'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: It is not a separate valid cognition, because it is not an object of a universal.üîΩThe response to that is:

original: skad cig so sor tha dad phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig so sor tha dad phyir // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because they are different in every moment,

original: mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa yang nye ba'i 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa yang nye ba'i 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Direct perception and inference reveal the object of engagement that is near.

original: sngar mthong ba nye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba nye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that what was previously seen is nearby.

original: nye ba'i yul can yin yang mngon sum ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nye ba'i yul can yin yang mngon sum ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it the case that even though the object is nearby, it is not direct perception?

original: dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir la de la phyir de nyid tshad ma gzhan yin te /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir la de la phyir de nyid tshad ma gzhan yin te /
translated: Because it is not produced from the sense faculty, and that is itself another valid cognition,

original: rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: because it is inference.

original: khyad par yul can nyid kyang min //
analyzed: khyad par yul can nyid kyang min //
translated: It is not even the apprehender of the specific object.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'brel ba 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba'i thun mong la nye ba yin par 'jog par byed la /
analyzed: 'brel ba 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba'i thun mong la nye ba yin par 'jog par byed la /
translated: When apprehending the connection, it is posited as seeing the common nearby object.

original: de yang spyi'i yul nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang spyi'i yul nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that is not the object of the universal, this is the meaning.

original: khyad par mthong ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba kho na khyad par yul nyid byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba kho na khyad par yul nyid byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't seeing the specific object just the specific object when seeing at the time of apprehending the connection?

original: de dang 'dra ba ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: It is not similar to that, I think.

original: gal te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If it is said,

original: de nyid ni rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid ni rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid de /
translated: that itself is what is to be inferred.

original: mngon sum 'jug pa'i yul du 'byung ba gal te rjes su dpag par bya ba yin na rjes su dpag par bya ba yin na rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum 'jug pa'i yul du 'byung ba gal te rjes su dpag par bya ba yin na rjes su dpag par bya ba yin na rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: If the object that appears to perception were an inference, then inference would not be a means of valid cognition,

original: gzung ba la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it would apprehend what has already been apprehended.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su 'byung ba la ni 'dra ba'i yul can nyid du brjod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su 'byung ba la ni 'dra ba'i yul can nyid du brjod par bstan pa ni /
translated: As for the object that appears at the time of inference, it is said to be similar to the object of perception.

original: ji ste mthong pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ste mthong pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught in the line: ‚ÄúIf it is seen, it is not an inference.‚Äù

original: gal te brjed phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba brjed pa la rjes su dpag pa rtogs pa'i don can ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te brjed phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba brjed pa la rjes su dpag pa rtogs pa'i don can ma yin no //
translated: If it is forgotten, it is not an inference. This means that if the object seen by perception is forgotten, inference does not cognize it.

original: brjed pa nyid la dpe med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: brjed pa nyid la dpe med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Because there is no example of forgetting, it is taught that it is not an inference.

original: de nyid phyir na zhes bya ba ni khyad par so sor nges pa ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na zhes bya ba ni khyad par so sor nges pa ma yin na'o //
translated: The line ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Äù means that if there is no specific determination of the difference between the two, then inference is not a means of valid cognition.

original: 'du byed pa ma nyams pa'i mngon sum yin na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: 'du byed pa ma nyams pa'i mngon sum yin na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: If the object of perception is not impaired, then inference is not a means of valid cognition.

original: 'du byed pa nyams pa la ni yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'du byed pa nyams pa la ni yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: But if the memory is impaired, it is not.

original: dran pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas tshad ma nyid yin pa bzhin no zhes bar du'o //
analyzed: dran pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas tshad ma nyid yin pa bzhin no zhes bar du'o //
translated: If there is memory, etc., up to: it is a valid cognition, just like the natural inference.

original: ma yin te de la ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ma yin te de la ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: No, it is not, because in that case, etc. This is a natural inference.

original: @60a * // 'dir ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni khyad par mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: @60a * // 'dir ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni khyad par mthong ba la'o //
translated: But it is not so in this case, etc. This is a special case.

original: de lta zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa bzhin nam glo bur ba'i rjes su dpag pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de lta zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa bzhin nam glo bur ba'i rjes su dpag pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Just like, etc. This is like a natural inference or like a casual inference.

original: sngon de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i'o //
analyzed: sngon de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i'o //
translated: A previous one of the same kind, etc. This is a memory of a connection.

original: brjed pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir rang bzhin rjes su dpag pa ma yin la /üîΩglo bur ba'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin par bstan pa ni goms pas bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brjed pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir rang bzhin rjes su dpag pa ma yin la / glo bur ba'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin par bstan pa ni goms pas bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is not a natural inference, because it is not present when there is forgetfulness.üîΩIt is not a casual inference, as is shown by the words: produced by practice.

original: goms pas bskyed pa las zhes bya ba ni glo bur pa'i rjes su dpag pa la goms pa med do //
analyzed: goms pas bskyed pa las zhes bya ba ni glo bur pa'i rjes su dpag pa la goms pa med do //
translated: Produced by practice, etc. There is no practice of a casual inference.

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur pa srid phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brjed pa'i phyir dang rjes su dpag pa ni rtog pa'i don can yin par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur pa srid phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brjed pa'i phyir dang rjes su dpag pa ni rtog pa'i don can yin par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that the form will change.

original: ma brjed na rjes su dpag pa spyi'i yul can kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ma brjed na rjes su dpag pa spyi'i yul can kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If one does not forget, it is shown that inference has only a general object:

original: mngon sum gyi tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: by the valid knowledge of perception.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: If, etc. is the philosophical position.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni skyes bzhin pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni skyes bzhin pa la'o //
translated: There, etc. refers to that which is in the process of arising.

original: skyes dngos dngos po grub pa zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba'i dngos po grub pa'o //
analyzed: skyes dngos dngos po grub pa zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba'i dngos po grub pa'o //
translated: The arisen thing, the established thing, etc. refers to the previously seen established thing.

original: gzhan la de nyid du 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan la de nyid du 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The error of apprehending that as the same in another is shown:

original: gal te mthong na de dngos ni //
analyzed: gal te mthong na de dngos ni //
translated: If it is seen, that thing

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is established by perception.

original: mngon sum gyi grub pa kho na'am khyad par mthong ba las grub pa la ni tshad ma nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi grub pa kho na'am khyad par mthong ba las grub pa la ni tshad ma nyid ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not a valid cognition if it is established only by perception or by seeing a particular.

original: gzung ba la 'dzin pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzung ba la 'dzin pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is shown that it is the apprehension of the apprehended:

original: des grub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: des grub ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is established by that‚Äù means it is established by perception.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni ma mthong ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni ma mthong ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained: ‚ÄúIf it is not seen‚Äù means if it is not perceived.

original: gal te ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: gal te ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not apprehended,‚Äù this means it is not apprehended by perception.

original: ji ste rjes su dpag pa dngos po 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba nyid khyad par mthong bas 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste rjes su dpag pa dngos po 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba nyid khyad par mthong bas 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúInference apprehends things,‚Äù this means that what is apprehended by perception is apprehended by seeing the difference.

original: mngon sum dang cig shos zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: mngon sum dang cig shos zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par bya ba dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúPerception and the other‚Äù means perception and inference.

original: gcig grub pa na zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi nang nas gcig kho na las grub par 'gyur bas chog mod //
analyzed: gcig grub pa na zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi nang nas gcig kho na las grub par 'gyur bas chog mod //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one is established‚Äù means if one of the two is established, that is sufficient.üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is the use of the other?‚Äù means what is the use of the other?

original: gnyis kyis ci zhig bya ba de la rag las pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni / mig la sogs pa'i byed pa'i byed pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ci zhig bya ba de la rag las pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni / mig la sogs pa'i byed pa'i byed pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it depends on that‚Äù means because it depends on the function of the eye and so on.

original: gang gi tshe snang ba yod pa de'i tshe yang 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes zer ba la 'o na snang ba de zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe snang ba yod pa de'i tshe yang 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes zer ba la 'o na snang ba de zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: When it is said, ‚ÄúEven when there is light, it is not apprehended,‚Äù it is said, ‚ÄúWell then, that light.‚Äù

original: de lta na de dag tshad ma dang cig shos gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na de dag tshad ma dang cig shos gang yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then are they valid cognitions or not?

original: gzhan dang mtshams ni sbyor ba'i zhes @60b bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang mtshams ni sbyor ba'i zhes @60b bya ba ste /
translated: The other is connected with the limit of the past.

original: sngar mthong ba dang lhan cig pa'i zhen pa ste /üîΩnges pa ni dran pa yin par brjod pa de'i phyir mngon sum tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba dang lhan cig pa'i zhen pa ste / nges pa ni dran pa yin par brjod pa de'i phyir mngon sum tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The attachment to what was seen in the past is memory.üîΩSince it is said that ascertainment is memory, therefore it is a valid direct perception.

original: dran pa nyid med par bsgrub pa la de rtags la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nyid med par bsgrub pa la de rtags la ltos pa ste /
translated: In order to establish that memory itself does not exist, it depends on a reason.

original: 'dra ba la sogs pa'i rtags la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba la sogs pa'i rtags la ltos pa'o //
translated: It depends on a reason such as similarity.

original: dran pa nyid kho na la yod pa'i phyir 'khrul ba can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa nyid kho na la yod pa'i phyir 'khrul ba can yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is mistaken because it exists only in memory,

original: ma yin 'khrul phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma yin 'khrul phyir zhes smos so //
translated: no, because it is mistaken.

original: 'grel pa ni gsal ba yin no //üîΩmngon sum rtog dang bral bar ni //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni gsal ba yin no // mngon sum rtog dang bral bar ni //
translated: The commentary is clear.üîΩDirect perception is free from conceptuality.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: It is established by direct perception itself.

original: zhes bya ba'i bshad pa mthong nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bshad pa mthong nas /
translated: Having seen this explanation,

original: bshad par bya ba'i mdo la 'jug par byed pa bstan pa ni de la mngon sum ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i mdo la 'jug par byed pa bstan pa ni de la mngon sum ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the introduction to the topic to be explained is presented with ‚ÄúAs for direct perception...‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan du snang ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du snang ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The other appearance is the opposite of that.

original: rtog pa las bral ba de'i ngo bo mngon sum nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dgag pa la khyad par med pa'i mi dmigs par 'dod la /
analyzed: rtog pa las bral ba de'i ngo bo mngon sum nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dgag pa la khyad par med pa'i mi dmigs par 'dod la /
translated: The nature of that which is free from conceptualization is established by direct perception.

original: tha dad pa dgag pa la ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par bstan pa ni /üîΩso so rang gi rig bya yin //
analyzed: tha dad pa dgag pa la ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par bstan pa ni / so so rang gi rig bya yin //
translated: The difference in the refutation of difference is taught by the intrinsic nature.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is to be known by each one individually.

original: ming ni sgra yin la rten can ni sgrar rung ba'i snang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ming ni sgra yin la rten can ni sgrar rung ba'i snang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Name is sound. The basis is the appearance that is suitable as sound.

original: rkyen gzhan tshang ba bstan pa ni //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan tshang ba bstan pa ni //
translated: The teaching of the completeness of other conditions is

original: thams cad la ni sems bsdus nas //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad la ni sems bsdus nas // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: having gathered the mind in all.

original: thams cad las ni yul thams cad las so //
analyzed: thams cad las ni yul thams cad las so //
translated: All means from all objects.

original: sems ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Mind is conceptualization.

original: g-yo ba med pa ni blo 'dar ba med pas te /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa ni blo 'dar ba med pas te /
translated: Non-movement is the absence of mental agitation.

original: rtog pa'i rlung dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rlung dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the wind of conceptualization.

original: rtog pa med na'ang yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rtog pa med na'ang yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it exists even when there is no conceptualization.

original: rtog pa med pa gzhan yin par brjod pa 'dis yin de'i phyir bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa gzhan yin par brjod pa 'dis yin de'i phyir bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the statement that the absence of conceptualization is something else.

original: de'i gnas skabs la rnam par rtog pa med pa ni mngon sum kho nas rtog pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs la rnam par rtog pa med pa ni mngon sum kho nas rtog pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the absence of conceptualization in that state is taught by direct perception alone is

original: mngon sum kho nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum kho nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúby direct perception alone.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs de la yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis rjes su 'jug pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnas skabs de la yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis rjes su 'jug pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there a form of conceptualization that operates in that state?

original: de med na de'i med med pa yang ji ltar nges pa yin /
analyzed: de med na de'i med med pa yang ji ltar nges pa yin /
translated: If it does not exist, how can the absence of that be ascertained?

original: nges pa ni rigs pa ma yin na khyad par med par med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni / gal te 'di la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni rigs pa ma yin na khyad par med par med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni / gal te 'di la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not ascertained, it is not reasonable to say that there is no difference between the two.üîΩIf you think this, the response is ‚ÄúIf it is said that . . .‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba ni rang gi yul la rang gi bya ba rjes su 'jug pa'i rtog pa'i skyed par byed cing de las snga rol du 'byung gi de dang mtshungs pa ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la yang cung zad rnam par rtog na
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni rang gi yul la rang gi bya ba rjes su 'jug pa'i rtog pa'i skyed par byed cing de las snga rol du 'byung gi de dang mtshungs pa ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la yang cung zad rnam par rtog na
translated: Isn‚Äôt the experience of the object the cause of the conceptualization that engages its object, and doesn‚Äôt it occur prior to that?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is ‚ÄúIt is not the case that . . .‚Äù

original: rtog @61a * //
analyzed: rtog @61a * //
translated: Conceptuality.üîΩüîΩ

original: pa can bzhin du rtog pa can ma yin pa yang rang gi ngo bor grub na rtog pa can skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: pa can bzhin du rtog pa can ma yin pa yang rang gi ngo bor grub na rtog pa can skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: If the non-conceptual were established as an entity, like the conceptual, it would generate conceptual cognition.

original: dbang po bzhin du skyed par byed pa nyid du rtog pa med pa can ni skyed par byed pa yin par mi rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po bzhin du skyed par byed pa nyid du rtog pa med pa can ni skyed par byed pa yin par mi rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If the non-conceptual were not established as an entity, like the sense faculty, it would not be understood to generate conceptual cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The non-conceptual also...

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba'i dus su'o //
translated: At that time means when free from conceptualization.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni nges pa dang ma nges par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni nges pa dang ma nges par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Due to the difference in characteristics means because of the appearance of the determined and the undetermined.

original: tshogs pa yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa la dran pas phan btags pa'i dbang po yin la gzhan la ni 'ba' zhig yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa la dran pas phan btags pa'i dbang po yin la gzhan la ni 'ba' zhig yin no //
translated: Because of the existence of the assemblage means that the sense faculty assisted by memory in generating conceptual cognition, but not in the other case.

original: da ni rjes su dpag pas yul tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid las kyang rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni rjes su dpag pas yul tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid las kyang rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, inference also teaches non-conceptual perception from the characteristic of having a different object.

original: gcig tu mthong ba'i khyad par ni zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'dis mngon sum gyi yul khyad par ni rnam par ni rnam par rtog pa'i rung ba ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu mthong ba'i khyad par ni zhes bya ba ste / 'dis mngon sum gyi yul khyad par ni rnam par ni rnam par rtog pa'i rung ba ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The difference in the perception of unity is as follows.üîΩThis shows that the object of direct perception is not suitable as the object of conceptual cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rung ba nyid kyang rung ba nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rung ba nyid kyang rung ba nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The fact that it is not suitable as the object of conceptual cognition is shown by the words:

original: de las min pa ni tha dad pa las so //
analyzed: de las min pa ni tha dad pa las so //
translated: Not from that, i.e., not from a different thing.

original: gzhan ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Another is not different.

original: gzhan snga ma yin pa la ltos nas snga ma kho na ste /
analyzed: gzhan snga ma yin pa la ltos nas snga ma kho na ste /
translated: In dependence on the other, i.e., the previous one, it is the previous one alone.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rnam shes las so //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rnam shes las so //
translated: The other is from consciousness.

original: tha dad blo med ces bya ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad blo med ces bya ba bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the absence of a different cognition is:

original: rnam pa gzhan snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because there is no appearance of another aspect.

original: rnam bar rtog pa ni khyad par gyi yul kho na la ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam bar rtog pa ni khyad par gyi yul kho na la ma yin te /
translated: Conceptual cognition does not have only a particular as its object,üîΩbecause it has a sound-equivalent as its object. This is shown by the words:

original: sgra dang mtshungs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni khyad par rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra dang mtshungs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni khyad par rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: With regard to the particulars.

original: ci las she na rjes su 'gro med pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci las she na rjes su 'gro med pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the reason? Because there is no concomitance.

original: sgra dang mtshungs pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa yin pa ci las she na rnam par rtog pa'i yul la sgra sbyor par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sgra dang mtshungs pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa yin pa ci las she na rnam par rtog pa'i yul la sgra sbyor par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
